div0.head: *h
div0.entryFree:
*hh, h)=ta (q.v.), to/, indecl., eighth (later seventh) letter of the Gr. alphabet; as numeral h/,= o)ktw/ and o)/gdoos, but h(NUM),= 8,000. In most local alphabets of v B.C. and earlier it represents
h, in others (incl. the Ion.= later general Gr. alphabet) one of the long
ē sounds (cf. bh= bh=). Described by E.Fr.382.5, Agatho 4.2.

h)/ (A), Ep. also h)e/ (in signf. A.11 h)/ (or h)e/) folld. by h)= (or h)=e), v. infr.), Conj. with two chief senses, Disj. (
or) and Comp. (
than). DISJUNCTIVE,
or, e)gw\ . . h)\ a)/llos *)axaiw=n Il.2.231, cf. 397,800, 4.142, 7.236, al.; qeo/sutos h)\ bro/teios h)\ kekrame/nh A.Pr.116. h)\ . . h)/
either . . or, h)\ nu=n dhqu/nont' h)\ u(/steron au)=tis i)o/nta Il.1.27, cf. 151, 5.484, etc.; so h)\ . . h)/toi . . Pi.N.6.4, Fr.138; h)/toi . . h)/ . . A.Ag.662, S. Ant.1182, Th.2.40, etc. (in Classical Gr. the alternative introduced by h)/toi is emphasized, later no distn. is implied, Ep.Rom.6.16; h)/toi . . h)\ . . h)/ . . PTeb.5.59(ii B.C.)); h)/ repeated any number of times, e)gw\ de/ ken au)to\s e(/lwmai h)\ teo\n h)\ *ai)/antos i)w\n ge/ras h)\ *)odush=os Il.1.138, cf. Od.15.84, S.Ant.707; h)/ is prob. wrongly accented in codd. of Il.2.289, Od.3.348, 19.109, v. h)= Adv.1.3: h)\ po/lis broto/s q' o(moi/ws A.Eu.524(lyr.) is exceptional.
or else, otherwise, ei)de/nai dei= peri\ ou(= a)\n h)=| h( boulh/, h)\ panto\s a(marta/nein a)na/gkh Pl.Phdr.237c; mh/ me lupei=te, h)\ feu/com' e)k th=s oi)ki/hs Herod.5.74; zw=nta kakw=s le/gein e)kw/luse . . , h)\ trei=s draxma\s a)poti/nein e)/tace Lex Sol. ap. Plu.Sol.21, cf. 24, IG12.94.10, Them.Or.21.260a. in Questions or Deliberations in Disj. form(the accentuation is h)\ （h)e/) folld. by h)= （h)=e), Hdn. Gr.2.24, al., A.D.Conj.224.28): Direct questions, introduced by h)\ （h)e/）, h)\ dolixh\ nou=sos h)= *)/artemis i)oxe/aira . . kate/pefnen; Od.11.172; h)/ ti kata\ prh=cin h)= mayidi/ws a)la/lhsqe . . ; 3.72, cf. 1.408, 16.462, Il.6.378, 15.735, 16.12, etc. without an introductory Particle, qeo/s nu/ tis h)= broto/s e)ssi; art thou a goddess
or a mortal? Od.6.149, cf. 1.226, 4.314,372,643, 20.130, 21.194, Il.10.63,425,534, 15.203: accented h)=, Hdn.Gr.2.145, al., but h)/ freq. in codd. of Hom. and always in codd. of later writers: h)/kousas h)\ ou)k h)/kousas h)\ kwfh=| le/gw; A.Th.202; a)/rti de\ h(/keis h)\ pa/lai; Pl.Cri.43a; kakourgei=n dei= h)\ ou)/; ib.49c; preceded by po/teron, po/teron dokei= soi ka/kion ei)=nai, to\ a)dikei=n h)\ to\ a)dikei=sqai; Id.Grg.474c, etc. Indirect questions, freq. epexegetic of a preceding question and identical in form with direct questions. ei)/p' a)/ge, . . h)/ r(' e)qe/lei . . , h)= a)pe/eipe . . Il.9.674; o)/fra daw=men h)\ e)teo\n *ka/lxas manteu/etai h)=e kai\ ou)ki/ 2.300; dia/ndixa mermh/ricen h)\ o(/ ge . . e)nari/zoi h)=e xo/lon pau/seien 1.190; later with ei) . . h)/ A.Ch.890,Ag.478, S.OC80, etc.; po/teron or po/tera . . h)/ . . Id.Pers.148, 352, Ag.630, etc.; sts. ei)/te . . h)/ E.El.897; h)\ . . ei)/te S.Aj. 177. without introductory Particle, ou)de/ ti oi)=da zw/ei o(/ g' h)= te/qnhke Od.11.464, cf. Il.10.546, Od.24.238. COMPARATIVE,
than, as, after a Comp., Il.11.162, etc.: after positive Adjs. which imply comparison, a)/llos, e(/teros h)/ . . , S.OT595, Tr.835(lyr.); e)nanti/os h)/ Pl.Grg.481c; i)/dio/n ti pa/sxein pa/qos h)\ oi( a)/lloi ibid.: after Advbs. or adverbial phrases, plh/n, pri/n, pro/sqen, xwri/s (qq. v.), a)lla/ (v. a)ll' h)/）; th=| u(sterai/a| h)/ . . Id.Cri.44a（f.l. in Smp.173a); e)n tw=| pe/mptw| kai\ deka/tw| ve/tei a)po\ tw= potexei= ve/teos h)\ *)aristi/wn e)foreu/ei Tab.Heracl.1.121; para\ do/can h)\ w(s au)to\s katedo/kee Hdt.1.79, cf. 8.4; diafero/ntws h)/ . . Pl.Phd.85b; ou)d' o(/son h)/ . . not so much
as . . , not more
than . . , Theoc.9.21: after Verbs implying comparison, bou/lesqai h)/ . . to wish
rather than . . , v. bou/lomai IV, ai(re/w B. 11.1b; so fqa/nein h)/ . . to come sooner
than . . , Il.23.445, Od.11.58; e)piqumei=n h)/ . . X.Cyr.1.4.3; de/xesqai h)/ . . Lys.10.21: less freq. after a word not implying comparison, di/kaion h(me/as e)/xein . . (sc. ma=llon） h)/ per *)aqhnai/ous Hdt.9.26; e)moi\ pikro\s . . h)\ kei/nois gluku/s S.Aj.966(s.v.l.); dedikaiwme/nos h)\ e)kei=nos Ev.Luc.18.14. joining two Comparatives which refer to the same subject, pa/ntes k' a)rhsai/at' e)lafro/teroi po/das ei)=nai h)\ a)fneio/teroi Od.1.165; taxu/tera h)\ sofw/tera Hdt.3.65; manikw/teroi h)\ a)ndreio/teroi Pl.Tht.144b, cf. Ar.Ach.1078. rarely after a Sup., plei=sta qwma/sia e)/xei *ai)/guptos h)\ a)/llh pa=sa xw/rh Hdt.2.35 (s.v.l.); pi/qoito/ ken u)/mmi ma/lista h)\ e)moi/ A.R.3.91. h)\ ou) is used when a neg. precedes, ou)de/n ti ma=llon e)p' h(me/as h)\ ou) kai\ e)p' u(me/as Hdt.4.118, cf.5.94, Th.2.62, etc.: after an implied neg., w)mo\n . . po/lin o(/lhn diafqei=rai ma=llon h)\ ou) tou\s ai)ti/ous Id.3.36. freq. omitted with numerals after plei/wn, e)la/ttwn, mei/wn, e)/th . . plei/w e(bdomh/konta v.l. in Pl.Ap.17d; ou) mei=on pentakosi/ous X.An.6.4.24: sts. with an inf. or conditional clause, ti/ ga\r a)ndri\ kako\n mei=zon a(martei=n E.Alc. 879; ti/s eu)praci/a spaniwte/ra . . , ei) [du/namis] pa/restin (for h)\ du/namin parei=nai); Th.1.33. pleon. with a gen., ti/s a)\n ai)sxi/wn ei)/h tau/ths do/ca, h)\ dokei=n . . Pl.Cri.44c, cf. Lys.10.28. the Disj. and Comp. uses are found together in Il.15.511 be/lteron, h)\ a)pole/sqai e(/na xro/non h)e\ biw=nai, h)\ dhqa\ streu/gesqai e)n ai)nh= dhi+oth=ti better,
either to die once for all
or win life,
than long to toil in battle. [h)\ ou), h)\ ou)k combine by Synizesis into one syll. in Trag. and Com., A.Pr.330, S.Aj.334, Ar.Lys.128; so usually in Ep., Od.1.298, al.; h)\ au)to/s Hes.Fr.194; h)\ ei) Alex.201.]

h)/ (B), an exclamation expressing disapproval, h)\ h)\ siw/pa Ar.Nu. 105; h)\ h)/: ti/ dra=s; E.HF906(lyr.), cf. Suid. to call attention, pou= *canqi/as; h)\ *canqi/a where's Xanthias?
hi, Xanthias! Ar.Ra.271.

h)/ (or h)=) (C), Cypr. for
if, Inscr.Cypr.135.6H. Cret. for
when, after, h)/ k' a)posta=| mwlh=n
after retiring, he shall take proceedings, Leg.Gort.1.52; e)n tai=s tria/konta h)/ ka vei/ponti within 30 days
from the time of their proclamation, ib.8.18.

h)=, Adv., never in the form h)=e （h)e/): TO CONFIRM an assertion,
in truth, of a surety, h)= o)li/gon oi(= pai=da e)oiko/ta gei/nato *tudeu/s Il.5.800, etc.; ironically, 1.229, al.; with concessive force,
it is true that . . : hence,
although . . , h)= kai\ ge/nei u(/steros h)=en 3.215: freq. strengthd. by the addition of one or two other Particles, as h)= a)/ra Od.24.193; h)= a)/ra dh/ Il.13.446; h)= r(a 4.82; h)= r(a/ nu 6.215; h)= ga/r 1.78; h)= ga/r toi Od.16.199; h)= dh/ Il.2.272; h)= dh/ pou 21.583; h)= dh=ta S.OT429; h)= qhn Il.20.452; h)= ka/rta S. El.1279; h)= ma/la Il.3.204; h)= ma/la dh/ 5.422; h)= mh/n and h)= me/n (v. infr.); h)= nu Il.22.11; h)= ta/xa Od.18.73; h)= te 13.211: and to express doubt, h)= pou, v. h)= pou and pou=: esp. h)= mh/n used in oaths and asseverations, Il.2.291, 7.393, A.Pr.73, 168, etc.; also h)= ma/n Il.2.370, 13.354, Sapph.Supp.23.5; h)= me/n Od.10.65(later ei)= mh/n, v. ei(=): c. inf. in orat. obliq., after Verbs of swearing, etc., su\ de\ su/nqeo, kai/ moi o)/mosson, h)= me/n moi pro/frwn e)/pesin kai\ xersi
 a)rh/cein Il.1.77; h)= me/n also in Ion. historical Prose, Hdt.4.154, 5.93, al.; e)ggua=sqai, h)= mh
 paramenei=n Pl. Phd.115d; e)gguhta\s katasth=sai h)= mh
 e)ktei/sein Lexap.D.24.39: with other Particles, h)= me
 dh/ Il.2.798, Od.18.257, al.; h)= dh\ ma/n Il.17.538. in the combinations e)pei\ h)=, o(/ti h)\ and ti/ h)\; A.D.Conj.255.5, Synt.307.19(cf. Hdn.Gr.1.520), recognizes an 'expletive' h)（paraplhrwmatiko\s su/ndesmos) perispom. after e)pei/, barytone after o(/ti or ti/. It is prob. the same as the affirmative h)= (cf. A.D.Conj.l.c.), and occurs in the same combinations, e)pei\ h)= polu/ . . Il.1.169, al.; e)pei\ h)= ma/la ib. 156, Od.10.465; e)pei\ h)= kai/ . . Il.20.437, Od.16.442. Trypho took ti/h as one word, and this can be supported by ti/ h)\ de\ su/ . . Il.6.55, but A.D.（Conj.l.c.) infers from the accent of o(/ti h)\ that ti/ h)\ was two words. The Attic accentuation is said by Eust.45 init., 118.39, 907.14 to be tih/, o(tih/(qq. v.). this h)= (or h)\) is prob. to be recognized in w(/s te ga h)= Il.2.289, w(/s te/ teu h)= Od.3.348, 19.109, where codd. have h)\ (in Od.3.348 h)de/ (cj. Bekker) shd. perh. be read for h)e/). in Questions not involving alternatives: Direct
questions, epexegetic of a preceding question, suggesting the answer to it, ti/pt' ei)lh/louqas; h)= i(/na u(/brin i)/dh| *)agame/mnonos; why hast thou come?
is it that thou mayst see . . ? Il.1.203, cf. 5.466,7.26, Od.4.710,13.418, 17.376, B.17.5; ti/ dh=ta xrh/|zeis; h)= me gh=s e)/cw balei=n; S.OT622, cf. E.Or.1425 (h)/ codd.); ti/s soi dihgei=to; h)= au)to\s *swkra/ths; Pl.Smp.173a (perispom., cod. B): on the accent, Hdn. Gr.2.112. not epexegetic of a preceding question, h)= su/ g' *)odusseu/s e)ssi polu/tropos; art thou the wily Odysseus? Od.10.330, cf. Il.11.666, 15.504; h)= ou)k o)tru/nontos a)kou/ete . . *(/ektoros; do you not hear . .? ib.506, cf. Od.16.424; h)= to\ ploi=on a)fi=ktai; Pl.Cri.43c; h)= ou) dokei= kai\ soi\ ou(/tw; don't you think so too? Id.Grg.479b (perispom., cod. T); h)= bou/lei sullogisw/meqa au)ta/; shall we work them (the consequences) out? ib.479c (perispom., cod. T); h)= torw=s le/gw; A.Ag.269; h)= ka)n do/moisi tugxa/nei tanu=n parw/n; S.OT757: freq. with other Particles, h)= a)/r . . ; Od.20.166, Il.19.56; mostly h)= r(a . . ; 5.421, 762, Od.4.632; also in Trag. (in lyr.), A.Pers.633, S.Aj.172, 955: esp. to mark the first of several questions, Pi.I.7(6).3 sqq.; h)= a)/ra dh/ . . ; Il.13.446; h)= r(a/ nu . . ; 4.93; h)= nu . . ; 15.128; h)= tau=ta dh/ . . ; S.Ph.565, El.385; h)= tau=ta dh=ta . . ; Id.OT429; h)= ga/r . . ; A.Pr. 745, 757, S.OT1000: in Att. Prose, h)= ga/r; standing alone,
is it not so? Pl.Tht.160e, Grg.449d, 468d; h)= kai/ . . ; A.Ag.1207, 1362:—h)= usu. begins the sentence, except that the vocative may precede, as in Il.5.421, 762, Od.4.632, S.OC863, 1102, or a)lla/, as in A.Ag.276, Ch.774:—by Crasis h)= combines with a)/ra in Att. and the koinh/ to a)=ra (q. v.), in all other dialects (cf. A.D.Conj.223.24) to h)=ra (q. v.), but a)=ra is found in Pi.P.4.78 (a)/ra codd.), al., Archil.86, 89. Indirect questions, oi)/xeto peuso/menos meta\ so
 kle/os h)/ pou e)/t' ei)/hs Od. 13.415 (v.l. ei), which alone has Ms. authority in Il.1.83, Od.19.325); o)/fra kai\ *(/ektwr ei)/setai h)\ kai\ e)mo
 do/ru mai/netai e)n pala/mh|sin Il.8.111 (v.l. ei)）; a)ll' a)/ge moi to/de ei)pe\ . . h)\ kai\ *lae/rth| au)th
 o(do
 a)/ggelos e)/lqw; Od.16.138 (v.l. ei)）; a)mfi/stasqai h)= ka pefuteu/kwnti pa/nta ka	 ta
 sunqh/kan they shall investigate
whether . . Tab.Heracl.1.125; manteu/sasqai/ oi(. . h)= lw/i+o/n oi(/ ka ei)/h Isyll.34; diafafi/casqai h)= dokei= au)to
 stefanw=sai IG12(3).170.12 (Astypalaea): accented h)/ in codd. Hom., but it shd. perh. be perispom.

h)=, for e)/fh, 3sg. impf. or aor. 2 of h)mi/ (q. v.). h)=, for h)=n, Att. contr. from lon. e)/a, impf. of ei)mi/ (
sum).

h(=, Adv. of Place,
where, Berl.Sitzb.1927.170 (Cyrene), Leg.Gort. 6.31.

h(=|, dat. sg. fem. of relat. Pron. o(/s, h(/, o(/, in adverb. sense, of Place,
which way, where, whither, relat. to th=|, Il.13.53, 15.46; also in Trag. and Att., S.El.1435; th=|de . . h(=| A.Ch.308; e)kei/nh| . . h(=| Pl.Phd. 82d; Dor. a(=| SIG56.28 (Argos, v B.C.). of Manner,
how, as, h(=| kai\ *loci/as e)fh/misen A.Ch.558; h(=| nomi/zetai S.OC1603; h(=| bou/lontai Th.8.71, etc.:—not in Hom., unless we read h(=| qe/mis e)sti/ for h(\ qe/mis, v. qe/mis.
wherefore, Th.1.25, 2.2,al.
in so far as, diafe/rein ta\ e(kou/sia tw=n a)kousi/wn h(=| o( me\n . . tw=| de/ . . X.Mem.2.1.18, cf. Pl. Men.72b; r(h/tores h(=| r(h/tores Phld.Rh.2.265S.; h(=| a)/nqrwpos
qua man, Arist.EN1096b2. with Sup., h(=| e)du/nato ta/xista
as quickly
as he could, X.An.1.2.4, etc.; h(=| dunato\n ma/lista ib.1.3.15; h(=| a)/riston Id.Cyr.2.4.32, etc.; h(=| r(a=|sta/ te kai\ h(/dista Id.Mem.2.1.9; h(=| a)\n du/nwmai ta/xista Id.Cyr.7.1.9.

h)=a, h)=en, 1 and 3sg. Ep. impf. of ei)mi/ (
sum). h)=|a, contr. for h)/i+a, Ion. impf. of ei)=mi (
ibo). h)=|a, ta/, contr. from h)/i+a (q. v.).
h)a^rino/s, v. e)arino/s.
*)/hatos, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Heraclea Trachinia, GDI1895.

h)baio/s, a/, o/n, lon. (Cypr. acc. to AB1095) for baio/s,
small, usu. with neg. ou)de/, ou)/ oi( e)/ni fre/nes, ou)d' h)baiai/ no sense is in him, no not
the least, Il.14.141, cf. Od.21.288; ou)/ oi( e)/ni tri/xes, ou)d' h)baiai/ no not even
a few, 18.355; also h)baih\n ou)/ti kata\ pro/fasin Call.Fr.540: rarely without neg., [phlamu/des] kai\ h)baiai/ per e)ou=sai Opp.H.4.514. often in neut. as Adv., ou)d' h)baio/n not
in the least, not
at all, Il.2.380, Od.3.14, etc., cf. Phylarch.(?)84J.: rarely without a neg., h)baio\n a)po\ spei/ous
a little from the cave, Od.9.462.

h(b-a/skw, Incept. of h(ba/w,
come to puberty, Hp.Aph.3.28. X.An. 4.6.1; pai=s h(ba/skwn a)/rti ib.7.4.7; of women,
become marriageable, Ruf. ap. Orib.inc.2.2. metaph., nu=n e)/q' h(ba/skei kako/n (read by Gal. for h(ba=| soi) E.Alc.1085; h(mi=n h(ba/skei peni/h AP6.30 (Maced.); poihtikh\ ou)/pw h(ba/skousa Philostr.Her.Praef.
reach, or
show the outward signs of, manhood, Aristaenet.1.11, Philostr.Im.2.7.

h(b-a/w, Cret. h(bi/w Leg.Gort.7.41,al., Aeol.(?) a)ba/w Hdn.Gr.2.16, Alc.Supp.7.11 (dub.); Ep. opt. h(bw/oimi, part. h(bw/wn (v. infr.): impf. h(/bwn Ar.V.357: fut. -h/sw （e)f-) X.Cyr.6.1.12, Dor. h(ba/sw [a_] AP7.482: aor. 1 h(/bhsa Od.1.41, Hes.Op.132, Pl.Ap.41e: pf. h(/bhka （par-) Hdt.3.53, etc.: (h(/bh):—
attain or
have attained puberty, o(/tan h(bh/sai te kai\ h(/bhs me/tron i(/koito Hes.Op.132; h(bw=sin o)ye/ Hp.
Aër.4; e)peida\n h(bh/swsi Pl.Ap.l.c.; of women. gunh\ te/tor' h(bw/oi (sc. e)/th) four years
past puberty, Hes.Op.698; h(ba/seis h(/ban APl.c.; h(ba=n e)pi\ diete/s, v. sub dieth/s; o)mo/sai *xalkide/wn tou\s h(bw=ntas a(/pantas all the
adults, IG12.39.32, cf. Ar.Ra.1055, Th.4.132.
to be in the prime of youth, ei)/q' w(\s h(bw/oimi, bi/h te/ moi e)/mpedos ei)/h Od.14.468, al.; a)nh\r ou)de\ ma/l' h(bw=n not even
in the prime of life, Il.12.382, cf. Od. 23.187, A.Ch.879; ge/ronta to\n nou=n, sa/rka d' h(bw=san fe/rei Id.Th. 622; h(ba=n sqe/nos
to be young and strong, E.HF436 (lyr.); h(/bwn I
was young, Ar.V.357; h(. ta\s ai)sqh/seis, of an old man, Philostr.VS1.9.3; of plants, h(meri\s h(bw/wsa
a young, luxuriant vine, Od.5.69, cf. Simon.183.3, Longus 4.5; h(bw=nt' a)rti/ws oi)ni/skon （para\ prosdoki/an for neani/skon) Cratin.183. metaph.,
to be fresh, vigorous, h(bw/ois, fi/le qume/ Thgn.877 (dub. l.); a)ei\ ga\r h(ba=| toi=s ge/rousin eu)= maqei=n '
tis always
youth for old men to learn, i.e. 'tis never too late to learn, A.Ag.584 (nisi leg. h(/bh）; h(ba=| dh=mos ei)s o)rgh\n pesw/n the people
rages like a passionate youth, E.Or.696, cf. neaniko/s; a)/ggelon . . ge/ronq', h(bw=nta d' eu)glw/ssw| freni/
exulting, A.Supp.775; also of things, ga/moi, e)/ar h(., Opp.H.1.474, 2.252.
to have the outward signs of puberty, Arist.GA746b23; ge/nus h(ba=| AP12.31 (Phan.).

h(/b-h, Dor. h(/ba, Aeol. a)/ba Alc.101, h(: (v. sub fin.):—
youthful prime, youth, nehni/h| a)ndri\ e)oikw/s, prw=ton u(phnh/th|, tou= per xarie/statos h(/bh Od.10.279, cf. Il.24.348; kai\ d' e)/xei h(/bhs a)/nqos o(/ te kra/tos e)sti\ me/giston 13.484, cf. Hes.Th.988; e)rikudh/s Il.11.225, Hes.l.c.; poluh/ratos Od.15.366, etc.; h(/bhs me/tron i(ke/sqai or i(ka/nein, = h(ba/skein, 11.317, 18.217, etc.; h(/bhn poluh/raton i(ko/meq' 15.366, cf. Il.24.728; h(/bhs a)po/nasqai, tarph=nai, 17.25, Od.23.212; e)f' h(/bhs Ar.Eq.524; qre/yasqai/ tina pro\s h(/bhn until
manhood, Pl.Mx.238b; me/xri h(/bhs Th.2.46.
strength and vigour of youth, [di/skon] a)fh=ken . . peirw/menos h(/bhs Il.23.432; h(/bh| te pepoi/qea xersi/ t' e)mh=|si Od.8.181, cf. 16.174; h(/bhs a)kmh/ S.OT 741: in pl., karpotro/foi nea/nides h(=bai E.Ion 477 (lyr.). as a legal term, h(/bh was
the time before manhood, at Athens sixteen years of age, AB255.15; fourteen acc. to EM359.17, Harp. s.v. e)pidiete/s; at Sparta eighteen, ta\ de/ka a)f' h(/bhs (sc. e)/th), i.e. men of twentyeight, X.HG2.4.32, 3.4.23; ta\ tettara/konta a)f' h(/. ib.6.4.17; of women, e)pei\ d' e)s h(/bhn h)=lqen w(rai/an ga/mwn E.Hel.12. of oxen, h(/bhs me/tron e)/xonte Hes. Op.438; of the
fresh skin of a snake, Nic.Th. 138. metaph.,
cheer, merriment, Pi.P.4.295; daito\s h(/bh E.Cyc. 504 (lyr.); also,
youthful fire, spirit, Pi.P.6.48.
body of youth, A. Pers.512, 733, Ag.109 (lyr.), etc.
the pubes, Hp.Epid.3.4, Ar. Nu.976, Theopomp.Com.37, Arist.HA493b3,al. a kind of
vine, Hsch.; Dor.a(=bai (pl.) v.l. in Theoc.5.109. pr.n., *(/hbh Hebe, Il.4.2, Od.11.603, Hes. Th.950; later allegorized as
goddess of youth. (Cf. Lith.
jėgà 'power'.)

h(b-hdo/n, Adv.
from the youth upwards, a(/pantes h(bhdo/n Hdt.1.172, cf. 6.21, Luc.Vit.Auct.14,al.; a)/cion *)efesi/ois h(. a)pa/gcasqai Heraclit.121; tou\s a)/ndras h(. a)posfa/cai D.S.3.54, cf. D.H.2.16,al.

h(/b-hsis, ews, h(,
pubescence, peri\ to\ h)=tron Sor.1.24.
h(b-hth/r, h=ros, o(, = h(bhth/s, AP5.276 (Eratosth.), 6.76 (Agath.), Coluth.71.

h(b-hthri/a, h(,
the age of h(/bh, IG12(9).916.22 (Chalcis).

h(b-hth/rion, to/,
a place where young people meet, for exercise and amusement, Plu.Pomp.40,53, Ath.10.425e, D.C.61.17, Hsch.

h(b-hth/s, ou=, o(, Dor. h(ba_ta/s IG9(1).334 (Locr., v B.C.), Berl.Sitzb.1927.160 (Cyrene), a(ba_ta/s only in Call. (v. infr.); Thess. ei(ba_ta/s (q. v.): (h(ba/w):—
in one's prime, adult, kou=roi h(bhtai/ h.Merc.56, cf. Call.Lav.Pall.109; braxio/nwn h(bhth\n tu/pon E.Heracl. 858.

h(b-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
youthful, lo/goi X.HG5.3.20; h(liki/a Id.Lac. 4.7, Gal.17(2).791.
h(b-h/twr, oros, o(, = h(bhth/r, ki/xlai Matro Conv. 78.
h(b-iko/s, h/, o/n, = h(bhtiko/s, h(liki/a Gal.16.655 (with v.ll.), Steph.in Hp.2.373 D.
h)bolei=n : a)rgei=n, Hsch.

h)/bolon h)=mar: kaqo\ a)pa<n>tw=sin ei)s tau)to/n, h)\ eu)/kairon, i(ero/n, Hsch. (= Call.
Fr.anon.170).

h(bullia/w, Comic Dim. of h(ba/w,
to be in the bloom of youth, Ar.Ra. 516, Pherecr.108.29.

h)ga/qeos [a^], h, on, Dor. a)ga/q-,
most holy, of places immediately under divine protection, *pu/los, *lh=mnos, Il.1.252, 2.722; *puqw/ Hes. Th.499, Pi.P.9.71; xw=ros, a)/ntron A.R.3.981, 4.1131. (a)ga-, qeo/s with Epic metrical lengthening.)

h)ga^le/os, a, on, (a)/gnumi)
broken in pieces, Call.
Fr.anon.91.
h)ga/nea: pe/mmata ta\ a)po\ thga/nou, Hsch.; cf. h)/ganon. h)gane/s: kaqaro/n, ne/on, and h)ga/n<e>os: neani/skos, Id.
h)/ga^non, to/, Ion. for th/ganon, Anacr.26.
h(ge/maxos: pole/marxos, Hsch., cf. EM299.43.
h(gemo/n-eia, h(, fem. of h(gemoneu/s, = h(gemo/nh, Orph.A.909.

h(gemo/n-euma, atos, to/,
leading: but in E.Ph.1492 a(gemo/neuma nekroi=si, = h(gemw\n nekrw=n, cf. Sch. ad loc.

h(gemon-eu/s, e/ws, o(, Dor. a(g-IG5(1).540 (iii A.D.), Ep. for h(gemw/n, acc. h(gemonh=a, -h=as, Opp.C.1.224, AP14.72.11, Man. 1.36, etc.; of a Roman
governor, IG14.1437, Supp.Epigr.1.405A2 (Samos).

h(gemon-eu/w, Dor. a(g-,
lead the way, proti\ *)/ilion Il.16.92; pro\s dw/mata, a)gorh/nde, le/xosde, deu=ro, Od.3.386, 8.4, 23.293, 17.372; pro/sq' h(gemo/neuen 22.400, 24.155; au)=lin e)f' h(mete/rhn Theoc. 25.60; e)piqumi/as kai\ e)/rwtos h(gemoneu/santos Pl.Smp.197a: dat. pers., Od.3.386, 8.4, Hes.Th.387, etc.; th=| i)/men, h(=| ken dh\ su\ . . h(gemoneu/h|s Il.15.46; o(do\n h(.
to lead the way, e)gw\ d' o(do\n h(gemoneu/sw Od.6.261, cf. Parm.1.5: twice in Hom., c. dat. et acc., toi=si ge/rwn o(do\n h(gemo/neue Od.24.225; u(/dati r(o/on h(.
make a course for the water, Il.21.258.
lead in war,
rule, command, once in Hom., c. dat., *trwsi\ me\n h(gemo/neue . . *(/ektwr 2.816: elsewh., c. gen., *lokrw=n d' h(. *ai)/as ib.527, cf. 552, Hdt.7.99, 160, etc.; h(gemo/nwn h(. X. Ages.1.3, etc.; h(. th=s ske/yews
to take the lead in it, Pl.Prt.351e: abs.,
to have or
take the command, Hdt.8.2; h(. e)n po/lei Pl.R.474c:— Pass.,
to be ruled, u(po/ tinos Th.3.61.—Signf. 11 never occurs in Od., and signf. 1 rarely in Il.
to be governor, th=s *suri/as Eu. Luc.2.2: abs., PTeb.302.7(i A.D.), IGRom.3.162 (Ancyra, ii A.D.), etc.
h(gemon-hi/+s, i/+dos, h(, poet. for h(gemoni/s, Man.4.98.
h(gemon-i/dhs, ou,.o(, = h(gemw/n, LXX 2 Ma. 13.24.

h(gemon-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a leader, ready to lead or
guide, pro/s ti X.Mem.2.3.14 (Comp.); pro\s ta\ ponhra/ Id.Cyr.2.2.25; klh=ma -w/taton th=s a)mpe/lou Gp.4.13.4; h(. to/pos
vital spot, Vett.Val.38.13.
capable of command, authoritative, yuxh\ e)n toi=s h(/lici h(. X.Smp.8.16; h(. fu/sis Philol.11; h(. th\n fu/sin Pl.Phdr.252e; h(. te/xnai Id.Phlb.55d; oi( kat' a)reth\n h(. pro\s politikh\n a)rxh/n Arist.Pol.1288a12; to\ a)/rren . . tou= qh/leos -w/teron ib.1259b2; -wta/th [e)pisth/mh] Id.Metaph.996b10; h(. kai\ politiko\s bi/os (sc. th=s po/lews) Id.Pol.1327b5; zw/|dia viz. Aries, Leo, Sagittarius, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.165, Ptol.Tetr.34; h(gemoniko/n,
authoritative, of knowledge, Pl.Prt.352b; to\ h(gemoniko/n
the authoritative part of the soul (reason), esp. in Stoic philosophy, Zeno Stoic.1.39, etc.; but also,
the governing part of the universe, of the aether or sun, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.186,192, Cleanth.ib.1.112. Adv. -kw=s
like a leader, opp. despotikw=s, Arist.Fr.658; h(. kai\ basilikw=s Plb.2.64.6, cf. Procl.in Alc.p.52C.: Comp. -w/teron
more like an Emperor, J.AJ19.4.2. = Lat.
consularis, Plu.Pomp.26.
of or
belonging to the prefect of Egypt, u(phre/ths CPR18.35 (ii A.D.); ploi=a POxy.2116.1 (iii A.D.). -ka/, ta/,
payment to a h(gemw/n, e)di/doto *kle/wni e)n '*alecandrei/a| h( . . . kai\ si=tos a)ko/louqos
PLond.ined. 2089 (iii B.C.).

h(gemo/n-ios, on,
guiding, epith. of Hermes, as
the guide of departed souls, cf. yuxopompo/s, Ar.Pl.1159, IG22.1496.85, Corn. ND16.

h(gemon-i/s, i/dos, h(, fem. of h(gemw/n,
imperial, po/leis Str.8.6.10, cf. CIG2721 (Stratonicea); gh= App.BC2.65: metaph., dikaiosu/nh h( e)n a)retai=s h(. Ph.2.5; ai)sqh/sewn h(. o(/rasis Id.2.24.

h(gemo/su^na (sc. i(era/), ta/,
thank-offerings for safe-conduct, X.An. 4.8.25.

h(gemw/n, Dor. a(g-, Aeol. a)gi/mwn IG12(2).164 (Mytil.), al., o/nos, o(; also h(, Pi.I.8(7).22, A.Supp.722, Aeschin.1.171, X.Oec. (infr. 11):—
one who leads; and so, in Od.,
guide, 10.505, 15.310, Hdt.5.14, S.Ant.1014, Pl.Men.97b; h(gemo/nes gene/sqai tini\ th=s o(dou= Hdt.8.31, cf. E.Hec.281, X.Mem.1.3.4; h(. podo\s tuflou= E.Ph.1616; h(gemo/nes tou= plou= Th.7.50; of a charioteer, S.OT804.
one who does a thing first, shows the way to others, toi=s newte/rois h(. h)qw=n xrhstw=n gi/gnesqai Pl.Lg.670e; pate/res th=s sofi/as kai\ h(. Id.Ly.214a; po/nous tou= zh=n h(de/ws h(gemo/nas nomi/zete X.Cyr.1.5.12; th=s ei)rh/nhs h(. D.18.24; [a)xaristi/a] e)pi\ pa/nta ta\ ai)sxra\ h(. X.Cyr.1.2.7: abs., of choir-
leaders, Mnemos.47.253 (Argos, ii/i B.C.). in Il.,
leader, commander, chief, opp. laoi/, plhqu/s, 2.365, 11.304: c. gen., h(gemo/nes *danaw=n, fula/kwn, etc., 2.487, 9.85, cf. Hdt.6.43, 7.62, al.; strathgo\s kai\ h(. tw=n '*ellh/nwn pro\s to\n ba/rbaron ib.158; h(. tw=n pole/mwn Id.9.33; e)/xontes h(gemo/nas tw=n pa/nu [strathgw=n] Th.8.89; = loxago/s, Arr.Tact. 5.6; h(. tw=n e)n proxeirismw=| PAmh.2.39 (ii B.C.);
chief, sovereign, Pi.I. 8(7).22, etc.; h(. gh=s th=sde S.OT103, cf. OC289; pa/ntwn . . kai\ au)tou= basile/ws h(. X.HG3.5.14; h(. summori/as D.21.157; of the
queen-bee and
queen-wasp, regarded by Arist. as males, Arist.HA553a25, 629a3 (but h( tw=n melissw=n h(. X.Oec.7.32, cf. 38); o( h(. tw=n proba/twn, of the bell-wether, Arist.HA573b24; tw=n bow=n ib.575b1; ne/mein ta\ kre/a tou= h(gemo/nos boo/s SIG144.36 (Piraeus, iv B.C.), cf. X.HG6.4.29. h(. xorou=
leader of a chorus, Poll.4.106; pai=des h(. IG7.3196 (Orchom. Boeot.);
president of a gymnasium, ib.3.1086, al.
a Roman Emperor, Str.4.3.2, Plu.Cic.2, al.; as translation of
princeps, Mon.Anc.Gr.7.9; h(. neo/thtos, = Lat.
princeps juventutis, ib.18;
a provincial governor, Str.17.3.25, Ev.Matt.27.2, Act.Ap.23.24: freq. of the
praefectus Aegypti, PRyl.119.4 (i A.D.), etc.; h(. a)mfote/rwn, i.e. of Upper and Lower Egypt, POxy.39.6 (i A.D.); h(. *ku/prou
Tab. Defix.Aud. 25.13 (iii A.D.). as Adj., a)nh/r Pl.Criti.119a; [nau=s], of the flagship, A.Supp.722; h(. th=s fulh=s korufai=os D.21.60 (s.v.l.); h(. po/des Arist.HA490b5, IA713b32: as neut., h(gemo/si me/resi Pl.Ti. 91e. in Prosody, = purri/xios, D.H.Comp.17, Dem.47. h(gemo/nes, Dor. a(g-, ai(, in Architecture,
coping-tiles of the roof, IG22.463.70, 1627.303, 4.1484.100 (Epid.). a kind of fish, = h(ghth/r 2, Plu.2.980f.

h(ge/omai, Dor. a(g- (irreg. pres. part. a(gw/menos Hymn.Curet.4), impf. h(gou/mhn ll.12.28, etc., Ion. -eu/mhn Hdt.2.115, h(ge/onto Id.9.15: fut. h(gh/somai Il.14.374, etc.: aor. 1 h(ghsa/mhn Od.14.48, etc.: aor. 1 h(gh/qhn in pass. sense, PGiss.48.20 (iii A.D.) (cf. perihg-): pf. h(/ghmai Hdt.1.126, 2.115, a(/ghmai Pi.P.4.248:—
go before, lead the way, w(\s ei)pw\n h(gei=q', h( d' e(/speto *palla\s '*aqh/nh Od.1.125; a)\n pa/i+s h(gh/saito nh/pios 6.300, etc.; pro/sqen de\ . . *)=iris h(gei=t' Il.24.96; h(gou= pa/roiqe E. Ph.834; h(. e)pi\ nh=a Od.13.65; e)s tei=xos Il.20.144; klisi/hnde Od.14. 48, cf. Hdt.2.93, etc.; h(ghso/menos ou)dei\s e)/stai X.An.2.4.5: Astron.,
precede in the daily movement, Autol.2.3, al. c. dat. pers., *trwsi\ poti\ pto/lin h(gh/sasqai Il.22.101; e)k *doulixi/ou . . h(gei=to mnhsth=rsi Od.16.397; oi( ga\r ble/pontes toi=s tufloi=s h(gou/meqa Ar.Pl.15; h(. toi=s poli/tais pro\s a)reth/n X.Ages.10.2. with o(do/n added, o(do\n h(gh/sasqai
to go before on the way, Od.10.263; h(. tini\ th\n o(do/n Hdt.9.15. c. acc. loci, h(/ oi( . . po/lin h(gh/saito who
might guide him to the city, Od.6.114, cf. 7.22, 15.82; h(. bwmou\s a)stikou/s A.Supp.501. a(/rmata h(.
drive chariots, Philostr.Im.2.23. of logical priority,
to be antecedent, opp. e(/pesqai, Stoic.2.71, 88, S.E. M.8.110, al., Dam.Pr.241, Phlp.in GC195.13, in Ph.496.14. h(gou/menon, to/, the
leading principle, the
main thing, Ph.Bel.63.14, cf. Sosip.1.47. c. dat. pers. et gen. rei,
to be one's
leader in a thing, qei=os a)oido\s . . h(mi=n h(gei/sqw . . o)rxhqmoi=o Od.23.134; h(. tini\ sofi/as, w)|dh=s, Pi.P.l.c., Pl.Alc.1.125d; a)lh/qeia dh\ pa/ntwn me\n a)gaqw=n qeoi=s h(gei=tai pa/ntwn de\ a)nqrw/pois Id.Lg.730c; h(. tou= xorou= *pe/rsais X.Cyr.8.7.1, cf. Call.Del.313: c. gen. rei, a(. no/mwn
to lead the song, Pi.N.5.25; fro/nhsis h(. tou= o)rqw=s pra/ttein Pl.Men.97c; h(. panto\s kai\ lo/gou kai\ e)/rgou X.Mem.2.3.15: also, to\ o)rqw=s toi=s toiou/tois xrh=sqai e)pisth/mh h)=n h(goume/nh Pl.Euthd.281a. c. dat. rei,
to be leader in . . , kerdosu/nh|, nhpie/h|si h(. tini/, Il.22.247, Od.24.469. c. acc. rei,
lead, conduct, h(. ta\s pompa/s D.21.174; th\n a)podhmi/an (v.l. for h)|th/sato) Dinon 7; ta\s tu/xas E.Supp.226: with adverbial acc., h( glw=ssa pa/nq' h(goume/nh S.Ph.99. part. h(gou/menos, h, on, as Adj., ske/lh h(gou/mena, opp. e(po/mena, the
front legs, Arist.IA713b6; o( h(. pou/s the
advanced foot, Id.Fr.74.
lead, command in war, c. dat., nh=es qoai/, h(=|sin '*axilleu\s e)s *troi/hn h(gei=to Il.16.169, cf. Od.14.238; ou) ga\r e)/hn o(/s ti/s sfin e)pi\ sti/xas h(gh/saito
might lead them to their ranks, Il.2.687; h(. *trw/essin e)s *)/ilion 5.211; h(. *mh/|osin 2.864; lo/gxaisin E.Ba.1360; e(te/rois Lys. 31.17, cf. X.An.5.2.6; e)n tai=s stratei/ais, ai(=s h(gei=tai basileu/s Isoc. 12.180: also generally, po/lei E.Fr.282.24; but usu. c. gen., *sarphdw\n d' h(gh/sat' . . e)pikou/rwn Il.12.101; h(gh/sato law=n 15.311, cf. 2.567, al.; h(. th=s e)co/dou Th.2.10; h(gou/menos tw=n h(donw=n a)ll' ou)k a)go/menos u(p' au)tw=n Isoc.9.45: abs.,
to be in command, Id.16.21, etc.
rule, have dominion, c. gen., th=s '*asi/hs, th=s summaxi/hs, Hdt.1.95, 7.148; oi( *qessali/hs h(geo/menoi Id.9.1: abs., oi( h(gou/menoi
the rulers, S. Ph.386, cf. A.Ag.1363; h(. e)n toi=s a)delfoi=s
leading men, Act.Ap. 15.22; h(. sxolh=s
to be the head of a philosophical school, Phld.Acad. Ind.p.107 M., al. as official title, h(gou/menos, o(,
president, suno/dou PGrenf.2.67.3 (iii A.D.); gerdi/wn ib.43.9 (i A.D.); i(ere/wn PLond. 2.281.2 (i A.D.): abs., PFay.110.26 (i A.D.). of Roman governors, h(. e)/qnous,= Lat.
praeses provinciae, POxy.1020.5 (ii/iii A.D.); h(. th=s *galati/as Luc.Alex.44. of subordinate
officials, h(. tou= strathgou= POxy.294.19 (i A.D.); kw/mhs PRyl.125.3 (i A.D.).
abbot, Just.Nov.7.1, al.: fem. -me/nh
abbess, ibid. h(gou/menos as Adj.,
principal, pulw/n PFlor.382.15 (iii A.D.), POxy.55.9 (iii A.D.). post-Hom.,
believe, hold, Hdt. (usu. in pf. h(/ghmai, 3pl. h(ge/atai), etc.; h(. ti ei)=nai Id.1.126, al.; h(gei=sqe de\ [qeou\s] ble/pein . . pro\s to\n eu)sebh= brotw=n S.OC278, cf. Th.2.89, Ar.Nu.1020 (lyr.), etc. with an attributive word added, h(. tina\ basile/a
hold or
regard as king, Hdt.6.52; mhd' au)qadi/an eu)bouli/as a)mei/non' h(gh/sh| pote/ A.Pr.1035; a(/pantas e)xqrou\s tw=n qew=n h(gou= ple/on Id.Ch.902, cf. 905; h(. ta)/lla pa/nta deu/tera
to hold everything else secondary, S.Ph.1442; ou)k ai)sxro\n h(gh=| . . ta\ yeudh= le/gein; ib.108, cf. Ant.1167; ta\s tou/twn a)pori/as a)ntipa/lous h(. tw=| h(mete/rw| plh/qei Th.4.10; peri\ pollou= h(/ghmai mh\ ceinoktone/ein Hdt.2.115; peri\ plei/onos Isoc.19.10; peri\ plei/stou Th.2.89; peri\ ou)deno/s Lys.7.26; par' ou)de/n Decr. ap. D.18.164: c. part., pa=n ke/rdos h(gou= zhmioume/nh fugh=| E.Med.454. esp. of belief in gods, th\n megi/sthn dai/mona h(/ghntai ei)=nai Hdt.2.40, cf. 3.8; h(. qeou/s
to believe in gods, Ar.Eq.32, E.Hec.800, Ba.1326; dai/monas h(. Pl.Ap.27d. h(gou=mai dei=n
think fit,
deem necessary, c. inf., And.1.23, D.1.20: without dei=n, paqei=n ma=llon h(ghsa/menoi h)/ . . Th.2.42 (s.v.l.); h(ghsa/mhn diata/gmati au)tou\s swfroni/sai Inscr.Magn.114 (ii A.D.); h(gh/sato e)paine/sai Pl.Prt.346b. pf. in pass. sense, ta\ a(ghme/na,= ta\ nomizo/mena, Orac. ap. D.43.66; h(geo/menon
being led, Hdt.3.14 (a)go/menon Dind.): hence act. form h(ge/w, Hdn.Gr.2.950. (
sāg-, cf. Lat.
praesagio.）

h)gere/qomai, Ep. form of a)gei/romai (Pass.)
gather together, assemble, only 3pl. pres. and impf., and inf., a)mfi\ de/ min . . a)goi\ h)gere/qontai Il. 3.231, cf. h.Ap.147; a)mf' '*atrei/+wna a)olle/es h)gere/qonto Il.23.233; peri\ d' e)sqloi\ e(tai=roi a)qro/oi h)gere/qonto Od.2.392; a)mf' ai(=ma . . a)olle/es h)gere/qonto 11.228; sfin e)pe/fradon h)gere/qesqai Il.10.127 Aristarch. (h)gere/esqai codd.): subj. h)gere/qwntai Opp.H.3.360.
h)/gerqen, Ep. 3pl. aor. 1 Pass. of a)gei/rw.
h(gesi/a, h(, (h(ge/omai) = h(/ghsis, Hsch. (h(geski/hs: o(dhghsi/as cod.).
h(gesi/la_os, h(ghsi/lews [i^], v. a)ghsi/laos.

h(ge/ths, ou, o(, Dor. a(g- ( a)g-), (h(ge/omai)
leader, voc. h(ge/ta o(doi=o Epigr.Gr.1035.13 (Pergam.); a)ge/ta kw/mwn Orph.H.52.7 codd.; a). qhrosu/nas AP6.167 (Agath.):—fem. a(ge/tis, idos, ib.7.425 (Antip.Sid.).

h(ghla/zw, Ep. collat. form of h(ge/omai,
guide, lead, kako\s kako
 h(ghla/zei Od.17.217; but kako
 mo/ron h(.
lead a wretched life, 11.618; bi/oton baru
 h(. A.R.1.272; i(ero
 go/on Orac. ap. Zos.1.57: for Arat.893, v. u(fhghla/zw.
h(ghla^te/w, prob. f.l. for a(g-, Them.Or.4.56c.

h(/g-hma, atos, to/,
that which guides, Inscr.Perg.246.27. (h(ge/omai 111)
thought, purpose, LXXEz.17.3.

h(g-hsi/polis [si^], ews, o(,
leader of the state, D.L.2.131.

h(/g-hsis, ews, h(,
command, LXXJd.5.15 (v.l.), 1 Ma.9.31.

h(g-h/teira, h(, fem. of h(ghth/r, Pl.Epigr.5.7, Opp.
C.1.253.

h(g-hte/on,
one must lead, X.HG4.7.2, Eq.Mag.4.3.
one must hold, consider, Pl.R.361a, Plb.1.35.9, Hierocl.p.63A., etc.

h(g-hth/r, Dor. a(g-, h=ros, o(, = h(ghth/s,
a guide, S.OC1521; sofi/hs e(o\n h(ghth=ra his
guide to philosophy, IG3.947. the
pilot-fish, Opp.H.5.70. = h(gh/twr,
a leader, a(. a)nh/r Pi.P.1.69.

h(g-hthri/a (sc. pala/qh), h(,
mass of dried figs, borne in procession at the Attic *plunth/ria, in memory of the discovery of this food,
which was considered the first step in civilized life, Ath.3.74d, Porph.Abst.2.7, Hsch., Phot.:
h(g-htori/a, EM418.49:
h(g-h/tria, Eust. 1399.29.

h(g-hth/s, ou=, o(, = h(ghth/r,
a guide, no/sfin h(ghtw=n A.Supp. 239.

h(g-htiko/s, Dor. a(g-, h/, o/n, = h(gemoniko/s,
authoritative, leading, tou)/nom' ou)x a(. Com.Adesp.inGött.Nachr.1922.28; opp. a)porhtiko/s, Procl.in Prm.p.483 S.; dub. sens. in Vett.Val.15.16.

h(g-h/twr (Dor. a(g- Ibyc.Oxy.2081（
f）Fr.4), oros, o(,
leader, commander, chief, *trw/wn, fula/kwn, Il.3.153, 10.181; h(gh/tores h)de\ me/dontes
chiefs in war and leaders in council, 2.79, etc.; h(. o)nei/rwn, of Hermes, h.Merc. 14. title of chief priest of Aphrodite in Cyprus, BMus.Inscr. 975.10 (Amathus), cf. Hsch. s.v. a)gh/twr.

h(giasme/nws, Adv. pf. Pass., (a(gia/zw)
in holy manner, Al.Ps.133 (134).2.

h)gme/nws, Adv. pf. Pass., (a)/gw)
reasonably, Suid. (prob. l.).

h(gneume/nws, Adv. pf. Pass., (a(gneu/w)
purely, Poll.1.32.
h)go/n (h)=gon cod.): kateago/s, Hsch.; cf. h)gale/os.
h)goro/wnto, Ep. and Ion. lengthd. for h)gorw=nto, v. a)gora/omai.
h(go/s, o(,= h(gemw/n, EM390.36; = eu)dai/men (Ionic), ib.37.
h(gou/menos, o(, v. h(ge/omai 11.3.

h)/goun, Conj., (h)/ ge ou)=n)
that is to say, or rather, to define a word more correctly, freq. in glosses, cf. Eust.50.15, Lyd.Mens.4.23, etc.: sts. introduced into the text, kaka\ pa/nta [h)/goun th/n te a)peyi/hn] kai/ . . Hp.Acut.（Sp.）49 (ii 491 L.); dia\ chro/thta [h)/goun xauno/thta] th=s gh=s X.Oec.19.11: in late Prose,
or at any rate, PMasp.328 i 20 (vi A.D.), al.: generally,
or, POxy.941.5 (vi A.D.).
h(da^no/s, h/, o/n, = h(du/s, etym. of e(dano/s, Eust.974.53.

h)de/,
and, prop. correlative to h)me/n: h)me\n . . , h)de\ . . ,
both . . , and . . , Il.7.302, etc. without h)me/n,
and, h(gh/tores h)de\ me/dontes 2.79, cf. 1.41,96,251, etc.: sts. with te before it, skh=ptro/n t' h)de\ qe/mistas 9.99; *(/ektor t' h)d' a)/lloi 12.61; *(/hrh t' h)de\ *poseida/wn kai\ *palla\s *)aqh/nh 1.400; au)to/s t' a)naxa/zomai h)de\ . . 5.822, cf. Pi.O.13.44; also me\n . . , h)de\ . . Od.1.240, 12.381, etc.; me/n te . . , h)de\ . . Orph.H.14.9; pai/dwn h)d' a)lo/xwn kai\ kth/sios h)de\ tokh/wn Il.15.663; h). kai/
and also, 1.334, Od.2.209, 4.235, 1.240; h)d' e)/ti kai/ Il.1.455, 2.118; h)de/ te AP 9.788.9.—The Trag. use h). in anapaestics and lyrics, A.Pers.16, 289, etc.; and (less freq.) in iamb., as Id.Ch.1025, Eu.414, S.Fr.386, 549, E.Hec.323, HF30: twice found in Com., Eup.14 (anap.), Alex.133.6(trim., s.v.l.). Not in Att. Prose; used by Hp. (= e)/ti de/) acc. to Gal.19.102, cf. Aret.CD2.7; a)ta\r h)de/ ib.1.3.
h)/dea, h)/dein, v. *ei)/dw.

h)delfidme/nws, Adv. pf. Pass., prop.
with brotherly likeness: metaph., h). e)n gastri\ e)xou/sh|
just as if . . , Hp.Mul.1.3: abs.,
in like manner, ib.2.205.
h(de/ws, Adv. of h(du/s, v. h(du/s 111.

h)/dh, Adv.:
already, by this time, nu\c h)/. tele/qei 'tis
already night, Il.7.282; h)/. *trw/essin o)le/qrou pei/rat' e)fh=ptai ib.402: with numerals, h)/. ga\r tri/ton e)/tos Od.2.89; tri/thn h)/. h(me/ran Pl.Prt. 309d; e)/tos to/d' h)/. de/katon S.Ph.312; h)=n d' h)=mar h)/. deu/teron ib.354; telou=ntes e(/kton e(/bdomo/n t' h)/. dro/mon Id.El.726; h)/. ga\r polu\s e)kte/tatai xro/nos Id.Aj.1402.
forthwith, immediately, frone/w de\ diakrinqh/menai h)/. *(argei/ous kai\ *trw=as Il.3.98; le/con nu=n me ta/xista, o)/fra kai\ h)/dh . . tarpw/meqa koimhqe/ntes Il.24.635, cf. Od.4.294; h)/. nu=n . . mega/l' eu)/xeo Il.16.844; stei/xois a)\n h)/. S.Tr.624; h)/dh . . ste/llesqe; Id.Ph.466; meta\ tou=t' h)/. Ar.Th.655; h)/. pote/
now at length, Mitteis Chr.87.8 (ii A.D.); on the verso of a letter,
urgent, immediate, PCair. Zen.154 (iii B.C.); h)/. h)/. taxu\ taxu/ PMag.Osl.1.319. opp. to the future or past,
actually, now, ou)k o)/nar, a)ll' u(/par h)/. Od.20.90; toi=s me\n ga\r h)/., toi=s d' e)n u(ste/rw| xro/nw| S.OC614; oi( me\n ta/x', oi( d' e)sau=qis, oi( d' h)/. E.Supp.551; ou) ta/x', a)ll' h)/. Ar.Ra.527; h( h)/. xa/ris
present favour, D.23.134; to\ h)/. kola/zein X.An.7.7.24. of logical proximity, h)/. ga\r a)\n prosti/qesqai Pl.Tht.201e; ta\ e)k tou/twn h)/. sugkei/mena ib.202b; pa=s h)/. a)\n eu(/roi Id.R.398c; a(\n su\ o(mologh/sh|s, tau=t' h)/. e)sti\n au)ta\ ta)lhqh= Id.Grg.486e; tou=to tou)/pos deino\n h)/. Ar.Ach.315; ta\ pa/nta ta\ pra/gmata diafqei/ranta tau=t' e)sti\n h)/. D.19.19. kai\ h)/. and
further, as well, e)me/ te kai\ se\ kai\ ta<*>=ll' h)/. Pl.Tht.159b, cf. S.E.P.1.53,219, etc.
for instance, Aen. Tact.4.1, 10.25.
only then, then and not before, to/t' h)/dh A.Pr.911, Isoc. 12.25, Ep.6.9; e)ntau=q' h)/. Aeschin.3.140; kakopaqou=ntes h)/. tw=n lo/gwn a(/ptontai Th.1.78. with Sup., w)= pa/ntwn a)ndrw=n h)/. ma/lista . . kthsa/mene
up to this time, Hdt.8.106; me/gistos h)/. dia/plous Th.6.31: with Comp., h)/dh . . lo/gou me/zwn Hdt.2.148. joined with other words of time, h)/. nu=n
now already, Il.1.456, A.Ag.1578; nu=n h)/. Od.23.54, S.Ant.801 (anap.); h)/. pote/ Il.1.260, S.Aj.1142, Ar.Nu.346; pot' h)/. A.Eu.50; h)/. pw/pote Eup.214, Pl.R.493d; pa/lai h)/. S.OC510 (lyr.); h)/. to/te
even then, Pl.R.417b; e)pei\ h)/. Od.4.260; ei) h)/. Il.22.52; to\ thni/k' h)/. S.OC440; to\ loipo\n h)/. Id.Ph.454; a)/llote h)/. polla/kis Pl.R.507a; h)/. ge even
now, D.19.52. of place, a)po\ tau/ths h)/. *ai)/guptos after this Egypt begins, Hdt.3.5, cf. 2.15,4.99, E.Hipp.1200; *fwkeu=sin h)/. o(/moros h( *boiwti/a e)sti/n Th.3.95. (In general, cf. Arist.Ph.222b7.)
h)/dh, h)/dhs, h)/dhsqa, v. *ei)/dw. h(/distos, h(di/wn, Sup. and Comp. of h(du/s.

h(/domai, Boeot. va(/d- [a_] Corinn. in BKT5(2).34, Dor. a(/d- [a_], Aeol. a)/d- [a_] Sapph.Supp.24.10: fut. h(sqh/somai S.OT453, Pl.Phdr. 233e, etc.: aor. 1 h(/sqhn (post-Homeric, v. infr.), also h)de/sqhn (sic) Hsch., Med. h(sa/mhn Od.9.353: (
swād-, cf. a(nda/nw, h(du/s):—
enjoy oneself, take one's pleasure, once in Hom., Od.l.c.; freq. in Hdt. and Att.:—Constr.: with part., h(/sato pi/nwn Od.l.c.; h(/sqh a)kou/sas he
was glad to have heard, Hdt.3.34; h(/doi' a)\n . . i)dou=sa A.Pr.758, cf. S. Ph.882; drw=ntes a(\n h(dw/meqa (sc. drw=ntes) Id.Aj.1085; oi(=' a)\n . . h(sqei/h labw/n Id.El.1325; h(/. qwpeuome/nous Ar.Ach.635, etc. c. dat., h(/desqai/ tini
to delight in or
at a thing or person, Hdt.1.69, al., Th.1.120, etc.; a(/pantes h(do/mesqa/ soi Ar.Eq.623 (lyr.): in aor., ironically, h(/sqhn a)peilai=s I
am amused at your threats, ib.696, cf.Nu.174: once c. gen., pw/matos h(/sqh he
enjoyed the draught, S.Ph.715 (lyr.). c. acc. and part., h(/sqhn pate/ra to\n a)mo\n eu)logou=nta/ se I
am pleased to hear you praising him, ib.1314; do/mous h(/detai plhroume/nous E.Fr.328.1. with neut. Adj., e(/teron h(/sqhn Ar.Ach.13; tou=q' h(/domai Id.Ra.748 (cod. R); h(/sqhn baia/ Id.Ach.2; braxe/a h(sqei=sa Th.3.40: c. acc. cogn., h(dona\s h(/desqai Pl.Phlb.63a, etc. folld. by a Prep., h(/desqai e)pi/ tini X.Cyr.8.4.11, Pl.Phlb.48b, etc.; u(pe/r tinos Lys.2.26; but pro\s o)li/gon h(sqei\s nautia=| for a little time, Arr.Epict.4.9.4. h(/domai o(/ti . . Ar.Nu.773. abs., w(s h(/domai kai\ xai/romai keu)frai/nomai Ar.Pax 291, cf. Plu.2.449a, etc.; esp. in part., as Adj.,
glad, delighted. h(dome/na yuxa=|, fwna=|, E.Fr.754 (lyr.), Ar.Av.236 (lyr.); to\ h(do/menon Plu.2.1025e, 1101f: freq. in dat., h(dome/noisi h)=n to\ gino/menon they were
pleased at . . , Hdt.8.10, cf. 9.46; e)a\n u(mi=n h(dome/nois (sc. h)=|) Antipho 6.8, cf. Pl.Phd.78b, La.187c; to\ h(do/menon kata\ sa/rka Epicur. Sent.4. Act., h(/dw
please, delight, c. acc. pers., aor., h(=se Anacr.148: so later pres., h(/dei Muson.Fr.18Bp.103 H.; h(/domen Men. Mon.38: aor. 1 h(=sa Ephipp.6.5 (s.v.l.), Ael.NA10.48, Hld.10.32, AP7 lemma (lalh=sai f.l. for a)ll' h(=sai）; ta\ h(/donta
joys, pleasures, opp. ta\ lupou=nta, Antipho Soph.Oxy.1364.116, cf. Pl.Ax.366a, Diog. Oen.29; to\ h(=don S.E.M.7.203.

h(dome/nws, Adv. of foreg.,
with joy, gladly, pra/ttein ti X.Cyr.8.4.9.

h(donh/, Dor. a(dona/ (or in Trag. chorus h(dona/ S.OT1339), h(, (h(/domai)
enjoyment, pleasure, first in Simon.71, S.l.c., Hdt.1.24, al.; prop. of sensual pleasures, ai( tou= sw/matos or peri\ to\ sw=ma h(., X.HG 4.8.22,6.1.4; ai( kata\ to\ sw=ma h(. Pl.R.328d; swmatikai\ h(. Arist.EN 1151a13; ai( peri\ po/tous kai\ peri\ e)dwda\s h(. Pl.R.389e; but also a)koh=s h(. Th.3.38; h( a)po\ tou= ei)de/nai h(. Pl.R.582b; of
malicious pleasure, h( e)pi\ toi=s tw=n fi/lwn kakoi=s, e)pi\ tai=s loidori/ais h(., Id.Phlb.50a, D.18.138; h(donh=| h(ssa=sqai, h(donai=s xari/zesqai, to give way
to pleasure, Th. l.c., Pl.Lg.727c; ko/tera a)lhqei/h xrh/somai h)\ h(donh=; shall I speak truly or
so as to humour you? Hdt.7.101; ei) u(mi=n h(donh\ tou= h(gemoneu/ein ib.160; h(. ei)se/rxetai/ tivi ei) . . one feels
pleasure at the thought that . . , Id.1.24; h(donh\n e)/xein tino/s to be
satisfied with . . , S.OC 1604; h(donh\n e)/xei, fe/rei, Pherecr.145.2, Alex.263.6; h(donh\ i)de/sqai (like qau=ma i)de/sqai), of a temple, Hdt.2.137: with Preps. in Adv. sense, dai/mosin pro\s h(donh/n A.Pr.494; o(\ me/n e)sti pro\s h(. D.18.4; pro\s h(. le/gein to speak so
as to please another, S.El.921, Th.2.65; dhmhgorei=n D.4.38; ou) pro\s h(. oi( h)=n ta\ a)ggello/mena Hdt.3.126; pa/nta pro\s h(. a)kou/ontas D.8.34; later pro\s h(donh=s ei)=nai/ tini Parth.8.8, Lib. Or.12.1; kaq' h(donh\n klu/ein S.Tr.197; kaq' h(donh/n [e)sti/] moi c. inf., A.Pr.263; kaq' h(. ti dra=n, poiei=n, Th.2.37,53; kaq' h(dona\s tw=| dh/mw| ta\ pra/gmata e)ndido/nai ib.65; e)n h(donh=| e)sti/ tini it is
a pleasure or
delight to another, Hdt.4.139; folld. by inf., E.IT494; by acc. et inf., Hdt.7.15; e)n h(donh=| e)/xein tina/s to take
pleasure in them, Th.3.9; e)n h(donh=| a)/rxontes, opp. oi( luphroi/, Id.1.99; meq' h(donh=s Id.4.19; u(f' h(donh=s S.Ant.648, etc.; u(po\ th=s h(. Alex.24, 110.23: as dat. modi, h(dona=|
with pleasure, S. OT1339 (lyr.), cf. Hdt.2.137 (f.l.). concrete,
a pleasure, S.El. 873 (pl.), Ar.Nu.1072 (pl.); h(donai\ traghma/twn
sweetmeats, Sopat. 17. Pl.,
desires after pleasure, pleasant lusts, X.Mem.1.2.23, Ep.Tit.3.3, al. in Ion. Philosophers,
taste, flavour, usu. joined with xroih/, Diog.Apoll.5, Anaxag.4 (pl.), cf. Arist.PA660b9, Thphr. HP4.4.7, LXX Nu.11.8, Eudem. ap. Ath.9.369f, Mnesith. ap. eund.8.357f.

h(doniko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for h(donh/,
pleasurable, Chrysipp. Tyan. ap. Ath. 14.647d; bi/os h(. Arist. ap. D.L.5.31. oi( h(. the
voluptuaries, of the Cyrenaic school of philosophers, Ceb.13, Ath.13.588a; h( h(. ai(/resis Gal.Libr.Propr.16; e)pi\ swfrosu/nhs ou)xi\ h(. le/getai o( u(perba/llwn a)ll' a)ko/lastos Asp.in EN53.19. Adv. -kw=s Procl. in Prm. p.521S.

h(dono-k<*>ra^si/a, h(,
rule of pleasure, Aristeas 278.

h(/g-plhktos, Dor. a(dono/plaktos, on,
pleasure-struck, Cerc.6.10—also h(g-plh/c, h=gos, o(, h(, fu/sis Timo 58.4.

h)=dos, eos, to/ (Aeolic, acc. to Hdn.Gr.2.904),
delight, pleasure, ou)de/ ti daito\s e)sqlh=s e)/ssetai h)=. Il.1.576; a)lla\ mi/nunqa h(me/wn e)/ssetai h)=. 11.318; a)lla\ ti/ moi tw=n h)=.; what
delight have I therefrom? 18.80; au)ta\r e)moi\ ti/ to/d' h)=.; Od.24.95, cf. Theoc.16.40, A.R.3.314.—In this sense almost confined to Ep. and nom. sg.; in late Prose, pro\s to\ h)=. Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.20. = o)/cos,
vinegar, used as a flavouring, tou=to mo/non *)attikoi\ tw=n h(dusma/twn h)=. kalou=si Ath.2.67c, cf. Poll.6.65, Eust.1417.19, prob. l. in Antiph.134.4—Dor. form a(=dos (in both senses), EM18.12, Hsch. s.v. ga=dos.
h)= d' o(/s, for e)/fh e)kei=nos, v. h)mi/.
h(dosu/nh, h(,= h(donh/, Dor. a(dosu/na_, Hsch.

h(du/-bi^os [u^], on,
sweetening life: ta\ h(. a name of certain
cakes, Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath.14.647c.
living pleasantly, Ptol.Tetr. 162, Vett. Val.18.29, Sch.Ar.V.504.

h(du-bo/hs, Dor. a(du^bo/a_s, ou, o(,
sweet-sounding, a(dubo/a| . . au)lw=n pneu/mati E.Ba.127; h(. ko/ssufos AP 9.396 (Paul. Sil.); do/nac APl.4.231 (Anyte).

h(du/-gaion, to/,= si/kuon,
Heraclid.Tarent. ap. Ath.2.74b（h(dune/on isf.l.in Hsch.).

h(du/-ga^mos, on,
sweetening marriage, ke/rdos AP5.242 (Maced.).

h(du-ge/lws, wtos, o(, h(,
sweetly laughing, h.Hom.19.37, AP5.134.

h(du-glwssi/a, h(,
sweetness of tongue, PMag.Leid.V.20.

h(du/-glwssos, Dor. a(d-, on,
sweet-tongued, boa/ Pi.O.13.100.

h(du-gnw/mwn, on, gen. onos, (gnw/mh)
of pleasant mind, opp. h(dusw/matos, X.Smp.8.30.

h(du/-deipnos, on,
dainty-supping, name of a parasite, Alciphr.3.68 tit.

h(du/-qroos, on, contr. h(du/-qrous, oun,
sweet-strained, *mou=sa E.El.703 (lyr.); *dio/nusos AP9.524.8: Dor. a(d-, ki/qaris Pae.Delph.13.

h(du/-karpos, on,
with sweet fruit, Pherecyd.178J.; de/ndron Thphr.HP4.4.5.

h(du-kre/ws, wn, gen. w,
of sweet flesh, Arist.HA564a3,al.: Comp. -krew/teros Id.GA786a15.
h(du/-kwmos, o(, name of a kind of au)/lhsis, Trypho ap. Ath.14.618c; of a dance, Poll.4.100.
h(du-la/los [a^], on,= h(dulo/gos, fqo/ggoi IG12(7).95.4 (Amorgos).

*(hdu/leios [u^], a, on,
of or
connected with Hedylus, ku/lic IG11(2).154 B50 (Delos, iii B.C.).

h(du^l-i/zw, (h(du/los)
flatter, wheedle, Men.28.

h(du^l-ismo/s, o(,
flattering, Eust.1417.21, Phot.

h(du^log-e/w,
speak sweet things, tini Phryn.Com.3.4.

h(du^log-i/a, h(,
jesting, in pl., Ath.4.164e.

h(du^/log-os, Dor. a(d-, Aeol. a)d-, on,
sweetspeaking, sweet-voiced, Sapph.Oxy.1787 Fr.11.4; sofi/a Cratin.238, Timo 67.4; lu/rai molpai/ te Pi.O.6.96; *xa/ris AP5.136 (Mel.); glw=ssa ib.7.159（Nicarch.). of persons,
flattering, fawning, E.Hec. 132 (anap.): as Subst.,
jester, Ath.4.165b. (In signf. 1 proparox., in 2 parox.)
h(du/los [u^], h, on, Dim. of h(du/s, only as pr. n. (exc. A.D.Adv.172.1, EM742.52).

h(du^-lu/rhs [u^], ou, o(,
singing sweetly to the lyre, *pi/ndaros AP11.370 (Maced.): Dor. a(dulu/ras, epith. of Apollo, Philol.71.6 (Argos, iv B.C.).

h(du^-ma^nh/s, e/s,
full of sweet frenzy, Nonn.D.7.269.

h(du^-me/leia, h(,
sweetness of melody, Vett.Val.3.20 (pl.).
h(du^/-meli,= melisso/fulon, prob. in Ps.Dsc. 3.104.

h(du^-meli/fqoggos, on,
of honey-sweet voice, *simwni/dhs AP 9.571 (acc. to Planudes).

h(du^-mi^gh/s, Dor. a(d-, e/s,
sweetly-mixed, xo/ndros ib.7.736 (Leon.).

h(/du^mos, Dor. a(/d- on, poet. for h(du/s,
sweet, pleasant, usu. epith. of sleep (v. nh/dumos, for which it is v.l. in Il.2.2, Od.4.793, 12.311, cf. Hsch. s.v. nh/dumos), h.Merc.241, 449, Antim.74, Simon.79, A.R.2.407; lo/goi Epich.179; oi)=nos Orph.Fr.261: irreg. Sup. -e/statos Alcm. 137.

h(dun-te/on,
one must season, Alex.186.4.

h(dun-th/r, h=ros, o(,
seasoning, a(/les Eratosth. ap. Hsch., Poll.6.71.

h(dun-th/rios, a, on,
sweetening, soothing, Sch.E.Hec.535.

h(dun-tiko/s, h/, o/n,
fit for seasoning, Arist.Pr.923a29. -kh/ te/xnh an art
of seasoning, Pl.Sph. 223a.

h(dun-to/s, h/, o/n,
seasoned, pi/ssa, ste/ar, Hp.Mul.1.88, 2.205.

h(du/n-w, aor. 1 h(/du_na Pl.Tht.175e, Diph.24:—Pass., aor. 1 h(du/nqhn Antiph.90: pf. h(/dusmai Pl. (v. infr.), inf. h(du/nqai Phot.: (h(du/s):—
season a dish, c. acc., [ko/kkugas] Epich.164; o)/yon Pl.Tht.l.c.; kro/mmuon . . ou) mo/non si=ton a)lla\ kai\ poto\n h(du/nei X.Smp.4.8;
make pleasant, geu=sin, oi)/nous, Thphr.Od.9,10; even of salt (cf. h(donh/ 11), Arist.Mete.359a34. metaph., h(. qw=pas lo/gous Pl.Tht.l.c.; o( poihth\s h(. to\ a)/topon Arist.Po.1460b2:—Pass., th\n h(dusme/nhn mou=san parade/ch| e)n me/lesin Pl.R.607a, cf. Arist.Po.1449b28, Pol.1340b17, D.H.Comp. 25; tou\s lo/gous h(du/nesqai a)/n ti u(po\ tw=n fqo/ggwn X.Smp.6.4.
delight, coax, gratify, ko/lac h(/dune/ tina lo/gw| Diph.24; h(. th\n a)koh/n D.H.Comp.14:—Pass., Timo17.
h(du/-odmos [u^], Dor. a(d-, on,= h(du/osmos, oi)=nos Hp.Mul.1.34; e)/ar Simon.74.

h(du-oini/a, h(,
sweetness of wine, Hp.Morb.4.34, Gp.5.2.19.

h(du/-oinos, Dor. a(d-, on,
producing sweet wine, a)/mpeloi X.An.6.4.6; -o/teros karpo/s Thphr.CP3.15.1.
containing sweet wine, lepasta/ Apolloph.6. h(du/oinoi, oi(,
dealers in sweet wine, X.Vect.5.3.

h(du-o/neiros, on,
causing sweet dreams, i)sxa/des Hermipp.63.16.

h(du/-osmos, on,
sweet-smelling, fragrant, strw/mata Ar.Fr.695. h(du/osmon, to/,= mi/nqh,
green mint, Mentha viridis, Thphr.HP7.7.1, Str.8.3.14; h(. a)/grion
wild mint, M. longifolia, Dsc.3.34. [As trisyll., AP11.413 (Ammian.).]

h(du-o/fqalmos, on,
sweet-eyed, Hsch. s.v. meli/glhnos.

h(du^pa/q-eia [pa^], h(,
pleasant living, luxury, X.Cyr.7.5.74, Hp.Ep. 17, Plu.2.6b, al., Sor.1.34, Luc.DMort.10.8: in pl., Ath.4.165e, Just.Nov.105.1; title of work by Archestratus, Ath.1.4e.

h(du^paq-e/w,
live pleasantly, enjoy oneself, X.Cyr.1.5.1, Jul.Mis.342b; h(. a)po/ tinos X.Oec.5.2.

h(du^pa/q-hma, atos, to/,
enjoyment, sarko/s AP9.496 (<Ath.>).

h(du^paq-h/s, e/s, (paqei=n)
living pleasantly, enjoying oneself, luxurious, Antiph.91, Aristox.Fr.Hist.15.
h(du/-pneustos, on,= h(du/pnoos, AP5.117 (Marc. Arg.).

h(du-pnoi/+s, i/+dos, h(,
ox-tongue, Helminthia echioides, Plin.HN20.75; to be restored in Hsch. for h(dupnoi/+dhs. -pnoos, Dor. a(d-, on, contr. h(du/-pnous, oun,
sweet-breathing, au)=rai E.Med.840 (lyr.); of musical sound, Pi.O.13.22,I.2.25; of auspicious dreams, S.El.480 (lyr.).
sweet-smelling, fragrant, lepasth/ Telecl.24 (lyr.); xw=ros AP9.564 (Nic.); kro/kos IG14.607e (Carales); o(/rmos (necklace) Dsc.1.99. v. h(du/xrous 11.

h(du/-polis, Dor. a(d-, o(, h(,
dear to the people, S.OT510 (lyr.).
h(du-porfu/ra [u^], h(, a kind of porfu/ra, Arist.Fr.304.

h(du-po/ths, ou,
fond of drinking, epith. of Dionysus, AP9.524.8, cf. Hedyl. ap.Ath.4.176d, Man.4.493.
furnishing sweet drink, a)/mpelos Nonn.D.12.249.

h(du-po/tis, idos, h(,
something that makes drink taste pleasant, name of a cup, Epig.5, IG11(2).110.26 (Delos, iii B.C.), SIG2 588.7 (ib., ii B.C.), Semusap.Ath.11.469c:—Dim. h(du-poti/dion, IG7.303 (Oropus, iii B.C.), 11(2).203B29 (Delos, iii B.C.):—also h(du-po/tion, Cratin.Jun.14 (s.v.l.), IG22.1534.220 (iii B.C.), al.

h(du/-potos, on,
sweet to drink, oi)=nos Od.2.340, 3.391, etc.; also of a cup, h(. ku/lic Philol. 72.547 (Olbia, v B.C.).

h(du-pro/swpos, on,
of sweet countenance, xo/ndros Matro Conv.102.
h(du/-rabdon, to/,= kinna/mwmon, Hsch.

h(du/s, h(dei=a, h(du/, h(du\s a)u+tmh/ (as fem.) once in Hom., Od.12.369: Dor. a(du/s [a_], Boeot. neut. vadou/ (written ga/dou) cj. in Corinn.17 (cf. pr. n. vadiou/logos IG7.2788.3), Elean ba_du/s (q.v.): irreg. acc. a(de/a for h(du/n Theoc.20.44, for h(dei=an ib.[8], Mosch.3.82: Ion. fem. h(de/a^, Dor. a(de/a: Comp. h(di/wn [i_], Sup. h(/distos Od.13.80, etc.; also h(du/teros Thphr.HP3.2.1, Ps.-Phoc.195, AP9.247 (Phil.); h(du/tatos ib.11.298.7, Plu.2.98e.
pleasant to the taste, dei=pnon Od.20.391; of wine, 3.51, 9.197, etc.; to the smell, a)mbrosi/hn . . h(du\ ma/la pnei/ousan 4.446; o)dmh\ d' h(dei=a a)po\ krhth=ros o)dw/dei 9.210; to the hearing, di/dou d' h(dei=an a)oidh/n 8.64; au)dh/ Hes.Th.40; feelings or states, h(. u(/pnos Il.4.131, Od.1.364, al.; koi=tos 19.510; h(du\ ma/la knw/ssousa 4.809; h(du\s mu=qos, opp. a)lgeino/s, S.Ant.12: c. inf., fe/ggos h(/dion drakei=n A.Ag.602; h(du\s a)kou=sai [lo/gos] Pl.Men.81d, cf. Ar.V.503; later h(. a)kousqh=nai D.H.Comp.9; ei) . . to/de pa=si fi/lon kai\ h(du\ ge/noito Il.4.17, cf. 7.387: c. inf., ou)k a)\n e)moi/ ge meta\ fresi\n h(du\ ge/noito zwe/men Od.24.435; a(du/ ti qarsale/ais to\n makro\n tei/nein bi/on e)lpi/si A.Pr.536, etc.; so ou)/ moi h(/dio/n e)sti le/gein I had
rather not . . , Hdt.2.46: neut. as Subst., to\ di' a)koh=s te kai\ di' o)/yews h(du/ Pl.Hp.Ma.298a; memigme/non tw=| semnw=| to\ h(. D.H.Comp.1; ta\ h(.
pleasures, Th.5.105, Pl.Grg.495a, etc.: neut. as Adv., e)p' au)tw=| h(du\ ge/lassan
merrily, Il.2.270, etc.; a(du\ de\ kai\ tu\ suri/sdes
sweetly, Theoc.1.2. after Hom., of persons,
welcome, S.OT82, Ph.530 (Sup.), El.929; ironically, h(/distos . . desmw/ths e)/sw qakei= Id.Aj.105; like eu)h/qhs,
innocent, simple, w(s h(. ei)= Pl.Grg.491e, Plu.Art.17, etc.: Sup., w)= h(/diste
my good friend (iron.), Pl.R.348c, al.
well-pleased, glad, h(di/ous e)/sesq' a)kou/santes D.23.64; h(di/ous tai=s e)lpi/sin Plu.Cam.32; th\n gnw/mhn h(di/w pro\s to\ me/llon poiei=n to open
a pleasanter view of the future, Id.Fab.5. Adv. h(de/ws
pleasantly, with pleasure, kaqeu/dein Pl.Cri.43b; eu(/dein S.Tr.175; dra=n Id.Ant.70; o(ra=n tina E.IA1122; bi/oton a)/gein Id.Cyc.453; labei=n, de/xesqai, Ar.Eq.440, X.Mem.1.2.4; h(. a)\n e)roi/mhn I would
gladly ask, should
like to ask, D.18.64; h(. e)/xein ti to be
pleased or
content with, E.Ion647 (but i(/n' h( do/khsis *cou=qon h(. e)/xh| ib.1602); ou)de\ po/twn h(. ei)=xon had no
inclination to drink, Hp.Epid.3.13; tinos, of a person, Macho ap.Ath.13.577e; h(. e)/xein pro\s a(/pantas to be
suave, courteous towards . . , Isoc.1.20; tini D.5.15; h(. e)/xein, of things, to be
pleasant, E.IA483; h(. e)/moige ka)lgeinw=s a(/ma S.Ant.436; iron., h(. ge '
prettily said', Pl.Hp.Ma.300c: Comp. h(/dion Lys.7.40, Pherecr.67, etc.: Sup., h(/dista menta)\n h)/kousa Pl.Tht.183d, etc. in Hom. neut. h(du/ as Adv. (v. supr.), cf. h(/domai. [h(/di^on E.Supp.1101 (s.v.l.), Ar. V.298 (lyr.), Alex.25.6, but h(di/on（a） [i_] E.Cyc.251, etc.] (Skt.
svādús, Lat.
suāvis.）

h(du/sa^ron, to/,
axe-weed, Bonaveria Securidaca, Dsc.3.130.

h(/dusma, atos, to/, (h(du/nw)
relish, seasoning, sauce, Ar.Eq.678, V. 496, Pl.R.332d, X.Mem.3.14.5, Thphr.CP6.4.6, etc.; of vinegar, Ath.2.67c: metaph., ou) . . h(du/smati xrh=tai a)ll' w(s e)de/smati toi=s e)piqe/tois Arist.Rh.1406a19; h( melopoii/+a me/giston tw=n h(. Id.Po.1450b16, cf. Jul.Or.7.207b: in pl.,
spices, aromatics, Hp.Mul.2.202, Dsc.1.61, Plu.2.995c.
h(dusma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Telecl.1.11.

h(dusmato-qh/kh, h(,
spice-box, Poll.10.93.

h(dusmato/-lhros, on,
absurdly dainty, o)ya/ria Archestr.Fr.45.18.

h(dusmo/s, o(, (h(du/nw)
a sweet savour, sweetness, LXXEx.30.34.

h(du/stomos,
jocosus, Gloss.

h(du^sw/ma^tos [u^], on,
of sweet form, opp. h(dugnw/mwn, X.Smp.8.30.
h(du/terai: ai( trugo/nes, Hsch.

h(du/ths [u^], htos, h(, （h(du/s)
sweetness, Sch.Ar.Av.222.

h(du^-to/kos, on,
producing sweets, Nonn.D.3.150.

h(du^-fa^h/s, Dor. a(d-, e/s,
sweet-shining, h)/lektros D.P.317; plinqi/s AP6.295 (Phan.).

h(du^-fa/rugc [a^], uggos, o(, h(,
sweet to the throat, prob. in Philox.2.18.

h(du^/-fqoggos, on,
sweet-voiced, te/ttiges Hsch. s.v. h)xhtai/.

h(du^/-frwn, onos, o(, h(,
sweet-minded, AP9.525.8.

h(du^-fwni/a, h(,
sweetness of sound, Babr.9.3, Alciphr.3.12, etc.

h(du^/-fwnos, Dor. a(d-, Aeol. a)d-, on,
sweet-voiced, Sapph.61; o)/rtuc Pratin.Lyr.4, cf. Aristaenet.1.10.

h(du^-xa^rh/s, e/s,
sweetly joyous, AP3.18 (Inscr. Cyzic.).

h(du^/-xroos, on, contr. h(du^/-xrous, oun,
of sweet complexion, pro/swpa IG14.2040.7; h(du/xroun mu/ron a
fragrant perfume, Dsc.1.58; to\ h(. Androm. ap. Gal.14.52, Alex.Trall.7.3;
hedychrum, Cic.Tusc.3.19.46. h(du/xrous, also h(du/pnous, o(, a lamb not yet weaned, Phot.

h(/dw, v. h(/domai 11. h)dw/: i)=ris, h)/goun to/con, Hsch. h)e/, v. h)/,
or, whether.

h)e/, exclam.
ah! A.Th.966, 980, Supp.831 (all lyr.). h)=|e, h)/|ei, v. ei)=mi (ibo). h)ei/dhs, h)ei/dh, v. ei)/dw. h)e/lios, o(, v. h(/lios. h)eliw=tis, v. h(liw/ths.

h)ere/qomai, Ep. for a)ei/romai, only in 3pl. pres. and impf.,
hang floating or
waving in the air, ai)gi/da . . , th=s e(kato\n qu/sanoi . . h)ere/qontai Il.2.448; of a flight of locusts, 21.12; of flying-fish, Opp.H.1.435; e(\c xei=res e(ka/stw| -ontai A.R.1.944: metaph., o(plote/rwn a)ndrw=n fre/nes h)ere/qontai young men's minds
turn with every wind, Il.3.108.—The form a)ere/qontai in Hsch., cf. EM421.6.

h)e/rios, h, on, (h)=ri)
early, at or
with early morn, h)eri/h d' a)ne/bh me/gan ou)rano/n Il.1.497, cf. 557, 3.7 (Sch. e)arinai/), Od.9.52, A.R.3.417.
later, (h)h/r)
misty, dimly seen, Arat.349, A.R.1.580, 4.1239.
high in air, h). *gera/neia Simon.114; of birds, Opp.C.1.380, H.3.203; of flying-fish, ib.1.430; a)/grai AP6.180 (Arch.), cf. Nonn.D.7.315, al.
airy, air-like, pu=r Hp.Vict.1.10.

h)ero-di/nhs [i_], ew, o(,
wheeling in mid air, ai)eto/s AP9.223 (Bianor).

h)ero-eidh/s, e/s, Ion.and Ep. for a)er-, which is not found,
misty, cloudy, dark (esp. in Od.), e)p' h)eroeide/a po/nton Od.2.263, etc.; spe/os h). 12.80, cf. 13.103; pe/trh, of Scylla<*>s cave, 12.233: neut. as Adv.,
in the far distance, dimly, o(/sson d' h)eroeide\s a)nh\r i)/den Il.5.770: h). nefe/lh Hes. Th.757; pnoiai/ Orph.H.38.22.—Ep. word, h). au)gai/ Arist.Col.792b8: Comp., u(/dwr pa/ntwn -e/steron Arr.Ind.6.3.

h)ero/-eis, essa, en, Ion. and Ep. for a)ero/eis (q.v., cf. cj. in Telest.1.12)
cloudy, murky, *ta/rtaros Il.8.13, al., cf. Hes.Th.119; zo/fos Il.15.191, etc.; h)ero/enta ke/leuqa
the murky road (i.e. death), Od.20.64; later h). i)/aspis D.P. 724; mo/lubdos Man.6.391;
livid, xroih/ Nic.Th.257. epith. of o)/nagros,= taxu/s, acc. to Sch., Opp.C.3.183.

h)e/ro-qen, Ion. and Ep. for a)er-,
from air, APl.4.107 (Jul.).

h)ero-mh/khs, es, Ep. for a)er-,
high as heaven, Orph.A.924.

h)ero/-miktos, on, (mei/gnumi)
mingling with air, fwnai/ Id.Fr.297b2 (in form a)ero/-).

h)ero/-morfos, on, (morfh/)
airformed, au)=rai Id.H.81.6, cf. 16.1.

h)ero/-plagktos, on,
wandering in mid air, ib.7.8, Man.4.509.
h)ero/-poitan: e)pitimw=san, and h)ero/-pompa: kata\ to\n a)e/ra faino/mena, Hsch.
h)e/ropos, o(, Ion. for a)e/roy, Ant.Lib.18.3.

h)ero-feggh/s, e/s,
shining in the air, *zeu/s Orph.H.20.2.
h)ero-foi/ths, ou, o(,= h)ero/foitos, Ion Lyr.10, Orph.L.45, Nonn.D.24.79, al.

h)ero-foi=tis, idos, h(,
walking in darkness, coming unseen, *)erinu/s Il.9.571, 19.87.
air-traversing, of the moon, Orph.H.9.2; me/lissa Ps.Phoc.171.

h)ero/-foitos, on, (foita/w)
air-wandering, fu/sis, of birds, ib.125; oi)=stros Orph.A.47; of cuttle-fish, Opp.H.3.166 (cf. h)e/ra temnousi 1.427); of the moon, Max.485, etc.

h)ero/-fwnos, on,
sounding through air, loud-voiced, kh/rukes Il.18.505 (s.v.l., i(erofw/nwn cj. Ahrens); ge/ranoi Opp.H.1.621.
h)erti/zw,= a)erta/zw, Hsch. h)h/n, exclam.,= h)\ h)/, Men.Per. 15. h)h/r, v. a)h/r.
h)qa/dios [a^], on, poet. for h)qa/s, Opp.C.1.448.
h)qai=os, a, on, Dor. for h)qei=os, Pi.I.2.48.

h)qa^le/os, h, on, (h)=qos)
accustomed, eu)nai/ Opp.C.2.307; [tau=roi] ib. 88, cf. Epigr.Gr.1035.23 (Pergam.).
h)qa/nion, to/, Dim. of h)qmo/s, Hellanic.53J.; cf. h)qh/nion.

h)qa/s, a/dos, o(, h(, (h)=qos 11)
accustomed to a thing,
acquainted with it, c. gen., h). ei)mi/ pws tw=n th=sde mu/qwn S.El.372; qh/rhs Opp.H.4.122; tw=n xwri/wn Ael.NA7.6: c. dat., pe/trais ib.9.36. abs.,
inured, accustomed, Hp.Mul.1.1; tw=n ga\r h)qa/dwn fi/lwn ne/oi . . eu)piqe/steroi E. Andr.818; of animals,
tame, [o)/rniqes] h).
domestic fowls, Ar.Av.271; of decoy-birds, Plu.Sull.28; h). sko/mbroi Ael.NA14.1. of things,
usual, customary, ni/kh APl.5.354; pa/gai AP9.264 (Apollonid. or Phil.): as neut., ta\ kaina/ g' e)k tw=n h)qa/dwn h(di/on' e)sti/ E.Cyc.250; toi=s h)qa/si li/an toi=s t' a)rxai/ois e)ndiatribein Ar.Ec.584, cf. 151.

h)qei=os, also h)qai=os, a, on,
trusty, honoured, term of address used to express respect, h)qei=e Il.6.518, al., Hes.Sc.103: periphr., h)qei/h kefalh/ Il.23.94; a)lla/ min h)qei=on kale/w Od.14.147; cei=non e)mo\n h)qai=on Pi.I.2.48; h)qai=oi
trusty friends, Antim.22. (Cf. h)=qos.)
h)/|qeos, o(, h(, Att. for h)i/qeos (q.v.).

h)q-e/w, aor. 1 h)/qhsa （h)/qisa codd.), gloss on h)=sa, v. h)/qw:—Med., aor. 1 h)qhsa/mhn Nic.Al.324: (h)/qw):
-sift, strain, Nic.l.c.:—Pass.,
to be strained, to\ h)qou/menon Pl.Cra.402d; [oi)=nos] h)qhme/nos Epil.6; xruso\s h)qhme/nos dia\ pe/tras
filtered through, Pl.Ti.59b: metaph., e)k tetrhme/nhs [th\n r(h=sin] h)qei=
lets it trickle out, Herod.3.33.

h)/q-hma, atos, to/,
that which is sifted or
strained, Dieuch. ap. Orib.4.7.26.
h)q-h/nion: h)qa/nion, Hsch.

h)/q-hsis, ews, h(,
riddling, li/qwn IG4.1485.124 (Epid.); prob. l. for h)/qisis, Arist.Pr.870b18.
h)q-hth/r, h=ros, o(,= h)qmo/s, Marc.Sid.76.
h)q-hth/rion, to/,= h)qmo/s, Str.3.2.9.

h)q-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
capable of being strained, of wines, Thphr.CP6.16.6.

h)qi^k-eu/omai,
speak ethically, Phoeb.Fig.1.1, Sch.Il.7.408.

h)qi^k-o/s, h/, o/n, (h)=qos 11)
moral, opp. dianohtiko/s, Arist.EN1103a5, al.; ta\ h)qika/
a treatise on morals, Id.Pol.1295a36, cf. Democr.4a; oi( h). lo/goi Phld. Herc.1251.13; to\ h). filosofi/as, opp. fusiko/n, dialektiko/n, D.L. Prooem.18; h( h). filosofi/a Str.1.1.18; h( h). alone, Ph.1.370.
showing moral character, expressive thereof, le/cis Arist.Rh.1408a11; pw=s . . tou\s lo/gous h). poihte/on ib.1391b22, cf. 1395b13; h). tragw|di/a Id.Po.1456a1; h( *)ilia\s paqhtiko/n, h( de\ *)odu/sseia h). ib.1459b15; h). me/lh, a(rmoni/ai, Id.Pol.1341b34, 1342a3 (Sup.); ou)k e)/stin o( au)lo\s h)qiko/n, a)lla\ . . o)rgiastiko/n ib.1341a21; h). grafeu/s, a)galmatopoio/s, ib.1340a38; h)qikh\ h( e)n o)fqalmoi=s
the expression of character by the eyes, Philostr. Gym.25. Adv. -kw=s, lekte/on (opp. a)podeiktikw=s) Arist.Rh.1418a39; h). meidia/sas laughing
expressively, Plu.Brut.51; e)pikrotei=n to\ metaka/rpion Aristaenet.1.27;
in character, Demetr.Eloc.216;
naturally, ib.297.
tactful, Plu.2.73f (Comp.). Adv. -kw=s Id.Alex.52.
h)/qi^sis, v. h)/qhsis. h)qma/rion, to/, Dim. of h)qmo/s, Hsch.

h)qmoeidh/s, e/s,
like a strainer, perforated, Hero Spir.1.8, Plu.2.699a; koili/ai Aret.SD2.3. to\ h). o)stou=n the
ethmoid or
perforated bone at the root of the nose, Gal.UP11.12: more freq. in pl., ta\ -eidh=, with or without o)sta=, ib.8.7; h). decamenai/, of the kidneys, prob. in Ph.2.244 (ai(mo-, i)sqmo- codd., cf. Gal.Nat.Fac.1.15). Adv. -dw=s Ruf.Anat.52.

h(qmo/s, SIG2 (Sigeum, vi B.C.), Hdn.Gr.1.543, in codd. usu. (but perh. wrongly) h)qmo/s, o(, (h)/qw)
strainer, colander, SIG l.c., E.Fr. 374, IG22.1416.11, 4.39.20, Gal.Nat.Fac.1.15; esp.
wine-strainer, Pherecr.41; part of an eel-trap, Arist.HA534a22; of the eyelashes, X.Mem.1.4.6; prov., tw=| h)qmw=| a)ntlei=n, of fruitless toil, Arist.Oec. 1344b25. h). sxoi/ninos,= khmo/s 111, Cratin.132, cf. AP9.482.23 (Agath.).
sluice or
weir (?), IG11(2).287 A75 (Delos, iii B.C.).
h)qmw/dhs, es,= h)qmoeidh/s, Sch.Ar.V.99.

h)qogra^f-e/w,
paint or
describe character, Marcellin.Vit. Thuc.50.

h)qo/gra^f-os, o(,
painter of character, Arist.Po.1450a28.

h)qolog-e/w,
express characteristically, gone/wn pa/qh LXX 4 Ma.15.4:— Pass., kwmw|di/a -oume/nh comedy
of manners, Longin.9.15.

h)qolog-i/a, h(,
painting of character, esp. by mimic gestures (cf. xarakthrismo/s), Posidon. ap. Sen.Ep.95.65, Quint.1.9.3, Suet.Gramm.4 (pl.).

h)qo/log-os, on,
painting character by mimic gestures (cf. biolo/gos), of dramatic and mimic performers, D.S.20.63, Cic.Orat.2.59.242, Ath.1.20a; of Socrates, Timo62.
h)qono/h, coined as etym. of *)aqhna=, Pl.Cra.407b.

h)qopoi-e/w,
mould the character of a person, to\n qeath/n Plu.Per.2; th\n yuxh/n S.E.M.6.30.
express or
delineate character, D.H. Lys.19: c. acc., to\ sxh=ma th=s gunaiko/s Aps.p.322 H.

h)qopoi-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
expressive of character. Adv. -kw=s Eust.1955.54.

h)qopoi-i/a, h(,
formation of character, Str.2.5.26 (pl.), Gal.15.97.
delineation of character, Phld.Po.5.9 (pl.), Str.14.1.41, D.H.Lys.8, Isoc.11 (pl.), Hermog.Prog.9, Aphth.Prog.11, etc.

h)qopoi-o/s, o/n,
forming character, h). to\ qermo/n Arist.Pr.955a32; me/lh S.E.M.6.36; paideu/seis Plu.Them. 2; to\ h).,= foreg. 1, Id.2.660c.

h)=qos, eos, to/ (cf. e)/qos),
an accustomed place: hence, in pl.,
haunts or
abodes of animals, meta/ t' h)/qea kai\ nomo\n i(/ppwn Il.6.511; [su/as] e)/rcan kata\ h)/qea koimhqh=nai Od.14.411; of lions, Hdt.7.125; of fish, Opp.H.1.93; of
the abodes of men, Hes.Op.167, 525, Hdt.1.15, 157, A.Supp.64 (lyr.), E.Hel.274, Pl.Lg.865e, Arist.Mu.398b33; e)/legon e)c h)qe/wn to\n h(/lion a)natei=lai away from his
accustomed place, Hdt. 2.142; of plants, Callistr.Stat.7: metaph., with play on signf. 11, Pl.Phdr.277a.
custom, usage: in pl.,
manners, customs, Hes.Op.137, Th.66, Hdt.2.30,35, 4.106, Th.2.61; tro/poi kai\ h)/qh Pl. Lg.896c; e)qre/yw *ce/rchn e)n toi=s au)toi=s h)/. ib.695e; fqei/rousin h)/qh xrh/sq' o(mili/ai kakai/ PHib.1.7.94 (E.Fr.1024 = Men.218); toi=s h)/qesin a(plou=s D.S.5.21.
disposition, character, e)pi/klopon h)=qos Hes.Op. 67,78; h)=. e)mfue/s Pi.O.11(10).21; a)ki/xhta h)/., of Zeus, A.Pr.187; tou)mo\n h)=. paideu/ein S.Aj.595; w)= miaro\n h)=. Id.Ant.746; to\ th=s po/lews h)=. Isoc.2.31; belti/wn th=s po/lews to\ h)=. D.20.14; esp.
moral character, opp. dia/noia, Arist.EN1139a1; as the result of habit, to\ pa=n h)=. dia\ e)/qos Pl.Lg.792e, cf. Arist.EE1220a39; h)=. a)nqrw/pw| dai/mwn Heraclit.119; h)=. phgh\ bi/ou Stoic. ap. Stob.2.7.1; th=s yuxh=s, th=s gnw/mhs, Pl.R.400d, D.61.16: freq. opp. pa/qos, Arist.Rh.1356a23 (pl.), etc.; h)qw=n te kai\ paqw=n mi/mhsis D.H.Pomp.3; to\ h)=. pra=os Pl.Phdr.243c: less freq. in dat., a)gorai=os tw=| h)/. Thphr.Char.6.2, cf. Inscr.Magn.164.3 (i/ii A.D.): pl.,
traits, characteristics, Pl.R.402d, Arist.EN1144b4 (in sg., to\ th=s a)ndrei/as h)=. Pl.Lg.836d): seldom in pl., of an individual, sterro\n ta\ h)/qea Hp.Ep.11; i(ero\s kata\ ta\ h)/qh Ath.1.1e. of outward
bearing, w(s i(laro\n to\ h)=. X.Smp.8.3; u(gro/ths h)/qous Lycurg.33; u(yhlo\s tw=| h)/. Plu.Dio4: in pl., of facial expression, o)fqalmw=n h)/qh Philostr.Gym. 25. in Rhet.,
delineation of character, h)=. e)/xousin oi( lo/goi e)n o(/sois dh/lh h( proai/resis Arist.Rh.1395b13; h)=. e)mfai/nein Phld.Rh.1.200S.; esp. opp. pa/qos, Longin.9.15, etc.; kat' h)=. le/gesqai, opp. kata\ pa/qos, D.H.Comp.22, cf. Lys.19: in pl., pragma/twn kai\ h)qw=n Phld.Po.5.5; e)n pa/qesi kai\ h)/qesin Demetr.Eloc.28, etc.; so of works of art, h( *zeu/cidos grafh\ ou)de\n e)/xei h)=. Arist.Po.1450a29; pa/qos kai\ h)=. kai\ sxhma/twn xrh=sis Ael.VH4.3; polla\ h)/qh e)pifai/nei Philostr.Her.2.10; also of Music, S.E.M.6.49.
dramatis persona, ei)sa/gei a)/ndra h)\ gunai=ka h)\ a)/llo ti h)=. Arist.Po.1450a11, al. also of animals, h)=. to\ pro\s toke/wn (prob.l.for e)/qos) A.Ag.727, cf.E.Hipp.1219, Pl.R.375e, Arist. HA487a12 (pl.); to\ h)=. a)sqenh/s, of a bird, ib.615a18; of things,
nature, kind, para\ d' h)=. e(ka/stw| (to each of the four elements) Emp. 17.28; tou= puretou= Gal.7.353. e)n h)/qei
tactfully (cf. h)qiko/s 11.2), prosfe/resqai toi=s a(marta/nousin Plu.2.73e. cf. Herm. in Phdr.p.195A.; dia\ me/trion h)=qos, of the expression dokei= moi, Steph.in Hp.1.59D.
h)qroisme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of a)qroi/zw, gloss on a)gelhdo/n, Hsch.
h)/qw, collat. form of h)qe/w (q.v.), aor. 1 h)=sa, Hp. ap. Gal.19.103.
h)i/+, Boeot. for ai)ei/ （= a)ei/), Schwyzer 462A25 (Tanagra, iii B.C.), Hdn.Gr.1.497.

h)/i+a (A), contr. h)=|a, ta/,
provisions for a journey, Ep. word, Hom.mostly in Od., deu=te, fi/loi, h)/i+a ferw/meqa 2.410, cf. 289; kai/ nu/ ken h)/i+a pa/nta kate/fqito 4.363; e)ce/fqito h)/i+a pa/nta 12.329; e)n de\ kai\ h)=|a kwru/kw| [e)/qhke] 5.266, cf. 9.212: generally, [e)/lafoi] pardali/wn te lu/kwn t' h)/i+a pe/lontai
food for wolves, Il.13.103; h)/i+a kriqa/wn,= a)/leura, Nic.Al.412. w(s d' a)/nemos . . h)i/+wn qhmw=na tina/ch| karfale/wn, i.e. a heap of
husks or
chaff (= o)spri/wn kala/mai acc. to Eratosth. ap. Eust.1445.42), Od.5.368; th\n gaste/r' h)/|wn ka)xu/rwn sesagme/nos Pherecr.161. (Etym. uncertain: not related to the sg. h)/i+on which is glossed by pareia/n, gna/qon, Hsch.; cf. ei)ai/, ei)=oi.） [i^, but i_ Od.2.289,410, Il.13.103.]

h)/i+a (B), Ion. for h)/|ein, impf. of ei)=mi (
ibo).

h)i/qeos [i^], contr. h)/|qeos (v.infr.), Dor. a)/|qeos Cerc.9.11, but Aeol. (?) h)i/+qeos Sapph. (v. infr.): o(:—
unmarried youth (h)i/qeon h)\ kai\ gegamhko/ta a)/paida Pl.Lg.877e), Sapph.Supp.20a.18 (pl.); parqe/nos h). te joined, Il.22.127, al.; xorou\s parqe/nwn te kai\ h)iqe/wn Hdt.3.48, cf. Plu. Thes.15; including parqe/noi, B.16 tit., cf. 43, al.; of the qewroi/ sent to Delos, Arist.Ath.56.3; ou) ga/r e)stin h)/|qeos E.Ph.945; of animals,
unmated, Pl.Lg.840d: later as Adj., pai=des h)i/qeoi Plu.Thes.17; h)i+qe/oisin e)fh/boisin IG3.1151. h)i/qeoi, oi(,
ghosts of those who die unmarried, Tab.Defix.Aud.52.7. rare as fem., h)i+qe/h,= parqe/nos,
Nic.Fr.74.64, AP9.241 (Antip.<Thess.>); ko/rh h)/|qeos Eup.332. metaph. as Adj., nou=s Porph.Marc.33. (h)iq- shd. be read as h)|q- in Prose.)
h)ikano/s: o( a)lektruw/n, Hsch. h)/i+kto, v. e)/oika. h)/i+ce, v. a)i/+ssw.

h)i+o/eis, essa, en, (h)/i+a A) Ep. word of doubtful meaning, e)p' h)i+o/enti *skama/ndrw| Il.5.36; perh. connected by later poets with h)i+w/n, hence h). *pa/normos Q.S.1.283; ko/llouros
haunting the shore, Marc.Sid.22: but perh. also with h)/i+a (A), xh/nesin h)i+o/en pedi/on ka/ta boskome/noisin Q.S.5.299; derived from i)/on by EM423.14.

h)/i+on, Ep. for h)/|esan, 3pl. impf. of ei)=mi (
ibo); also 1sg., Luc.Syr.D. 24. Ion. impf. of a)i/+w, read by Zenod. for e)/kluon, Od.2.42. v. h)/i+a (A) fin.
h)/i+os, o(, epith. of Phoebus, h)/i+e *foi=be Il.15.365, 20.152, h.Ap.120. (Prob. from the cry h)/, h)/, cf. i)h/i+os.)

h)i+o/w, (h)/i+a A)
provide with food, in Pass., Hsch.

h)i+w/n, Trag. h)|w/n E.Or.994, Dor. a)i+w/n Pi.I.1.33, A.Ag.1158 (lyr.), a)w/n Mosch.3.37 (cj.): o/nos, h(:—
shore, beach, o(/qi ku/mat' e)p' h)i+o/nos klu/zeskon Il.23.61; a)mfi\ de/ t' a)/krai h)i+o/nes boo/wsin 17.265; a)\m pe/trhsi kai\ h)i+o/nessi kaqi/zwn (Ep. dat.) Od.5.156, cf. Hdt.2.113, 8.96, E.Tr. 827 (lyr.), X.HG1.1.5, Sotion p.191 W., D.C.59.25. after Hom., in pl., of other
banks, as of a lake, Pi.I.1.33; of a river, A.Ag.l.c., A.R.2.659,4.130, D.H.4.27. metaph., of the
lower part of the face, over which the tears flow, Hsch.(pl.): sg., = pa=sa h( tw=n o)fqalmw=n perigrafh/, Poll.2.71.

h)=ka, Adv.: of Place or Motion,
slightly, a little, h)=k' e)p' a)ristera/
a little to the left, Il.23.336; h)=. parakli/nas kefalh/n Od.20.301: hence, generally,
softly, gently, h)=. e)la/sai 18.94, cf. 92; a)pw/sato h)=. ge/ronta Il.24.508; h)=. ma/la yu/casa 20.440; h)=. kio/ntas Od.17.254; h)=. bihsa/menos Nic.Al.226. of Sound,
softly, low, h)=. pro\s a)llh/lous a)go/reuon Il.3.155; h)=. mu/resqai, ma/l' o(madh=sai, A.R.3.463,565. of Sight,
softly, smoothly, h)=. sti/lbontas e)lai/w| with oil
soft-shining, Il.18.596; h)=k' e)pimeidh/sas
soft-smiling, Hes.Th.547; h)=. me/lan
slightly black, Opp.C.3.39. of Time,
by little and little, AP5.278 (Paul. Sil.), Opp.H.2.67. (Perh. connected with Lat.
sēg-nis (for
sēg-nis): but Hsch. has ga/ka (i.e. va=ka）: h(de/ws; cf. h(/sswn, h(/kistos, h)/kistos, h)kai=on, h)/kalos, h)kale/on.)
h(=ka, aor. 1 of i(/hmi.

h)ka/da: h)ndrwme/nhn gunai=ka, Hsch. h)kai=on: a)sqene/s, Id. h)/kalos, on, = a)kalo/s, Call.Fr.27 P.:—also h)kale/on gelo/wsa: pra/ws, ou)k e)skuqrwpakui=a, Hsch. h)/ka^xe, v. a)xeu/w, a)xe/w (A) 11.1.

h)/kestos, h, on, (Ep. for *a)/kestos, from kente/w)
untouched by the goad, of young heifers reserved for sacrifices, bou=s . . h)/nis h)ke/stas Il. 6.94,275,309:—also h)ke/sths: a)da/mastos, Suid.

h)kh/, h(, Ion. for a)kh/ (A), a)kwkh/, Hsch.: hence,
edge, meeting-point, ku/mato/s te ka)ne/mou Archil.43.

h)kh/s, e/s,
sharp, Hsch.

h)/kistos, h, on, Sup. Adj. of Adv. h)=ka, h)/kistos e)laune/men
the gentlest or
slowest in driving, Il.23.531 (h(/k- Eust.1314.27, EM424.27; cf. sq.).

h(/kistos, h, on, prob., like foreg., Sup. of h)=ka,
least, o( d' h(/kist' e)/xwn maka/rtatos S.Fr.410. c. inf.,
worst at . . , h(/. qhra=n, krumw=| o(milei=n, Ael.NA9.1,4.31 (cf. foreg.). mostly as Adv., h(/kista
least, Hp.Acut.68, S.Ph.427, etc.; ou)k h(/. a)lla\ ma/lista Hdt.4.170; w(s h(/.
as little as possible, Th.1.91. in reply to a question,
not at all, S.OT623, E.HF299, etc.; h(/kista/ ge S.OT1386, Pl.Phdr.276c; h(/. pa/ntwn Ar.Pl.440. ou)x h(/., freq. in litotes,
above all, more than all, A.Ch.116; oi(/ te a)/lloi kai\ ou)x h(/. *)aqhnai=oi Pl.Prt.324c, cf. Tht. 177c, Smp.178a, al.; e)pi\ pollw=n me/n . . , ou)x h(/. de\ e)n toi=s parou=si pra/gmasi D.2.1, cf. Th.7.44, etc.: c. gen., ou)x h(/. *)aqhnai/wn se/, a)ll' e)n toi=s ma/lista Pl.Cri.52a.

h)kri_bwme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of a)kribo/w,
exactly, Aristeas 310, Eust.1406.29 (ed. Rom.).

h(/kw, Il.5.478: impf. h(=kon (v. infr.): fut. h(/cw (v. infr.); Dor. h(cw= Theoc.4.47, Call.Fr.1.65 P. (in Dor. and Hom. more commonly i(/kw): all other tenses late; aor. 1 part. h(/cas Paus.2.11.5, Gal.6.56, 10.609: pf. h(=ka Philostr.VA3.24, Scymn.62, 1pl. h(/kamen UPZ72.9 (ii B.C.), CIG4762 (Egypt, i A.D.), Dor. h(/kames f.l. in Plu.2.225b, 2pl. h(/kate PGrenf.2.36.18 (i B.C.), 3pl. h(/kasi LXX4 Ki.20.14, Ev.Marc.8.3; inf. h(ke/nai UPZ6.30 (ii B.C.): plpf. h(/kesan J.AJ19.1.14: —Med., pres. subj. h(/khtai Aret.SD2.1: fut. h(/comai v.l. in M.Ant. 2.4:—
to have come, be present, prop. in a pf. sense, with impf. h(=kon as plpf., I
had come, and fut. h(/cw as fut. pf., I
shall have come, ma/la thlo/qen h(/kw Il.5.478, cf. Od.13.325, Pi.O.4.12 (i(/kw codd. vett.): impf. h(=kon A.Pr.661, Th.1.91, al., Pl.R.327c, Hdt.8.50, etc.: fut. h(/cw A.Pr. 103, al., E.Andr.738, Ar.Pax265, Orac. ap. Th.2.54, etc.; h(=ke imper., S.Aj.1116, Ar.Pax275, X.Cyr.4.5.25; h(ke/tw E.Rh.337:—Constr. mostly with ei)s, Hdt.8.50, A.Ch.3, etc.; para/ tina Hdt.7.157, Th.1.137; pro/s tina A.Ch.659; pro\s dai/mona S.Fr.770; esp. in worship, h(/kw pro\s th\n kuri/an *)=isin OGI186.6 (Egypt, i B.C.), cf. Ev.Jo.6.37; pro\s po/lin S.OC734; e)pi/ tina
to set upon, attack, Pl.R.336b, Aeschin. 2.178; but h(/. e)pi\ to\ stra/teuma
to have come to fetch the army, X. An.7.6.2; oi( e)pi\ tau=q' h(/kontes D.18.28; e)p' o)le/qrw| E.IA886 (troch.); peri\ spondw=n X.An.2.3.4: c. acc., h(/ceis potamo/n A.Pr.717, cf. 724, 730; h(/. dh=mon to\n *lurkei/ou S.Fr.271.6, cf. E.Ba.1; h(/kousin au)tw=| a)/ggeloi X.Cyr.5.3.26; e)s tau)to\n h(/.
to have come to the same point, to agree, E.Hec.748, Hipp.273: with Adv. of motion, h(/. e)nqa/de, deu=ro, S.Ph.377, D.19.58; bh=nai kei=qen o(/qenper h(/kei S.OC1227: c. neut. Pron., au)ta\ tau=ta h(/kw para/ se Pl.Prt.310e; e)rwtw/menoi o(/ ti h(/koien for what they
had come, X.HG4.5.9: c. acc. cogn., o(do\n makra\n h(/kein Id.Cyr.5.5.42: c.inf., manqa/nein ga\r h(/komen we
are here to learn, S. OC12.
to have reached a point, e)s tosh/nd' u(/brin ib.1030; ei)s tou=to a)maqi/as E.Andr.170; ei)s tosou=ton a)maqi/as Pl.Ap.25e; ei)s o(/son h(liki/as Id.Chrm.157d, etc.; pro\s ga/mwn a)kma/s S.OT1492; o(ra=|s i(/n' h(/keis; ib.687, etc.; Geom.,
pass through a point, dia\ tw=n po/lwn Autol.Sph.10, cf. Archim.Con.Sph.9. dia\ ma/xhs, di' o)rgh=s h(/kein, A.Supp.475, S.OC905; cf. dia/ A. IV. with an Adv. folld. by gen., ou(/tw po/rrw sofi/as h(/keis Pl.Euthd.294e; eu)= h(/kein tino/s
to be well
off for a thing,
have plenty of it, tou= bi/ou, xrhma/twn, Hdt.1.30, 5.62; e(wutw=n Id.1.102; qew=n xrhstw=n Id.8.111; piqano/thtos Demetr.Magn. ap.D.H.Din.1; ou)k o(moi/ws h(/. tino/s not
to be equally
well off in respect of . . , Hdt.1.149; pw=s a)gw=nos h(/komen; how
have we
sped in the contest? E.El.751; w(=de ge/nous h(/. tini/
to be this
degree of kin to him, Id.Heracl.213; w(s duna/mews h(/keis Paus.4.21.10; e)s mh=kos eu)= h(/kwn Ael.NA4.34: abs., eu)= h(/kein
to be flourishing, Hdt.1.30: rarely c. gen. only, su\ de\ duna/mios h(/keis mega/lhs thou
art in great power, Id.7.157 (nisi leg. mega/lws).
to have come back, returned, D.20.73; from exile, And.2.13; au)ti/ka h(/cw I
shall be back in a moment, X.An.2.1.9; h(=ke/ nun taxu/
come back soon, Ar.Pax275; a)/yorron h(/ceis A.Pr. 1021; a)/yorron h(/comen pa/lin S.El.53. c. part., h(/kw fe/rwn I
have come bringing (i.e. with), Id.OC579, cf. 357, Ar.Pax265, Eup.22 D., Pl.Grg.518d; h(=ken a)/gwn Id.Phd.117a; e(/tero/n ti h(/keis e(/xwn Id.Grg. 491c, etc.: c. fut. part., like e)/rxomai, h(/kw fra/swn, a)ggelw=n, etc., I
am going, I
intend to say, E.Ph.706, 1075, etc.
to have come to be, qeoi=s e)/xqistos h(/kw S.OT1519 (troch.), cf.Aj.636(lyr.), El.1201, etc.;
take one's origin, a)po\ politeiw=n toiou/twn h(/kete, e)n ai(=s . . Th.4.126. of things, in various uses: of meats,
to have come to table, Alex.132; w(s ta\ perifero/mena h(=ke pro\s h(ma=s X.Cyr.2.2.3; of reports, e)moi\ a)ggeli/h h(/kei para\ basile/os Hdt.8.140.a/, cf. S.OC1177; of events, ph=ma h(/kei tini/ A.Pr.103, cf. Ar.Ra.606, etc.; e)p' a)ndri\ h(/kei bi/on teleuth/ S. OC1472; i(/n' h(/keita\ mant eu/mata what they
have come to, Id.OT953; w(s au)to\n h(/coi moi=ra ib.713 codd.; h(/cei po/lemos Orac. ap. Th.2.54; e)s au)to\n h(/cei to\ deino/n Id.6.77; of Time, h(/kei h)=mar, nu/c, A.Ag.1301, E.IT42; h(/kei u(mi=n o( kairo/s Lys.12.79; to\ me/llon h(/cei A.Ag.1240.
concern, relate to, poi= lo/gos h(/kei; to what
do the words
relate? E.Tr.154 (lyr.); ei)s e)/m' h(/kei . . ta\ pra/gmata Ar.Pl.919; ei)s e)me\ to\ e)llei=pon h(/cei
will fall upon me, X.Cyr.1.5.13: freq. in part., ta\ ei)s tou\s kindu/nous h(/konta Antipho 5.81; ta\ ei)s plou=ton h(/. Pl.Erx.392d; ta\ pro\s e)/painon, ei)s filanqrwpi/an h(/., Plb.12.15.9,28.17.2, etc.
depend upon, o(/sa th=s *fwke/wn swthri/as e)pi\ th\n presbei/an h(=ke D.19.30; to/ ge e)p' au)tou\s h(=kon me/ros Ph.2.21; o(/sa g' ei)s bou/lhsin h(/kein th\n e)mh/n Hld.4.7. c. inf., h(=ke/ moi ge/nei . . penqei=n
it has come to me by birth . . , my birth lays it on me . . , S.OC738, cf. Ichn.356; kalw=s au)toi=s katqanei=n h(=kon bi/ou
it being well for them at their age to die, E.Alc.291. c. part., o(\ kai\ nu=n h(/kei gino/menon which
commonly happens even now, Plb.24.9.11 codd. (v.l. geno/menon). (Prob. from same root as i(/kw.)
h(=l, h(=li, apoc. for h(=los, or for h(/lios, Euph.153a, 153b.
h)laiqerh/s, e/s, = h(lioqerh/s, EM425.9: Comp., prob. in Hsch.

h)lai/nw, Ep. for a)lai/nw,
wander, stray, flit about, h)lai/nonti Theoc. 7.23 (h)lai/nontai codd., but cf. Gal.12.361): metaph.,
wander in mind, Call.Dian.251.

h)la/ka^ta [a^k], wn, ta/, only in pl.,
wool on the distaff, h)la/kata strwfw=s' a(lipo/rfura Od.6.53,306, cf.7.105; h). strofali/zete 18.315; h). a)nelissome/nhs Alex.Aet.3.4.
*)hlaka/teia, ta/, festival at Sparta, Sosib.18 (-atoi/a cod. Hsch.).

h)la^ka/th [ka^], h( (so in Att. Inscrr., IG22.1517.209, but h)lek- SIG2 588.17 (Delos, ii B.C.), AJA17.162 (Cyrene), Sammelb.5873, cf. Hsch.; v. h)leka/tion), Dor. h)la^ka/ta_ E.Or.1431 (lyr.), Aeol. a)la^ka/ta_ Theoc.28.1 (a_l- also in xrusa_la/katos, eu)a_la/katos, Dor. h)l- is dub.):—
distaff, Od.4.135, 1.357, Il.6.491, E. l.c., etc.; h( h). [tou= a)tra/ktou]
the stalk of the spindle, Pl.R.616c: metaph., ghraih=|si . . h)laka/th|si with
the fate of old age, IG14.1389i18. of
distaffshaped objects:
one joint of a reed or
cane, Thphr.HP2.2.1;
a reed,= do/nac, Hsch.; w(/sper h)., of the pistil of the citron-flower, Thphr.HP1.13.4, cf. 4.4.3. in Compds. (e.g. xrushla/katos),
arrow, Hsch.
the upper part of the mast, which was made to turn round, A.R.1.565 (v. Sch.), Ath.11.475a.
windlass, Sch.Th.7.25 (v.l. h)lek-). the constellation
Coma Berenices, Sch.Arat.146.

h)la^ka^th=nes, wn, oi(, large sea-fish, prob. of the
tunny kind, Men. Kol.Fr.7, Mnesim.4.35, Mnaseas 33. (Sg. only in Hdn.Gr.2.923.)
h(la/mhn, h(/lato, v. a(/llomai.
h)laco/s and h)laco/os, sine expl., EM425.5 (perh. h)\ laco/s, misunderstood).

h(la/rion, to/, Dim. of h(=los,
small nail, POxy.1658.11 (iv A.D.), Suid. s.v. h(=los.
h)/la^sa, v. e)lau/nw.

h)laska/zw, lengthd. form of h)la/skw, u(po\ pto/lin h)laska/zwn Il.18.281: c. acc. loci, h.Ap.142 codd.
shun, flee from, c. acc., e)mo\n me/nos h)laska/zei Od.9.457 (v.l. h)luska/zei).

h)la/skw, Ep. form of a)lai/nw (cf. h)lai/nw),
wander, stray, roam, [e)/lafoi] au)/tws h)la/skousai a)na/lkides Il.13.104; [mui=ai] kata\ staqmo\n poimnh/i+on h)la/skousin 2.470; of persons, Emp.121.4, D.P.675.

*)hleia^ko/s or *)hlia^ko/s, h/, o/n, (*)=hlis)
of or
from Elis: ta\ *)hliaka/
the Antiquities of Elis, Paus.5 tit.; oi( *)hleiakoi/
philosophers of the school of Elis, disciples of Phaedo, Str.9.1.8, D.L.Prooem.17, 2.105,126.
h)leka/tion [a^], to/, Dim. of h)leka/th (v. h)lak-), BCH35.286 (Delos, ii B.C.).

h)le/ktri^nos, h, on, Dor. a)l-,
made of h)/lektron, Luc.VH1.20, Hld. 3.3.
shining like it, u(/dwr Call.Cer.29.

h)lektri/s, i/dos, h(, fem. of h)le/ktwr, epith. of the Moon, Orph.H.9.6. *)hlektri/des nh=soi
amber islands, at the mouth of the Po, Str.5.1.9, cf. Plin.HN4.103.

h)/lektron, to/, and h)/lektros, o( or h( (gender indeterminate in Hom., Hes., and Pl., neut. in Hdt.3.115, Thphr.HP9.18.2, Ti.Locr.102a, masc. in S.Ant.1038 codd., Eust.ad D.P.293, fem. in Ar.Eq.532, Alex. Aphr.Pr.Praef.),
amber (cf. *)hlektri/des）, [o(/rmos] meta\ . . h)le/ktroisin (i.e.
pieces of amber) e)/erto Od.15.460, cf. 18.296, Hdt.3.115, Pl.Ti. 80c, Phld.Sign.1, D.L.1.24, etc.; h)le/ktrou liba/des A.R.4.606.
