an alloy of gold and silver, xrusou= t' h)le/ktrou te kai\ a)rgu/rou h)d' e)le/fantos Od.4.73, cf. Hes.Sc.142, Hom.Epigr.15.10, Pytheas ap.Ath. 11.465d; ta)po\ *sa/rdewn h)/. S.Ant.1038 (cj.): in pl., of the pegs of a lyre, e)kpiptousw=n tw=n h)le/ktrwn Ar.Eq.532. (The two senses are difficult to distinguish in early Poetry; cf. Paus.5.12.7, Plin.HN33.80, 37.31. The word is connected with h)le/ktwr.)

h)lektro/-omai, Pass.,
become electrum, Zos.Alch.p.180B.

h)lektro-fa^h/s, e/s,
amber-gleaming, au)gai/, of the tears of the Phaethontiades, E.Hipp. 741 (lyr.).

h)lektro-fo/ros, on,
amber-bearing, de/ndra, da/kruon, Tz.H.4.381,690.

h)lektrw/dhs, es,
amber-like, koili/hs taraxh/ Hp.Epid.4.38; ba/lanoi Philostr.VA1.21.

h)le/ma^tos, Dor. and Aeol. a)le/matos, on,
idle, vain, Sapph.Supp. 15.5, Alc.Supp.23.4; w)= ta=s a)lema/tw yuxa=s prob. l. in Theoc.15.4 (a)dem-, a)dam- codd.); of a person, Timo 34.3, cf. 66.4 (cj.); bronth/ Sotad.2; xeiro\s e(khboli/a AP6.75 (Paul. Sil.); fantasi/h ib.11.350 (Agath.). Adv. -tws
idly, A.R.4.1206;
in vain, Call.Cer.91: so neut. pl. h)le/mata Opp.H.4.590.

h)leo/s, h/, o/n,
distraught, crazed, fre/nas h)lee/ Od.2.243; in shorter form fre/nas h)le/ (perh. replacing Aeol. a)=lle, written ale), Il.15.128; h)lea\ r(e/cas Call.Fr.174, cf. 173: neut. pl., as Adv.,
foolishly, AP7.639 (Antip.), Call.Aet.3.1.66: Aeol. a)=llos prob. in Sapph.35, 110, dub. in a)llofrone/w, a)llofa/ssw; cf. a)losu/na (s.v. h)losu/nh). Act.,
distracting, crazing, oi)=nos Od.14.464. a)leo/s [a^], is cited from A. (Fr.410) by Hsch. (a)laio/s cod.), cf. Hdn.Gr.2.909, EM59.45; cf. a)leo/frwn: o( para/frwn ibid.: a)l<e>w/ssein: mwrai/nein, Hsch.
h)le/sqhn, v. a)le/w (A). h)leu/ato, 3sg. 1 aor. of a)le/omai.
h)lh/lato, h)lh/lanto, v. e)lau/nw. h)/lhma, v. bh/lhma.

*(hlia/dhs, ou, o(,
child of the Sun, Luc.Am.2; oi( *(hlia/dai, an ancient family in Rhodes, Str.14.2.8, D.S.5.56.

h(lia/zomai, fut. -a/somai (v. infr.): aor. 1 inf. -a/sasqai Ar.Eq.798: —
sit in the court *(hliai/a,
be a Heliast, Id.Lys.380 (-a/ceis, -a/zeis codd., -a/zei Cobet), V.772 (with a play on the word, h(lia/sei pro\s h(/lion), Lexap.D.24.50.

h(lia/zw,
bake in the sun, [ma/zas] Str.16.4.13, cf. Dieuch. ap. Orib.4.8.1:—Pass.,
bask in the sun, Arist.HA611b14;
ferment, -a/zetai h( b_ lhno/s BGU1551.1,10 (iii B.C.); polla/kis o( oi)=nos -azo/menos teleiou=tai th=| kra/sei kai\ th=| duna/mei Anon.Incred.17. Pass.,= e)chlia/zomai, LXX 2 Ki.21.14.

h(liai/a, h(, at Athens,
public place or
hall, in which the chief law-court was held, e)n h(liai/a| Ar.Eq.897; a)naba\s ei)s th\n h(. th\n tw=n qesmoqetw=n prob. in Antipho 6.21, cf. IG12.39.75,63.14.
supreme court at Athens, Lex Solonis ap. Lys.10.16, Lex ap.D.21.47, Paus.1.28.8, etc. = a(li/a (A) (q.v.). h(liai/h, = a)le/a (B), Hsch.

*(hliai=a, ta/,
festival of Helios, Jul.Or.4.156c.

h(lia^ko/s, Dor. a(lia^ko/s, h/, o/n
of the sun, solar, Zeno Stoic.1.34; fa/ntasma, ei)/dwlon, Demetr.Lac.Herc.1013.17; ku/klos h(
the sun's orbit,
the ecliptic (v. e)kleiptiko/s), D.S.1.98; h(. (sc. ku/klos), o(, Cleom. 1.4, etc.; fw=s h(. Ph.2.254, al.; e)/kleiyis h(. D.L.1.23; e)niauto/s Gem. 8.47, Placit.2.32.3; e)/tos, ste/fanos a(., at Rhodes, Com.Adesp.336.4,6; ka/nqaros h(.
dung-beetle (v. h(lioka/nqaros), PMag.Par.1.751; troxi/skos h(. (magical remedy), Nech. ap. Harp.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(3).135; h(liakh/ (sc. peri/odos), h(,
solar year, Plu.Caes.59. Adv. -kw=s Procl.in Prm.p.631S.

h(lianqe/s, to/,
laudanum-plant, Cistus laurifolius, Ps.-Democr. ap. Plin.HN24.165.

h(lia/s, a/dos, h(, fem. of h(liako/s, a)kti/s Orac. ap. Luc.Alex.34; *(ro/dos Id.Am.7. *(hlia/des, ai(,
daughters of the Sun, who were changed into poplars and wept amber, Parm.1.9, A.R.4.604, Str.5.1.9; h( *(hlia\s ai)/geiros Philostr.VA5.5. h(lia/des: ai( kata/xrusoi kli=nai, Hsch.

h(li/a^sis (A), ews, h(, = h(li/wsis,
exposure to the sun, Gal.4.807 (pl.), D.C.59.7, Gp.7.1.3.

h(li/a^sis (B), ews, h(,
sitting in the *(hliai/a, Jusj. ap. D.24.150.

h(liast-h/s, ou=, o(, (h(liai/a 2) Heliast, Ar.V.206,891, Eq. 255, IG12.63.14, etc.
fuller,= Lat.
lutor, Gloss.

h(liast-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of, for, or
like a Heliast, ge/rwn Ar.V.195; o)bolo/s Id.Nu.863; o(/rkos Lex ap.D.24.21, Hyp.Eux.40.

h(li^-augh/s, e/s, (au)gh/)
gleaming like the sun, EM425.24.

h(li^-a/w,
to be like the sun, ko/mai h(liw=sai Anacreont.16.5, cf. Hld.3.4, Philostr. VA7.42. Act.,
expose to the sun, ta\s stafula/s Arist.Pr.926b38.

h)li^ba/ta_s [ba^], o(,
haunting the heights, tra/gos Antiph.133.3, cf. Anaxil.12 (-ba/tous codd.):—hence h(li^-ba^te/w,
haunt the heights, Sch. Il.15.273.

h)li/ba^tos [i^], Dor. a)l-, on,
high, steep, always in Hom. as epith. of pe/trh or pe/trai, Il.15.273, al., cf. Hes.Th.675, 786, Thgn.176, Pi. O.6.64, A.Supp.352 (lyr.), E.Supp.80 (lyr.), Theoc.26.10, etc.; o)/ros, a)/krh, e)ri/pnai, A.R.2.169, 361, 1248; of the Olympian throne of Zeus, Ar.Av.1732; of trees, h.Ven.267 (so prob. in Hes.Sc.422).—Also in X. and later Prose, pe/trai h). An.1.4.4; to/poi Plb.4.41.9; pe/tros Str.17.1.50; de/ndra Agatharch.97; pu=r Hanno Peripl.16; stauro/s Epigr. ap. Plu.Flam.9.
deep, abysmal, a)/ntrw| e)n h). Hes.Th. 483; *ta/rtaros h). Stes.83; h). u(po\ keuqmw=si E.Hipp.732 (lyr.); pela/gessin e)n h). Opp.H.3.171: metaph., kako\n h). Damox.2.22; eu)hqeia Porph.Abst.1.12. in later Poets (perh. from a misunderstanding of [*ku/klwy] h). pe/trhn e)pe/qhke qu/rh|sin Od.9.243),
huge, enormous, me/lea Opp.H.5.66; sxedi/h Q.S.11.312; so in Prose, ku=ma, skiai/, Plu.2.163c,935f. (Etym. dub., cf. a)/liy: pe/tra, Hsch.）

*(hli/eia, only in Rhod. form *(ali/eia, ta/,
festival of the Sun, SIG 724 (Rhodes, ii/i B.C.),al.; written *(aleia in Ath.13.561e, *(ali/wn (gen.) in Aristid.Or.25(43).32, a)lieita (for *(ali/eia ta/ . .) in Com.Adesp.336.

h)/li^qa, Adv.
very much, exceedingly, lhi/+da . . sunela/ssamen h)/. pollh/n Il.11.677, cf. Od.5.483; a)/stra h)/. muri/a Man.2.3; kaqarh\n gla/geos po/sin h)/. pi/nein Nic.Al.423, cf. A.R.3.342 (expl. by Sch. as,= a)qro/ws), 4.177,1265.
in vain, to no purpose, Call.Lav.Pall.124, A.R. 2.283; e)/brasen h)/. nhdu\s pneu/mata Nic.Al.25, cf. 140. (Prob. connected with h)leo/s in both uses.)

h)li^qi^-a/zw,
speak or
act idly, foolishly, Ar.Eq.1124.

h)li^/qi^-os, Dor. a)l-, a, on, also os, on Hdt.1.60: (h)/liqa 11):—
idle, vain, xo/los Pi.P. 3.11; be/los A.Ag.366(anap.); o(do/s Theoc.16.9.
foolish, silly, eu)hqi/h Hdt.1.60; h)li/qion qa/rros qarrei=n Pl.Phd.95c; no/mos PThead.25.7 (iv A.D.); freq. of persons, E.Cyc.537, Ar.Ach.443, etc.: Comp. -w/teros X.Smp.3.6: Sup. -w/tatos Ar.Ec.765; h)li/qio/n [e)sti] c. inf., Arist.Pol.1286a12, prob. in Antiph.58; also h)liqi/wn e)sti/ is the mark
of a fool, Phld.Po.5.32. Adv. -i/ws, diakei=sqai Lys.1.10; oi)o/menoi Pl. Tht.180d, cf. Theoc.10.40: Comp. -w/teron Jul.Gal.89a: neut. h)li/qion as Adv., Ar.Nu.872.
without sense, of the dead,
Tab.Defix. Aud.43.7.

h)li^qi^-o/ths, htos, h(,
folly, silliness, Cratin.188, Pl.R.560d, al., Phld.Rh.1.249 S., etc.; gnw/mhs Them.Or.1.11d.

h)li^qi^-w/dhs, es,
like a fool, Philostr.VS2.1.10.

h)li^qi^-w/nh, h(,
one who makes foolish or
distracts, epith. of the *)erinu/es, Tab.Defix.108.
h)li^qopoio/s, o/n, gloss on h)leo/s, Sch.Od.14.464.

h(li^ki/-a, Ion. -i/h, Dor. a(liki/a, h(, (h(=lic)
time of life, age, h)/n pws h(liki/hn ai)de/ssetai h)d' e)leh/sh| gh=ras Il.22.419; ghraio\n me/ros a(liki/as Pi.P.4.157; para\ to\n a(liki/as e)oiko/ta xro/non Id.O.4.29; th/nd' h(. a)stw=n, i.e. their old
age, A.Pers.914: acc. used adverbially,
in age, ne/os h(liki/hn Hdt.3.134; e)te/wn e)w\n h(liki/hn pe/nte kai\ trih/konta Id.1.26, cf. X.Cyn.2.3: so in dat., h(liki/a| e)/ti to/te w)\n ne/os Th.5.43; proelhluqo/tes tai=s h(. X.HG6.1.4; also u(po\ th=s h(. from our
age, Pl.La.180d; ai( di' h(liki/an a)/tokoi Id.Tht.149c; oi( e)n th=| au)th= h(. Th.1.80; to\ a)xrei=on th=s h(. Id.2.44; o(/tan . . tou= genna=n e)kbw=si th\n h(. Pl.R.461b; po/rrw th=s h(. to an advanced
age, Id.Grg.484c; proh/kwn e)s baqu\ th=s h(. Ar. Nu.514; proi+ou/shs th=s h(, Pl.Phdr.279a; o( par' h(liki/an nou=s beyond
one's age, Men.Mon.690: in pl., e)n a(pa/sais tai=s h(. Pl.R.412e, cf. Lg. 625b, al.
prime of life, manhood, e)n a(liki/a| prw/ta| Pi.N.9.42; au)th\ h( h(. tw=n ne/wn kate/krine Antipho 4.4.2; h(liki/an e)/xein, ei)s h(. e)lqei=n, a)fike/sqai, Pl.Euthd.306d, Tht.142d, Men.89b; h(liki/hn e)/xein c. inf., to be
of fit age for doing, Hdt.1.209, cf. Pl.Tht.146b; h(liki/as mete/xein Th.7.60; oi( e)n th=| h(liki/a| men
of military age, Id.8.75; e)n h(liki/a| strateu/esqai D.4.7; e)strateume/nos a(pa/sas ta\s e)n h(liki/a| stratei/as Id.21.95; oi( th=s h(. e)nto\s gegono/tes Lys.2.50; h( kaqesthkui=a h(. maturity, Th.2.36, cf. IG12(7).239.21 (Amorgos); of women,
womanhood, marriageable age, Hp.Prorrh.2.30, D.59.22; ai( e)n h(. gunai=kes Pl.R.461b; th\n h(liki/an th\n e(antou= katamemya/menos Is.7.14: in pl., oi( tai=s h(. ou) kalw=s kexrhme/noi Aeschin.1.194.
youthful passion, h(liki/h| kai\ qumw=| e)pitre/pein Hdt.3.36; ei)/kein Id.7.18.
maidenhood, th\n h(. ou) kalw=s diafula/casan Aeschin.1.182. as collective Noun,= oi( h(/likes,
those of the same age, comrades, o(\s h(liki/hn e)ke/kasto e)/gxei+ Il.16.808, cf. Pi.P.1.74; esp.
those of military age, th=s h(. a)pou/shs e)n tai=s nausi/ Lys.2.49, cf. Th.3.67, 8.1, etc.; also,
men of any age, pai/dwn te kai\ a)ndrw=n kai\ pa/shs h(. Pl.Lg.959e.
time, tau=ta h(liki/hn a)\n ei)/h kata\ *la/i+on about the
time of Laius, Hdt.5.59, cf. 60, 71; h(. tetrakosi/oisi e)/tesi . . presbute/rous Id.2.53.
age, generation, e)pi\ th=s nu=n h(. Isoc.4.167; pro\ th=s h(mete/ras h(. Din. 1.38; ei)s th\n nu=n zw=san h(. D.60.11; pollai=s e)/mprosqen h(. Plu.Per. 27, cf. D.L.5.37. of the body,
stature, as a sign of age, Hdt. 3.16, Pl.Euthd.271b, D.40.56; th=| h(. mikro/s Ev.Luc.19.3 (but prosqei=nai e)pi\ th\n h(. ph=xun e(/na add a cubit to one's
age (cf. ph/xuios), Ev.Matt.6.27); a)/ndras h(mistadiai/ous ta\s h(. Luc.VH1.40;
height of a pillar, Id.Syr.D.28.

h(li^ki-a/zomai, Pass.,
assume this or
that quality, dub. in Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.69.

h(li^ki-w/ths, ou, o(, Cret. valikiw/tas (written balikiw/ths), Hsch.:—
equal in age, comrade, Hdt.5.71, Ar.Nu. 1006, And.1.48; h(. tini/ Lys.20.36; e)mo\s h(. Pl.Ap.33d; h(. kai\ e(tai=roi Id.Smp.183c, al.: c. gen., h(. tw=n lo/gwn Him.Or.12.4:—fem. h(li^ki-w=tis, idos, Plu.2.554a, Luc.DMar.15.2; h(. i(stori/a
contemporary history, Plu.Per.13; pra/ceis h(. D.S.1.58: c. dat.,
contemporaneous with, ib.9: c. gen., Max.Tyr.3.2, Them.Or.4.58b.

h(li/kos [i^], h, on,
as big as, po/sos tis; mikro/s, h(li/kos *mo/lwn Ar.Ra. 55; ti/ tosou=ton u(/brisen, h(li/kon . . ; D.21.147; thlikou=tos, h(. ou)dei/s pw basileu/s Id.1.9. of age,
as old as, a)/ndra . . h(li/kon *qoukudi/dhn Ar. Ach.703; toi=sin h(li/koisi nw=|n, = thli/kois h(li/koi nw/, Id.Ec.465; oi( h(li/koi
e)gw/,= thli/koi h(li/koi e)gw/, Pl.La.180d: rare in Trag., o(ra=|s me\n h(ma=s, h(li/koi . .
of what various ages . . , S.OT15. in indirect questions,
how big, how great, Thphr.Char.23.2, Crates Theb.18, etc.; o(rw=n h(. e)sti\ *fi/lippos D.6.6, cf. Pl.Chrm.154b; freq. in expressions of wonder, qauma/si' h(li/ka
extraordinarily great, D.19.24; qaumasto\n h(li/kon Id.24.122; me/gista h(li/ka Luc.Merc.Cond.13; also,
how small, i)dou\ h(li/kon pu=r h(li/khn u(/lhn a)na/ptei Ep.Jac.3.5; a)\n i)/dw ga\r h(li/kon i)xqu\n o(/sou timw=si Antiph.166.6, cf. Luc.Herm.5. in exclamations, h(li/kon lalei=s Men.Sam.40. (Compd. of
yo-, relat. Pron. stem (cf. o(/s), and
-āli- (cf. h(=lic), with suffix -ko-; cf. phli/kos, thli/kos.)

h(li^kosou=n, strengthd. for h(li/kos,
however so great, Plot.1.4.7.

h(=lic, Dor. a(=lic, Aeol. a)=lic Sapph.119, i^kos, o(, h(:—
of the same age, katai/qousa paido\s . . dalo\n h(/lik', of Meleager's torch, A.Ch.608; dru=s A.R.2.479; *phlh=os . . h(/. xai/thn Tryph.637: mostly in pl., bo/es . . h(/likes i)sofo/roi Od.18.373; a(/likes oi(=a parqe/noi Pi.P.3.17; w)=ndres h(/. Ar.V.245; u(f' h(li/kwn neani/dwn Id.Th.1030(lyr.); e)n a(/liki xro/nw| in
equal time, B.7.45. Subst.,
fellow, comrade, oi( h(/likes Hdt.1.34, 2.32; h(/like/s q' h(/bhs e)mh=s A.Pers.681; to\n h(/lika to/nde Ar.Ach. 336 codd. (sed leg. o(mh/lika） meta\ tw=n h(. Antipho 3.2.3; prov., h(=lic h(/lika te/rpei Pl.Phdr.240c, cf. Arist.EN1161b34. (Fr. va=lic, cf. balikiw/ths: compd. of
swo- 'one's own' (cf. vo/s, Lat.
suus) and
-āli- 'size', 'growth' (cf. Lat.
alo, aequ-āli-s, Gr. o(m-a=li-c), with suffix -k-.)
h(lio/-ba^tos, on, coined as etym. of h)li/batos, EM427.45.

h(lio/-blhtos, on, = h(lio/bolos, pla/kes E.Ba.14; of a tree,
sun-scorched, Ael. NA8.26.

h(lio-bole/omai, Pass.,
to be sun-struck, Zen.5.53.

h(lio/-bolos, on,
exposed to the sun, sunny, of places, Thphr.CP4.12.3.

h(lio-dro/mos, o(,
sun's messenger, h(. *dio/s Ramsay
Cities and Bishoprics 2p.566（Acmonia); title of a grade of initiates in Mithras-worship, Cumont
Mystères de Mithra 1.317.

h(lio-du/sion [u^], to/,
sunset, Vett.Val.362.34.

h(lio-eidh/s, e/s,
like the sun, bright and beaming, Pl.R.509a, Gal. 5.635, Plot.1.6.9; a)h/r Arist.Fr.42; [sw=ma] Porph.Sent.29: Sup. -eide/statos Pl.R.508b, Gal.UP3.10.

h(lio-qalph/s, e/s,
warmed by the sun, gloss on e)laqerh/s, Hsch.

h(lio-qere/w,
to sun oneself, Gal.6.137.

h(lio-qerh/s, e/s, (qe/rw)
warmed in the sun, EM58.1.

h(lio-ka^h/s, e/s, (ka/w, kai/w)
sunburnt, Luc.Lex.2; o)/strakon v.l. in Dsc.2.2: -kae/s, to/, name of a
powder, Orib.Fr.115.

h(lio-ka^i/+a, h(,
sun-burning, exposure to the sun, D.L.7.1 (pl.), Paul.Aeg.3.6(pl.), Phlp.in Ph. 60.13, in GC148.14.
h(lio-kalli/s, i/dos, h(, = h(lianqe/s, Plin.HN24.165.

h(lio-ka/mi_nos [a^], o(,
a room exposed to the sun, for winter use, Plin.Ep.2.17.20, IGRom.4.1431.43（Smyrna).

h(lio-ka/nqa^ros, on,
the dung-beetle or
scarab, Alex.Trall.Febr.7.
h(lio/-kaustos, Dor. a(l-, on, （kai/w） = h(liokah/s, Theoc.10.27, Dsc.2.2.

h(lio-kaute/w,
to be sunburnt, Alex.Aphr. ap. Simp. in Ph.968.25.

h(lio-kentri/s, i/dos, h(, a kind of
fly, Gloss.

h(lio-ko/mas, ou, o(,
with hair like the sun, Eust.976.53.

h(lio/-ktu^pos, on,
sunburnt, A.Supp.155(lyr.) (h(dio/ktupon cod. Med.).

h(lio-ma^nh/s, e/s,
sun-mad, mad for love of the sun, epith. of the cicada, Ar.Av.1096 (lyr.).

h(lio-mantei/a, h(,
magical invocation of the sun, PMag.Leid.W. 4.

h(lio/-morfos, on,
sun-shaped, Castorio 1.

h(lio/omai, Pass.,
live in the sun, be exposed to the sun, h(liwme/nos, opp. e)skiatrofhkw/s, Pl.R.556d; of Places, o(/pws h( gh= h(liwqh=| Thphr. CP3.4.1, cf. HP1.10.3; ta\ h(liou/mena
parts exposed to the sun, X.Oec. 19.18; -ou/menos a)h/r Ath.Med. ap. Orib.9.5.1.
to be sun-struck, h(liou=sqai th\n kefalh/n Hp.
Aër.3; or
sunburnt, Muson.Fr.19p.107H.
to be illuminated by the sunlight, Arist.de An.419b31, Pr. 913a22:—late in Act. h(lio/w,
place in the sun, Aët.1.102, 112, al.

h(liopa/lios or h(li/o-on, name of a plant or stone, PMag.Berol.2.18 (perh.
sun-opal, cf. o)pa/llios).

h(lio/-peptos, on,
ripened in the sun, stafi/s Hippiatr.58.

h(lio-plh/c, plh=gos, o(, h(,
sunburnt, Call.Iamb.1.219.
h(lio/-pous, podos, o(, = h(liotro/pion, Ps.-Dsc.4.190.

h(/lios, o(, Ep. h)e/lios, as always in Hom. (exc. in the late passage Od.8.271) and Hes., cf. Hp.Alim.42: Dor. a)e/lios [a_] Pi.P.4.144, Call. Cer.92, Lav.Pall.89, and lyr. in Trag., S.Ant.809, E.Ph.175, al., but a(/lios [a_], S.Tr.96, E.Alc.395 (a^e/lios S.Tr.835): Cret. a)be/lios (i.e. a)v-), Hsch.: Aeol. a)e/lios Sapph.79(= Oxy.1787Fr.1.25), Supp.25.7; a)/lios Sapph.69 (s.v.l.): Arc. a)e/lios (or a(-) IG5(2).4.12 (Tegea, iv B.C.):—
sun, Il.7.421, etc.; o(ra=n fa/os h)eli/oio to see
the light of life, live, 18.61, etc.; u(p' h)eli/w| te kai\ ou)ranw=| a)stero/enti naieta/ousi 4.44; gunh\ . . a)ri/sth tw=n u(f' h(li/w| E.Alc.151; ou)ke/t' e)/stin u(f' a(li/w| ib.395; also u(po\ h(li/ou e(wra=sqai Th.2.102; oi( u(po\ tou=ton to\n h(/lion a)/nqrwpoi D.18.270; triw=n tw=n u(po\ to\n h(/. megi/stwn h(gemoniw=n Plu.Luc.30: prov., ou)d' o( h(/. ei)/setai Hld.7.21; w(/sper selh/nh g' h(li/w| (sc. o(/moios) a pale reflection, Com.Adesp.5.15D. to determine the cardinal points, pro\s h)w= t' h)e/lio/n te towards the East, opp. pro\s zo/fon: ei)/t' e)pi\ deci/' i)/wsi pro\s h)w= t' h)e/lio/n te, ei)/t' e)p' a)ristera\ toi/ ge poti\ zo/fon h)ero/enta Il. 12.239, cf. Od.9.26; o(/soi nai/ousi pro\s h)w= t' h)e/lio/n te, h)d' o(/ssoi meto/pisqe poti\ zo/fon 13.240; pro\s h)w= te kai\ h(li/ou a)natola/s, opp. pro\s e(spe/rhn, Hdt.7.58; ta\ pro\s h)w= te kai\ h(/lion a)nate/llonta Id.4.40; oi( a)po\ h(li/ou a)natole/wn *ai)qi/opes the
eastern . . , Id.7.70.
day, S.El. 424;
a day, Pi.O.13.37, Hp.Alim.42, E.Hel.652(pl.), Ps.-Luc.Philopatr. 4,26, etc.; later,
year, Herod.10.1.
sunshine, sun's heat, e)pi\ toi=s o)/resin Pl.Phd.116e; h(/. polu/s Luc.Nav.35, cf.Herm.25; polu\nto\n h(/. e)mfai/nein, of a sunburnt person, Id.Ind.3, cf. Rh.Pr.9: pl.,
sunbeams, Thphr.Sign.22, Ael.NA16.17;
hot sunny days, Th.7.87. metaph.,
sunshine, brightness, yuxh=s Plu.2.994e, cf. Artem.2.36, etc.; of a person, *(ella/nwn do/chs deu/teron *)ae/lion IG14.1188; of Ptol. VI, UPZ15.33; ne/os *(/h., of Nero and Caligula, SIG814.34, 798.3. as pr. n.,
Helios, the sun-god, Od.8.271, etc.; nh\ to\n *(/h. Men.Sam. 108; u(po\ *di/a *gh=n *(/hlion, in manumission-formula, POxy.48.6, 49.8 (i A.D.), IG9(1).412（Aetolia), IPE2.54.10(iii A.D.); [*(/hlios] dou/lous e)leuqe/rous poiei= Artem.2.36; identified with Apollo, Carm.Pop.12, E.Fr.781.11; with Dionysus, D.Chr.31.11, etc. *(hli/ou a)sth/r, of the planet Saturn, v.l. in Pl.Epin.987c, cf. D.S.2.30, Theo Sm. p.130H. (I.-E.
sāwelios, cf. Cret. a)be/lios, Lith.
sáulė, Lat.
sōl.）

h(liose/lhnos, o(,
sunstone, imitatur quodammodo congressum solis etlunae, figuratque colore, Procl.
de sacrificio et magia 101 (Kroll
Analecta Gr., Greifsw.1901p.8).
*(hlio-se/ra_pis, idos, o(, an Egyptian divinity, IG14.2405.48 (Puteoli).

*(hlio-sko/pios, on,
looking to the sun: h(. tiqu/mallos
sun-spurge, Euphorbia helioscopia, Dsc.4.164, cf. Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.39（v.l. -sko/pos), Plin.HN26.69.
*(hlio-sko/pos, o(, a Hermetic plant, Cat.Cod.Astr.8(2).163.

*(hlio-sta^si/a, h(,
solstice, Gloss.

*(hlio-sterh/s, e/s,
depriving of sun, i.e.
shading from the sun, epith. of the Thessalian hat, S.OC 313.

*(hlio-sti^bh/s, e/s,
sun-trodden, a)ntolai/ A.Pr.791.

*(hlio-tro/pion, to/,
heliotrope, Thphr.HP7.3.1, Gal.19.732; h(. to\ me/ga,
Heliotropium villosum, Dsc.4.190; h(. to\ mikro/n,
H. supinum, ib.191. =
Croton tinctorius, PHolm.8.3, al.
sun-dial, Moschio ap.Ath.5.207f, IG11(2).287 A117 (Delos, iii B.C.), Plu.Dio 29, Sch.Ar.Av.998, etc.
green stone streaked with red, blood-stone, Plin.HN37.165, Herm.Trism. in Rev.Phil.32.258.
*(hlio-tro/pios, on, belonging to foreg. 1, cu/lon Theb.Ostr.144.1 (i A.D.). v. *(aliotro/pios.
*(hlio/-tropos, o(, = h(liotro/pion 1, Ps.-Dsc.4.190.

h(liou=xos, on,
possessing sun, PMag.Par.1.3228 (s.v.l.).

h(lio-feggh/s, Dor. a(l-, e/s,
shining like the sun, Philod.Scarph. 136.
h(lio-fu^e/s, to/, = klu/menon, Ps.-Dsc.4.13.
h(lio/-fu^ton, to/, = mi=lac traxei=a, ib.4.142.
h(lio/w, v. h(lio/omai.

h(li/skos, o(, Dim. of h(=los,
little nail, Ar.Fr.314.
h)/li^te, v. a)litai/nw.

h)li^tenh/s, e/s,
lofty, pe/tra Suid.; cf. h)li/batos.

h(li/ths [i_], ou, o(, （h(/lios） = h(lioeidh/s, li/qos Dam.Isid.233; helitis (leg. -es) lapis, Procl.
de sacrificio et magia 91 (Kroll
Analecta Gr., Greifsw. 1901p.8).

h(li=tis, idos, h(, (h(=los)
of or
like nails, h(. lepi/s iron
that scales off from nails, Dsc.5.78, Aët.2.58.

h)li^to-ergo/s, o/n,
missing the work, failing in one's aim, AP7.210 (Antip.), dub.l. in Alc.Oxy.1360Fr.6.
h)li^to/-mhnis: o( ma/thn e)gkalw=n, Hsch.: acc. sg. -mhnin Epic. in Arch.Pap.7.5.

h)li^to/-mhnos, on,
missing the right month, i.e.
untimely born, Il.19.118, Tryph.556, Plu.2.358e, AP12.228 (Strat.).

h)lifa/rma^kos, h(,
a plant useful to staunch blood, Timag. ap. Stob. 4.36.19. h(li/fatos, variant for h)li/batos, Hsch.

h)=liy, i^pos, o(,
a Dorian shoe (cf. a)nh/lipos), Sch.Theoc.4.56.
h(li^-w/dhs, es, = h(lioeidh/s, ei)/dwlon Chaerem.14.14; mh=la Philostr. Im.1.6; ko/mh Anon. ap. Eust.432.26.

h(li^-w/n, w=nos, o(, month at Termessus, Lanckoroński
Städte Pamphyliens und Pisidiens 2.34.

h(li^-wpo/s, o/n,
lit by the sun's eye, ou)rano/s *zeu\s S.Fr.26 (= E.Fr.p.531 N.), 470.

h(li^/-wsis, ews, h(, (h(lio/omai)
exposure to the sun, Hp.Epid.7.82, Thphr.CP6.16.5, Sor.2.38, S.E.P.3.16.

h(li^-wte/os, a, on,
needing exposure to the sun, Philostr.Gym.58.

h(li^-w/ths, ou, o(, fem. h(li^-w=tis, poet. h)eliw=tis, idos, (h(/lios)
of the sun, a)kti=n' e)s h(liw=tin S.Tr.697; h)eliw=tis ai)/glh AP7.601 (Jul.Aeg.); au)gai/ Paul.Al.M.3; oi( h(liw=tai
the inhabitants of the sun, Luc.VH1.17. h(liw=tis, h(, Ion. name for
the dawn, EM440.55.
h(/lkhse, v. e(lke/w.

h)llhgorhme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (a)llhgore/w)
allegorically, Tz.ad Hes.Op.56.

h(lo/-kentron, to/,
spur, Gloss.

h(lo-kope/w, = Lat.
clavo, Dosith. p.435K., Gloss.; u(podh/mata -kekophme/na
hob-nailed shoes, Gal.13.326.

h(lo-ko/pon, to/, = Lat.
forma clavaris, Gloss.

h(lo-ko/pos, o(, (ko/ptw)
nail-smith, BGU1028.19 (ii A.D.), Judeich
Altertümer von Hierapolis 133; = Lat.
clavarius, clavifixor, clavorum faber, Gloss.
h)=lon, to/,= bra/bilon or kokku/mhlon, Seleuc. ap. Ath.2.50a.

h(lo-pa^gh/s, e/s, (ph/gnumi)
fixed with nails, Man.1.149.

h(lo/-plhktos, on,
hurt by a nail, Hippiatr.34.

h(lo-poio/s, o(,
nail-smith, Lat.
clavarius, Gloss.

h(=los, Dor. a(=los, IG4.1484.62(Epid.), SIG245i69 (Delph., iv B.C.), Pi. (v. infr.), Aeol.(?) va/lloi (pl.) written ga/lloi, Hsch.: o(:—
nail-head, stud, as an ornament, skh=ptron xrusei/ois h(/loisi peparme/non Il. 1.246, cf. 11.633; e)n de/ oi( [tw=| ci/fei] h(=loi xru/seioi pa/mfainon ib.29, cf. Ath.11.488b, c: hence, of the stars, Placit.2.14.3. after Hom.,
nail, Pi.P.4.71: h(=loi sidhroi= kai\ cu/linoi X.Cyn.9.12, etc.; of shoenails, Thphr.Char.4.13: prov., h(/lw| e)kkrou/ein to\n h(=lon Luc.Laps.7; h(/lw| o( h(=los (sc. e)kkrou/etai) Arist.Pol.1314a5, etc. = Lat.
acutus (=
spur), Gloss.
wart, callus, Thphr.Ign.37, Nic.Th.272; h(=loi kai\ tu/loi Dsc.1.104, cf. Asclep. ap. Gal.13.647; also on plants, esp. the olive, Thphr.HP4.14.3.

h)=los, o(,
barren spot, Hsch.
h)lo/s, supposed nom. of the voc. h)le/, v. sub h)leo/s.
h)losu/nh, h(, = h)liqio/ths, Nic.Al.420: Aeol. a)losu/na Theoc.30.12; cf. a)=llos (s.v. h)leo/s).

h(lo/w,
sharpen, h(lou=sin au)to\ (sc. to\ konta/rion） culopuri/as (sic) Anon. in Rh.236.18. Pass.,
become callous, h(lwme/nai e)coxai/ Gal.17 (1).902.
h)/lpeto, v. e)/lpomai.
h)lsa/mhn, = h)lasa/mhn, (e)lau/nw) Ibyc.55; dihlsa/mhn is prob. l. in Semon.17.

h)lu^g-a/zw, (h)=luc)
overshadow, only in compd. e)phl- (q.v.).

h)lu^g-ai=os, a, on,
shadowy, dark, Suid.

h)lu^/g-h [u^], h(,
shadow, Erot. s.v. e)phluga/zontai, Hsch. s.v. h)lugisme/nos: metaph., di/khs h).
the 'fog' of a lawsuit, Ar.Ach.684; cf. h)=luc.
h)lu^g-i/zw, = h)luga/zw, in pf. part. Pass. h)lugisme/nos, Hsch.

h)/lu^qon, v. e)/rxomai. h)=luc, u^gos, o(, = h)lu/gh, Choerob. in Theod.2.400; h)lu/gwn o)re/wn: e)n sko/tw| katexome/nwn, Hsch. (leg. -ai/wn). h)/luca, v. a)lu/skw. h)lu^si/h, h(, = h)/lusis, o(do/s, Id., cf. EM497.9.

*)hlu/sion [u^] pedi/on, to/,
the Elysian fields, Od.4.563, A.R.4.811, Str.1.1.4, Plu.Sert.8, etc.: in pl., IG14.1973; xw=ros *)hlu/sios ib.2012 Ca8; leimw/n Luc.JConf.17; e)n *)hlusi/w| alone, IG14.1750. h)lu/sia, ta/, = e)nhlu/sia (q.v.), Polem.Hist.93.
*)hlu/sios, a, on, Elysian, au)=rai IG14.1389i22; xorostasi/ai ib.58.

h)/lu^sis, ews, h(, = e)/leusis
step, gait, bradu/poun h)/. protiqei=sa E.Hec. 67; puknh\n bai/nwn h)/. Id.Ph.844; pikra\n diw/kwn h)/. Id.HF1041.
h)luska/zw, v. h)laska/zw. h)=lfon, v. a)lfa/nw. h(/lw, v. a(li/skomai. h)lw/mhn, v. a)la/omai.

h(lwto/s, h/, o/n, (h(lo/w)
nailed, nail-shaped, Paul.Aeg.6.66.

h(=ma, atos, to/, ('ihmi)
that which is thrown, dart, javelin, h(/masin e)/pleu a)/ristos best
at darting, Il.23.891: hence h(/mwn (q.v.). vh=ma, v. ei(=ma.

h)ma^qo/eis, essa, en (or -o/eis, en if *pu/los (q.v.) be fem.), Ep. for a)m-, （a)/maqos)
sandy, epith. of the Elean Pylos, *pu/lon h)maqo/enta Od.1.93,al., Hes.Sc.360: generally h)maqo/essa h)i+w/n A.R.1.932. (Deriv. from the name of a river by Str.8.3.14.)

h(=mai, h(=sai, h(=stai E.Alc. (v. infr.) (but ka/q-htai, v. ka/qhmai）, h(=sqon h.Ap.456, h(/meqa, h(=ste, h(=ntai Call.Fr.122, Ep. ei(/a^tai Il.10.100, e(/a^tai 3.134 (kate/atai Hdt.1.199); imper. h(=so Hom., h(/sqw （kaq-) A.Pr.916; subj. and opt. only in compd. kaq-; inf. h(=sqai; part. h(/menos: impf. h(/mhn, h(=so, h(=sto (but e)ka/qhto, kaq-h=to, v. ka/qhmai), dual h(/sqhn （e(h/sqhn Orph.A.815), pl. h(/meqa （h(/mesqa E.IA88), h(=sqe Cratin.142, h(=nto, Ep. ei(/a^to Il.7.61, e(/a^to ib.414, e)kate/ato Hdt.8.73 (v.l. e)kaq-): (I.-E.
ēs-, cf. Skt.
āste (= h(=stai) 'sits'; aspirate borrowed from i(/zw, e(/zomai; Ep. ei(/atai ei(/ato fr. h(/atai h(/ato (which shd. perh. be restored) through e(/atai e(/ato):—
to be seated, sit, Il.1.498, etc.: freq. with collat. sense,
sit still, sit idle, 2.255, 18.104, etc.; h(=sqai e)n ei)rh/nh| Callin.1.4; kat' oi)/kous e)kto\s h(me/nw| po/nwn E.Fr.10; of an army,
encamp, Il.15.740, 24.542; po/lin a)mfi/ 18.509; pro/sqe teixe/wn E.Supp.664; of a spy,
lurk, Il.18.523: metaph., pro\s e)ma=| yuxa=| qa/rsos h(=stai c. acc. et inf., E.Alc. 604 (lyr.);
lie hid, h(/at' e)ni\ *trw/wn a)gorh=| kekalumme/noi i(/ppw|, i.e. in the wooden horse, Od.8.503, cf. 512; of magistrates, e)n a)rxai=s h(/menoi E. Andr.699; daimo/nwn se/lma semno\n h(me/nwn A.Ag.183 (lyr.); later, of things,
lie, i(ro\n h(=stai Hdt.9.57; e)pi\ ste/gos i(ero\n h(=ntai ka/lpides Call. Fr.122, cf. Luc.Syr.D.31; h(me/nw| e)n xw/rw| (or xo/rtw|) in
a low place, Theoc.13.40:—Constr.: mostly with Preps., e)ni\ di/frw| Il.16.403, cf. A.Pr.368, etc.; e)pi\ korufh=s Il.14.158; e)p' e)sxa/rais A.Eu.806; para\ klisi/h| Il.1.330, etc.; a)na\ *garga/rw| 15.153: c. dat., *)olu/mpw| 13.524, cf. 21.389, etc.; e)retmoi=s at the oar, E.Cyc.16; a)noro/fois pe/trais Id.Ba. 38: rarely c. acc., A.Ag.183 (v. supr.); *simo/entos koi/tas E.Rh.547: c. part . . ti/h . . h(=s' o)lighpele/wn; Il.15.245; o)duro/menos, a)llofrone/wn, Od.14.41, 10.374; pefulagme/nos h(=so Orac. ap. Hdt.7.148; e)kpeplhgme/nh S.Tr.24.

h)/maiqon, to/,
half-obol, or
two-obol piece at Cyzicus, Herod.3.45, Phoen.2.3, cf. Hsch.

h)=mar, Dor. and Arc. a)=mar, atos, to/, = h(me/ra,
day, the prevailing form in Hom., nu/ktes te kai\ h)/mata Od.11.183; nu/ktas te kai\ h)=mar by night and
day, Il.5.490, Od.24.63 (where sg. h)=mar is used as pl., as in possh=mar, e)nnh=mar, e(ch=mar）; a)=mar h)\ nu/ktes Pi.P.4.256; h)=mar alone,
by day, Hes.Op.176 (but to\ h)=.
on that day, JHS12.234 (Cilicia)); me/son h)=. mid
day, Il.21.111, cf. Pi.P.9.113, etc.; dei/elon h)=. evening, Od.17.606; h)/mati xeimeri/w| on a winter's
day, Il.12.279, cf. 16.385. used in Ep. with Adjs., of a state or condition, ai)/simon, o)le/qrion, mo/rsimon, nhlee\s h)=.,
the day of destiny, of death, Il.8.72, 19.294, Od.10.175, Il.11.484; e)leu/qeron, dou/lion, a)nagkai=on h)=.,
the day of freedom, of slavery, 6.455,463, 16.836; no/stimon h)=. Od.1.9, al.; h)=. o)rfaniko/n Il.22.490. with Preps., e)p' h)/mati
day by day, daily, Od.12.105, 14.105 (ai)e\n e)p' h)/mati S.OC688);
in a day, within a day's space, Il.10.48, 19.229, Od.2.284; e)p' a)/mati
at the close of day Theoc.24.139; e)p' a)=.
by day, S.OT199; e)p' h)=.
for a day, Id.Fr.255.3, E.Ph.401; e)p' a)=mar e(/kaston, a)=mar e)p' a)=mar, Theoc.17.96, 11.69; h)=. e)p' h)=. a)ei/ AP9.499; kat' h)=.
day by day, S.Ph.798, E.Hec.628; kat' h)=. ai)ei/ S.OC682 (lyr.); a)ei\ kat' h)=. E.Tr.392; a)ei\ to\ kat' h)=. Id.El.145 (lyr.); to\ kat' a)=mar
the needs of the day, one's daily bread, S.Ph.1089,Fr.593(lyr.); but kat' a)=. also,
this day, to-day, Id.OC1079,cf.Aj.753; to\ me\n par' a)=., to\ de/
on one day, and on the next . . , Pi.P.11.63; par' h)=.
on the morrow, S.OC1455(lyr.); par' h)=. h(me/ra day
after day, Id.Aj.475; i)n a)/mata pa/nta
in perpetuity, IG5(2).5 (Tegea); without i)n, ib.262.22 (Mantinea).

h(marthme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass. of a(marta/nw,
faultily, h(gei=sqai Pl.Men.88e; h(. e)/xein Id.Lg.670c, Iamb.VP33.233.

h)ma/tios [a^], h, on, （h)=mar) poet. for h(merh/sios,
by day, h)mati/h me\n dfai/nesken me/gan i(sto/n, nu/ktas d' a)llu/esken Od.2.104, cf. 19.149; h)ma/tiai speu/dousi [me/lissai] Hes.Th.597; h). fe/ggos, i.e. the sun, AP9.651 (Paul. Sil.).
day by day, daily, Il.9.72.
h)/mbroton, Ep. aor. 2 of a(marta/nw.

h(meda^po/s, h/, o/n, (h(uei=s)
of our land or
country, native, opp. a)llodapo/s, xarakth/r Ar.Pax220; no/misma h(. IG12.91.4; stratih/ Call.Fr. 152: of a person, Pl.Thg.124d, Luc.Phal.1.11; h( h(medaph/ (sc. gh=) IG12.115.30; of the Roman empire, opp. to barbarian lands, Hdn. 1.1.4. (h(med- = Skt.
asmad-, stem of 1st pers. pl. pron.; for the termin. -apos, cf. a)llodapo/s.)
h(me/dimnon, to/,= h(mime/dimnon, in pl., IG22.1675.265, SIG1027.11 (Cos); also h(me/dimnos, o(, IG14.423i34 (Tauromenium), Did. in Gramm.Lat.3.412 K.; h(mi/dimmnon, to/, SIG998.8 (Epid., v B.C.).
h(mei=s, v. e)gw/. h(mekte/w, v. perihmekte/w.
h)/mellon, v. me/llw.

h)me/n, Ep. Conj., correl. to h)de/ (from h)= and me/n, de/),
both . . and . . , h). ne/oi h)de\ ge/rontes Il.2.789, etc.; h). a)nakli=nai pukino\n ne/fos h)d' e)piqei=nai 5.751; sts. kai/ is added to h)de/, h). qeo\n h)de\ kai\ a)/ndra 5.128; h). de/mas h)de\ kai\ au)dh/n Od.2.268; h). dh/ pot' e)meu= pa/ros e)/klues . . h)d' e)/ti kai\ nu=n moi . . e)pikrh/hnon e)e/ldwr Il.1.453: rarely folld. by de/ or te, h) . . . polloi\ de/ . . 12.428; h). o(/soi xalepoi/ . . oi(/ te filo/ceinoi Od.8.575: more freq. by kai/, Il.15.664,670, Hes.Op.339.

h(me/ra, Ep. and Ion. h(me/rh IG12(5).1（Ios), Dor. a)me/ra ib.5(1).213.43,al., 1390.109, 1432.25, Test.Epict.4.12, Michel995A 32, etc., Locr. a)ma/ra IG9(1).334.42 (aspirated perh. only in Att. and West Ion., cf. e)pa/meros Pi., etc., au)qhmero/n IG7.235.18 (Oropus), etc.; usu. unaspirated in early Att. Inscrr., IG12.49.6, al.; aspirated in codd. even in dialects: original a)me/ra prob. took aspirate from e(spe/ra): h(:—
day, less freq. than h)=mar in Hom., h(. h(/de kako\n fe/rei Il.8.541, 13.828; ti/s nu/ moi h(. h(/de; Od.24.514; nu/ktes te kai\ h(. 14.93; mh=ne/s te kai\ h(. ib.293; nou=soi e)f' h(me/rh| ai(\ d' e)pi\ nukti/ Hes.Op.102; h( sh/meron h(., v. sh/meron: a(/ma h(me/ra| or a(/ma th=| h(me/ra|
at daybreak, X.An.6.3.6, Aeschin.3.76; a(/m' h(me/rh| diafwskou/sh| Hdt.3.86; h(. die/lamyen, e)ce/lamyen, u(pe/faine, Ar.Pl.744, Pax304, X.Cyr.4.5.14; th=s h(. o)ye/ late
in the day, Id.HG2.1.23. sts. like Ep. h)=mar, with Adjs. to describe
a state or
time of life, e)pi/ponos a(.
a life of misery, S.Tr.654 (lyr.); lupra\n a)/gein h(. E. Hec.364; e)xqra\ h(. Id.Ph.540; palaia\ a(. old
age, S.Aj.623 (but qei/a h(. Id.Fr.950 is dub. l.); termi/a a(. Id.Ant.1330 (lyr.); ai( makrai\ a(me/rai length of
days, Id.OC1216(lyr.); ne/a a(. youth, E.Ion720(lyr.); so th=| prw/th| h(. Arist.Rh.1389a24; e)pi\ th=| teleutai/a| h(. at the close of
life, ib.1389b33, cf. S.OT1529; zoh\n ble/pousin h(. look
life-like, Herod.4.68. poet. for
time, h(. kli/nei te ka)na/gei pa/lin a(/panta ta)nqrw/peia S.Aj.131; e)s to/d' h(me/ras Id.OC1138: pl., e)n h(me/rais tino/s
in the days of . . , LXX 1 Ch.4.41, etc.; h(. a)rxai=ai ib.Ps.142(143).5.
birthday, D.L.4.41.
a fixed day, takth\ h(. Act.Ap.12.21; r(hth\ h(. Luc.Alex.19; h(. e)/sthsan a)rxairesiw=n D.H.6.48, cf. Act.Ap.17.31; h(. *kuri/ou LXXJl.2.1, cf. 2 Ep.Pet.3.12, etc.; h(. kri/sews Ev.Matt.10.15: so abs., u(po\ a)nqrwpi/nhs h(me/ras a human
tribunal, 1 Ep.Cor.4.3; h(me/rai kai\ a)gw=nes Jahresh.23Beibl.93 (Pamphyl.). in pl.,
age, probebhkw\s e)n tai=s h(. Ev.Luc.1.7, cf. LXXGe.47.8, etc. abs. usages, gen., triw=n h(mere/wn
within three
days, Hdt.2.115, cf. Th.7.3; h(merw=n o)li/gwn
within a few
days, Id.4.26, etc.; a)/llhs h(. another
day, S.El.698; th=s au)th=s h(. Isoc.4.87; mia=s a)me/ras IG5(1).213.43 (Sparta, V B.C.); h(me/ras
by day, opp. nukto/s, S.Fr.65; ou)/q' h(me/ras ou)/te nukto/s Pl.Phdr.240c; tou\s . . th=s h(. a)/rtous d_
daily, UPZ 47.21 (ii B.C.); di\s th=s h(me/rhs e(ka/sths twice every
day, Hdt.2.37; di/s th=s h(. Pl.Com.207; penta/kis th=s h(. Men.326; katesqi/w . . th=s h(. pe/nq' h(mime/dimna five
every day, Pherecr.1. dat., th=|de qh)me/ra|,= sh/meron, (S.OT1283; th=| to/q' h( Id.El.1134. acc., pa=san h(. any
day, i.e. soon, Hdt.1.111, 7.203; th\n me\n au)ti/x' h(. S.OC433; o(/lhn th\n h(. Eup.233; tri/thn h(. h(/kwn two
days after one's arrival, Th.8.23; ou)demi/an h(. u(peu/qunos ei)=nai/ fhmi D.18.112; pe/nte h(me/ras during five
days, Th.8.103; ta\s h(. in the
daytime, X.Cyr.1.3.12; th\n h(.
daily, LXXEx. 29.38. with Preps., mi/an a)n' a(me/ran on one

from early in the day, Plb.8.25.11: di' h(me/rhs, Att. -ras, the whole
day long, Hdt.1.97, 2.173, Pherecr.64, Ar.Ra.260(lyr.); dia\ tri/ths h(. every other
day, Hdt. 2.37; dia\ pollw=n h(. at a distance of many

yearly, LXXJd.17.10; e)n h(me/rh|
in a single day, Hdt.1.126, cf. Men.Pk.377; e)nh(. mia=| S.OT615; th=|d' e)n h(. Id.OC1612; e)n e)kei/nh| th=| h(. Ev.Jo.14.20; e)n e(ste/raisin h(. A.Ag.1666; e)n o)ktw\ h(. Lys.20.10; but e)n trisi\n h(.
within three
days, Ev.Jo.2.19; e)c h(me/ras by
day, ou)/te nukto\s ou)/t' e)c h(. S.El.780; h(me/ran e)c h(me/ras
day after
day, Henioch.5.13, LXXGe.39.10, 2 Ep.Pet.2.8 (but e)c h(merw=n ei)s h(me/ras LXX 2 Ch.21.15); e)p' h(me/rhn e)/xein, e)f' -ran xrh=sqai,
sufficient for the day, Hdt.1.32, Th.4.69; to\ ga\r bro/teion spe/rm' e)f' h(. fronei= A. Fr.399; th=s e)f' h(. bora=s E.El.429; but tou)f' h(me/ran
day by day, Id.Cyc. 336: c. dat., e)p' h(me/rh| e(ka/sth| (v.l. -rhs -ths) every
day, Hdt.5.117; o( h(/lios ne/os e)f' h(me/rh| Heraclit.6; kaq' h(me/ran
by day, A.Ch.818 (lyr.); kaq' h(. th\n nu=n
to-day, S.OC3, Aj.801; but kaq' h(. commonly means
day by day, IG12.84.40, etc.; kaq' h(. a)ei/ [S.]Fr.1120.4: with Art., to\n kaq' h(. bi/on Id.OC1364; h( kaq' h(. a)nagkai/a trofh/ Th.1.2; ta\ kaq' h(. e)pithdeu/mata Id.2.37; to\ kaq' h(. a)dee/s Id.3.37, etc.; to\ kaq' h(.
every day, Ar.Eq.1126 (lyr.), etc.; also ta\ kaq' e(ka/sthn th\n h(. e)pithdeu/mata Isoc.4.78; met' h(me/rhn
in broad daylight, opp. nukto/s, Hdt.2.150, cf. Ar.Pl.930; opp. nu/ktwr, Aeschin.3.77; meq' h(me/ras
some days after, LXXJd.15.1; h(me/ra par' h(me/ran gignome/nh
day following on
day, Antipho 5.72; but par' h(me/ran
every other day, Dsc.3.137, Luc.DDeor.24.2; par' h(. a)/rxein Plu.Fab.15; kaq' h(me/ran ei)w/qein o)rgi/zesqai, nu=n par' h(me/ran, ei)=ta para\ du/o, ei)=ta para\ trei=s Arr.Epict.2.18.13; pro\ h(me/ras before
day-break, Diph.22; but pro\ a)mera=n de/ka h)/ ka me/llwnti a)naginw/sken
GDI5040.42 (Crete); pro\ h(merw=n e(pta\ ei)duw=n *)oktwmbri/wn SIG646.2 (Thisbe, ii B.C.); gi/gnetai, e)/sti pro\s h(me/ran, towards
day, near
day, X.HG2.4.6, Lys.1.14; also,
for the day, daily, Charito 4.2. as pr. n.,
the goddess of day, Hes.Th.124. v. h(/meros 11.

h(merai=os, a, on,
of the daytime, h(merai/as (sc. w(/ras) PLips.40iii5 (iv A.D.).
a day long, plou=s Scyl.69.

h(mera/lwy [a^], o(, h(, the contrary of nukta/lwy (q. v.), Gal.14.768 (from Dem. Ophth., cf. Simon. Jan. s.v.
nictilopa).
*(hmerasi/a, h(, (h(/meros) epith. of Artemis in Arcadia, Paus.8.18.8:
h)lu^g-a/sia, ta/, her festival, IG5(1).1387.5 (Thuria, iii B.C.); *(h. ta\ e)n *lou/sois Ath.Mitt.49.118 (Aegium in Achaea).

h(me/r-eusis, ews, h(,
spending of the day, Aq.Ps.1.2.

h(mer-eu/w,
spend the day, e)n to/pw| e)rh/mw| X.HG5.4.3; e)n th=| a)gora=| D.44.4; pro\s pu=r X.Oec.4.2; e)n po/noisin E.Fr.525 codd.: abs.,
to travel the whole day, A.Ch.710.
pass one's days, e(/khla h(. S.El.787:—Med., di/aitan h(/ntin' h(mereu/etai dub. l. in E.Fr.812.6.
work by day, PLond.3.1177.78 (ii A.D.).

h(mer-h/sios, Dor. a(m-, a, on, also os, on Plb.9.13.6, Str.7.1.5, Gem.18.4: (h(me/ra):—
of the day, ta\ h(. Hp.Mul.1.11; u(/pnoi Democr.212; h(. fa/os light
as of the day, A. Ag.22; qeoi/ PMag.Leid.W.2.10.
a day long, h(. o(do/s a
day's journey, Hdt.4.101, Pl.R.616b; h(. lo/gos a speech
lasting a whole day, Isoc.15.320; a(. xro/nos Ti.Locr.97c, etc.; zwh/ Plu.2.111c.
of or
for a day, a)nwmali/a Gem.l.c.; misqo/s PFay.91.23 (i A.D.); to\ h(. (sc. mi/sqwma)
a day's wages, Suid.; pentakosi/ous gra/fei sti/xous h(merhsi/ous 500 lines
every day, D.L.7.181. Adv. -i/ws
daily, POxy. 83.12 (iv A.D.), prob. in PGrenf.2.67.11 (iii A.D.). h(. mnhmo/sunon
calendar, Epigr.Gr.1096.1 (Stratonicea). h(merhsi/a, h(,
day-book, BGU12.32, 870.3 (ii A.D.).
h(mer-i/a, Dor. a(m- (sc. w(/ra), h(, = h(me/ra, S.Aj.208 (s. v.l.).

h(meri/dhs, ou, o(, (h(/meros) of wine,
mild, mellow, Plu.2.663d, 692e. epith. of Dionysus, as patron of the
cultivated vine (h(meri/s), ib.451c,994a.
h(mer-i/dion, to/, Dim. of h(me/ra, Gloss.

h(mer-ino/s, h/, o/n,
of day, fw=s Pl.R.508c;
by day, opp. nukterino/s, pureto/s Hp.Epid.1.5; a)/ggelos h(.
day-messenger, X.Cyr.8.6.18; cf. h(merodro/mos; h(. qewri/ai Plb.9.14.6; bohla/tai PLond.3.1177.153 (ii A.D.). h(. si=ta, in Ar.Pax 163 (anap.), is expl. by Sch., qnhta/, e)pi/geia (v.l. h(meri/wn）; i)xqu/s h(. is dub. in Ephipp.5.2 (anap.).

h(me/r-ios, Dor. a(m-, on, used by Trag. in lyr.,
lasting but a day, ge/nna, ai(=ma, E.Ph.130, 1512; ou)/te qew=n ge/nos ou)/q' a(meri/wn . . a)nqrw/pwn S.Aj.398, cf. Ant.789; ka/matos Hymn.Is.87: abs., h(me/rioi
mortals, Orac. ap. D.S.7.12, Opp.H.2.669, AP7.372 (Loll. Bass.); h(. misqo/s PMasp.164.6 (vi A.D.).
daily, ku/klos Ph.1.92 (nisi leg. h(mer<h/s>ios).—Poet. Adj., for in X.Oec.21.3 h(merino/s should be read.

h(meri/s, i/dos, fem. of h(/meros: as Subst., h(meri/s (sc. a)/mpelos), h(,
the cultivated vine, opp. a)gria/s, Od.5.69, Simon.183, Opp.C.3.458, Jul. Or.7.221b, etc.; distd. from a)mpeli/s, Ar.Ach.997: metaph., h( poihtikh\ h(. tw=n *mousw=n Plu.2.15e. = h(mero/drus, Thphr.HP3.8.2.

h(mero/-bi^os, on,
living for a day: to\ h(.,= to\ e)fh/meron,
an insect, esp.
may-fly, Thphr.Metaph.29, Plin.HN11.120; of Diogenes,
living from hand to mouth, Satyr. ap. Porph.Abst.p.270 N.

h(mero-gra/fos [a^], o(,
one who keeps a diary, Marin.Procl.37.

h(mero-da^neisth/s, ou=, o(,
one who lends on daily interest, D.L.6.99, 100.

h(mero/-dotos, on,
bestowed for a day, Theognost.Can.136 (but *(hro/dotos ib.84).

h(mero-drome/w,
to be a h(merodro/mos, Str.5.4.13, Luc.DDeor.24.1.
h(mero-dro/mhs, Dor. (?)

h(me/ro-as, ou, o(,
long-distance runner, courier, Hdt.6.105, SIG303 (Olympia, iv B.C.).

h(mero-dro/mion, to/,
astrological calendar, title of work by Pappus, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.69.

h(mero-dro/mos, on,
taking a day to traverse, xw/ra Tim.Pers.41. -dro/mos, o(,= h(merodro/mhs, Hdt.9.12, Pl.Prt. 335e, Arist.Mu.398a30, D.S.15.82: metaph., of the
sun, prob. in PMag.Par.2.190, cf. Hsch.

h(mero/-dru_s, u^os, h(,
nut-gall oak, Quercus infectoria, Id.

h(mero-eidh/s, e/s,
of the form of day, fa/ntasma Epicur.Fr. 294（p.353 U.); to\ th=s filosofi/as h(. Iamb.Protr.21.kq/.

h(mero-qallh/s, e/s, (qa/llw)
gently-sprouting, AP9.374(nisi leg. -qhle/si).

h(mero-qhriko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the hunting of tame beasts: h( -kh/ sc. te/xnh)
the art of hunling them, Pl.Sph.222c.

h(mero-kalle/s, ou=s, to/,
Martagon lily, Lilium Martagon, Cratin.98.5, Thphr.HP6.1.1, 6.6.11, Dsc.3.122:—also h(merokata/llakton, to/, ibid.

h(mero-kle/pths, ou, o(,
one who robs by day, Gloss.
h(mero-koi/ths, ou, o(, a fish,= a)nwdo/rkas, Opp.H.2.199, 224.

h(mero/-koitos, Dor. a(m-, on,
sleeping by day, epith. of a thief, Hes. Op.605, Opp.H.2.408; a(mero/koitoi blaxai\teke/wn, for a(merokoi/twn, E. Cyc.58.

h(mero-legdo/n, Adv., (le/gw)
bycount of days, A.Pers.63(anap.); logeu=sai PRev.Laws4.1 (iii B.C.);
in the form of a diary, h(.
perscripta omnia, Cic.Att.4.15.3.
to the very day, Arist.HA575a27.

h(mero-loge/w,
to count by days, to\n xro/non Hdt.1.47.

h(mero-lo/gion, to/,
calendar, Plu. Caes.59 (v.l. -logei=on):—also h(mero-logika/, ta/, Ptol.Phas.p.11 H. -lo/gion, to/,= me/ros ti tw=n peri\ th\n ku/stin, Hsch.

h(mero-mantei/a, h(,
divination by day, PMag.Lond.121.155.

h(mero-ma^xi/a, h(,
battle by day, Aristid.2.314J.(s.v.l.).

h(mero-nu/ktion, to/,= nuxqh/meron, Vett.Val.314.21, Phlp. ap. Simp.in Ph.1179.17, Phlp.in Ph.711.12, al.,
Cat.Cod. Astr.8(3).113, EM540.21.

h(mero/-pi^tus, uos, h(,
cultivated pine, Hsch. s.v. mh/kwnes.
h(mero-poie/w,= h(mero/w, Id. s.v. e)chmerw=sai:
h(mero-poio/s, o/n, Gloss.

h(mero-po/sion, to/,
day's portion of wine, BMus.Inscr.1006 (Cyzic., i A.D.).

h(/meros, Dor. a(/m-, in codd. of Pi. (v. infr.) and A. (v. infr.), but h(/m- Tab.Heracl.1.172, on, also a, on Hdt.5.82, Pi.N.9.44, etc. (v. infr. 11).
tame, of animals, xh=na fe/rwn . . h(/meron e)c au)lh=s Od.15.162; h(/. zw=|a Pl.Phdr.260b; kre/a qh/reia kai\ tw=n h(. X.Cyr.1.3.6. of plants and trees,
cultivated, e)lai/h Hdt.5.82; de/ndrea Id.4.21,8. 115; karpo/s Pl.Criti.115a, cf. Ti.77b; trofh/, of corn, Corn.ND 2. of countries,
cultivated, reclaimed, h(merwte/rh xw/rh Hp.
Aër. 12; so h(merw/tatai o(doi/
smooth, easy roads, Pl.Lg.761a. of men,
civilized, gentle, Hdt.2.30（Comp.), Pi.P.1.71,3.6; a)/ndres ou(/tws h(/. kai\ fila/nqrwpoi D.21.49, cf. Phld.Ir.p.88W.（Sup.); a(me/rois xersi/n, ai)w\n a(., Pi.N.8.3, 9.44; oi)=kos a(/. a)stoi=s Id.O.13.2; so of a lion, e)n bio/tou protelei/ois a(/meron A.Ag.721; krathqei\s -w/teros fanei= ib.1632, cf. Pl.Prt.326b, Isoc.9.67. Adv. -rws Plb.5.54.9: Comp. -wte/rws Pl.Lg.867d: Sup. -w/tata D.C.57.18. Medic., of tumours,
benign, opp. kakoh/qhs, Leonid. ap. Aët.15.5. *(hme/ra, h(, title of Artemis in Arcadia, B.10.39, Call.Dian.236, IG5(2).398 (Lusi).

h(meroskop-ei=on, to/,
place for watching by day, Aen.Tact.6.6, Str. 3.4.6.

h(meroskop-e/w,
keep day-watch, Aen.Tact.6.1.

h(meroskop-i/a, h(,
watching by day, [Id.]6.tit.

h(mero/skop-os, on,
watching by day, fu/lac Ar.Av.1174: as Subst.,
day-watcher, Hdt.7.183,192, S.Ant.253, X.HG1.1.2, Aen. Tact.6.1,al.: metaph., pisto\n h(. o)fqalmo\n e(/cw A.Th.66.

h(mero/ths, htos, h(, (h(/meros)
cultivation, of a country, Hp.
Aër. 12. of men,
gentleness, Pl.R.410d, Ephor.31(b)J., Epicur. Sent.Vat.36, Phld.Hom.p.32 O., D.S.32.27, etc.; of animals, Arist. HA588a21. as a title, Clemency, h( h(mete/ra h(. Just.Nov.115Pr.

h(merotoke/w,
produce eatable fruits, Ph.1.402: metaph., ib.455.

h(merotrofi/s, i/dos, h(,
feeding for the day:= xoi=nic, Heraclid.Lemb.5.

h(merou/sios, a, on,
daily, Gloss. Adv. -si/ws PSI4.287.12 (iv A.D.), etc.

h(mero-fa^h/s, e/s,
shining by day, a)/stron TheanoEp.10:—also h(mero-fa^nh/s, e/s, Pl.Def.411b, Arist.Top.142b1.

h(mero/-fantos, on,
appearing by day, o)/nar A.Ag.82 (lyr.).

h(mero-fu^la^ke/w,
to be a day-watcher, App. BC4.62.
h(mero-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,= h(merosko/pos, X.HG7.2.6, Ph.2.236, Ostr.Strassb.534.1 (ii A.D.).
h(mero/-fullos, on,= h(/meros, e)lai/a Isyll. 20 (Dor. with h(m-).

h(mero/-fwnos, on,
heralding the day, epith. of the cock, v.l. for i(mero/-, Simon.80B.

h(mer-o/w, (h(/meros)
tame, make tame, prop. of wild beasts, Arist.HA488a29 (Pass.), Gp.16.21.2; but simply,
to be pacified, Pl. R.493b (Pass.); dw/rois Id.Lg.906d. of plants and trees,
reclaim, cultivate, h(. e)c a)gri/wn Hp.
Aër.12, cf. Thphr.CP2.14.1, 5.15.6; also of land, Crates Com.55. of countries,
clear them of robbers and wild beasts, as Hercules and Theseus did, nautili/aisi porqmo\n a(merw/sais Pi.I.4(3).57; xqo/na a)nh/meron tiqe/ntes h(merwme/nhn A.Eu.14; or
to cultivate them, Thphr.CP5.15.6,al. of men also,
civilize, humanize, lo/gw| Pl.R.554d; a(rmoni/a| te kai\ r(uqmw=| ib.442a; di/kh pa/nta h(me/rwken ta\ a)nqrw/pina Id.Lg.937e; to\ qumou/menon Eus.Mynd.1:— Pass., u(po\ paidei/as Pl.Lg.935a.
tame by conquest, subdue, h(merw/sas de\ *ai)/gupton e)cubri/sasan Hdt.7.5:—Med., pa=n e)/qnos h(merou/menos basile/i+ Id.5.2, cf. 4.118:—Pass., po/qen sou o( o)fqalmo\s h(me/rwtai; whence that
crest-fallen look? Mim.Oxy.413.153.
h(mer-wli/as: tou\s e)n au)lh=| diako/nous, Hsch.

h(me/r-wma, atos, to/,
cultivated plant, Thphr.CP5.6.8 (pl.), prob. in HP1.7.1 (pl.).
h(mer-wre/w,= h(merofulake/w, Hsch., Phot.:—Subst. h(mer-wri/a, h( （-w=|a cod.), Id.

h(me/r-wsis, ews, h(,
a taming, reclaiming, th=s xw/ras (by clearing it of wild beasts), D.S.1.24;
cultivation, of lands, Thphr.CP2.4.3; of men,
civilizing, Plu.Num.6 (pl.), Scymn.187.

h(mer-wth/s, ou=, o(,
tamer, civilizer, of Hercules, Max.Tyr.3.7.

h)=mes, Dor. for h)=men, 1pl. impf. of ei)mi/ (
sum).
h(mete/reios, on,= h(medapo/s, Anacr.71, Anaxandr.9.

h(me/teros, Dor. a(me/t-, Aeol. a)mme/t-, a, on, (h(mei=s)
our, Il.2.374, etc.; ei)s h(me/teron (sc. dw=ma) Od.2.55, 17.534; so h(me/tero/nde 8.39, 15.513; e)f' h(me/ter' ib.88, Il.9.619; e)n h(mete/rou Hdt.1.35, 7.8.d/; h( h(. (sc. xw/ra) Th.6.21, etc.; to\ h(.
our case, Pl.Ti.27d; to\ h(. ge/lwt' a)\n pa/mpolun o)/floi Id.Lg.778e, etc.; ta\ h(. fronei=n to take
our part, X. HG6.3.14, etc.; a)/ndres h(. they are
in our power, Pl.R.556d, cf. X. Cyr.2.3.2; h(. ke/rdh tw=n sofw=n,= h(mw=n tw=n sofw=n, Ar.Nu.1202; h(me/teron au)tw=n [oi)kodo/mhma],= h(mw=n au)tw=n, Pl.Grg.514b; representing an objective gen., to\ h(. de/os fear
of us, Th.1.77; ei)s th\n h(. didaskali/an Ep.Rom.15.4. sts. for e)mo/s, Od.11.562, al., Theoc.2.31, etc.; ta\ h(.
my property, PRyl.114.18 (iii A.D.); so in Imperial titles, as h( h(. h(mero/ths Just.Nov.115Pr.

h)mi/ (v. sub fin.), I
say, the 1st pers. of pres. being used in Att. dialoguein emphaticrepetitions, pai= h)mi/, pai= boy I
say, boy! Ar.Nu.1145, Ra.37; otherwise only in 3sg. h)si/ Hermipp.1, Aeol. h)=si Sapph.97, Dor. h)ti/ Alcm.139. impf. h)=n, 3sg. h)= (the only part used by Hom., chiefly in Il., always at the end of a speech), h)=, kai\ e)p' a)rgure/h| kw/ph| sxe/qe xei=ra he
spake and . . , Il.1.219, etc.; h)= r(a, kai\ a)mpepalw\n proi/+ei . . e)/gxos 3.355, etc.; rarely with the subject expressed, h)= r(a gunh\ tami/h 6.390, cf. Theoc.22.75: freq. in Att. in the phrases h)=n d' e)gw/
said I, Pl.R.327c, etc.; h)= d' o(/s
said he, Cratin.192, etc.; h)= d' o(\s le/gwn Ar.V.795; h)= d' h(/ Pl.Smp.205c; with the subject repeated, h)= d' o(\s o( *glau/kwn Id.R.327b, etc.; later without o(/s, h)= d' o( *nei=los Philostr.
V A6.16. (Cf. Lat.
aio, ad-agium: h)= fr. *h)=kt, hence h)mi/ etc. on analogy of fh=: fhmi/, etc.)

h(mi^-, insep. Prefix, used in compos.,
half-. (Cf. Skt.
sāmi-, Lat.
sēmi-.）

h(mi-a/grupnos, on,
half-awake, Agath.4.19.

h(mi/-alfa, to/,
halfalpha, a musical note, <*>, <*>, Alyp.4, al.

h(miambei=on, to/,
half-iambic line, i.e. catalectic dimeters, in pl., Cleanth.Stoic.1.129, Anacreont.tit.

h(miambiko/s, o(,
writer of such verses, dub. in Sch.Nic.Th.377.

h(mi-amfo/rion, to/,
half-a)mforeu/s, IG11(2).161A 121 (Delos, iii B.C.), J.BJ2.21.2.

h(mi/-andros, o(,
half-man, eunuch, Hippon.114, Luc. DDeor.23.1.
h(mi-a/nqrwpos, o(,= foreg., Id.Deor.Conc.4.

h(mi-a^rou/rion,
to/,
half an aroura, BGU417 (ii/iii A.D.); as a measure,
produce of half an aroura, xo/rtou h(. PSI4.368 (iii B.C.).
h(mi-a/rrhn, enos, o(, = h(mia/nqrwpos, v.l. in Ctes.Fr.29.5, Theopomp.Hist.101.

h(mi-arta/bion [a^b], to/,
half an a)rta/bh, PRyl.167.17 (i A.D.), POxy.708.6 (ii A.D.).

h(mi-a/rta^bos, on,

semissis, Plb.2.15.6, Head Hist.Num.2 601.

h(mi-a/sta^ton, to/,
the half-indefinite, a figure of speech expressing certainty as to the genus but doubt as to the species (e.g. Virg.Aen.8.352), Sacerd.p.469K.

h(mi-astra^ga/lion [a^l], to/,
creature with only one a)stra/galos, Arist.HA499b25 (v.l. h(mi-astra/galos).

h(mi-ba/rba^ros, on,
half-barbarous, Str.13.1.58, Philostr. VS2.1.13.

h(mi-ba^fh/s, e/s,
half-dipped, half-dyed, Nonn.D.1.358.

h(mi/-bi^os, on,
half-alive, Man.2.358.

h(mi/-bra^xus, eia, u, in prosody,
half of a short, h(mibra/xeia (sc. prosw|di/a) Sch.D.T.p.207 H.: pl., h(mibra/xea, ta/, ib.p.208 H.

h(mi/-brotos, on,
half-man, i(/ppos h(. a centaur, Opp.C.2.7.
h(mi/-broxos, on, = h(mibrexh/s, Thphr.HP3.1.6, 8.6.1.
h(mi-brw/s, w=tos, o(, h(, = sq., Antiph.89, AP6.57 (Paul. Sil.).

h(mi/-brwtos, on,
half-eaten, X.An.1.9.26, Axionic.8.2, Nic.Th.919, etc.

h(mi/-ga^mos, on,
half-married, i.e.
a concubine, Philostr.VS1.21.4.

h(mi-ge/neios, on,
but half-bearded, of a youth, Theoc.6.3.

h(mi-renh/s, e/s,
intermediate, equivocal, Pl.Ti.66d; of fruits,
half-formed, Thphr.HP1.14.1.

h(mi/-grammon, to/, (gra/mma 11.5)
half a scruple, Hippiatr.22.

h(mi/-gra^fos, on,
half-written, Men.1014.

h(mi/-gumnos, on,
half-naked, Luc.DMar.14.3, Arr.Ind.24.8.

h(mi-gu/naic [u^], aikos, o(, h(,
half-woman, Simon.179.9, Suid. s.v. a)/rren:—also h(mi-gu/naios [u^], on, Id. s.v. *polu/euktos.

h(mi-da^h/s, e/s, (dai/w A)
half-burnt, nhu=s Il.16.294; *fae/qwn A.R.4.598. (date/omai)
half-divided, half-mangled, sku/balon AP9.375; xeiro\s ba/ros Nic.Al.55 (cf. h(mideh/s).

h(mi-da/i+ktos [a^], on, （dai/+zw)
half-slain, Opp.C.2.281, H.5.669.

h(mi-daktu^liai=os, a, on,
half a finger long, S.E.M.10.137.

h(mi-daktu/lion [u^], to/,
half-finger's breadth, IG22.1013.25, 5(1).1390.16 (Andania, i B.C.), Plb.6.23.11, Ph.Bel.65.3, Plu.2.935d.

h(mi-da^mh/s, e/s,
half-slain, Opp.H.1.716 (v. Il. h(miqanh/s, h(midah/s).

h(mi-da^na/kh [na^], h(,
half-dana/kh, prob.l. in Theon Prog.13: —Dim. h(mi/-ion, to/, Hsch.
h(mi-da^ph/s, e/s, expld. by h(mitelh/s, Phot., Suid.

h(mi-da_reiko/n, to/,
half-daric, X.An.1.3.21, prob. in SIG276.13 (Delphi, iv B.C.).

h(mi-deh/s, e/s, (de/w B)
wanting half, half-full, X. An.1.9.25, AP5.182 (Posidipp.), PSI4.428.24, cj. for -dah/s in Nic.Al. 55; e)c h(mideou=s ge/monta h)/dh
from being only half-full . . , Them.Or. 18.222b.

h(mi/-delta, to/,
half-delta, a musical note, <*>, Alyp.4, al.

h(mi-de/cion, to/,

h(mi/-dimnon, v. h(me/dimnon.

h(mi-diploi/+dion, to/,
a woman's dress folded at the top so as to fall half-way down the figure, Ar.Ec.318, cf. EM430.46.

h(mi-doulei/a, h(,
half-slavery, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.284.

h(mi/-doulos, on,
half-slave, E.Andr.942, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.284.

h(mi/-draxmon, to/,
half-drachma, Poll.6.160; te/tarton h(. IG12.373.18: as an apothecaries' weight, Gal.13.674, al.

h(mi/-eilos, on, (ei(/lh)

h(mi-e/ktewn, gen. -ew, to/,
half-e(kteu/s, acc. sg. -ewn (written -eon) ib.12.76.7; gen. -ew ib.22.1356; but -e/ou Ar.Nu.643; nom. -e/on ib.645,
Mémoires présentés à l' Acad. des Inscr.1923.2 (iv B.C.); written -eion ibid.; pl. -eia IG22.1672.15, 268, al.; h(mi-e/a prob. cj. in Pl.Com.174.12: Ion. pl. -ekth= Milet.7.27. (Accent doubtful, parox. in codd.; -eion, -eia may have short ei as in ei)a/n, etc.)

h(mi-ekfa^nh/s, e/s,

h(mi-e/llhn, hnos, o(, h(,

h(mi-epe/s, to/,

h(mi-e/rgastos, on,
half-wrought, half-completed, u(/lh Gal.5.538:—also h(mi-ergh/s, e/s, Luc.Astr.5, and h(mi/-ergos, on, e)/mbruon Hp.Mul.1.78; [ai(=ma] Gal.5.535; of buildings, IG12.372.5; tei=xos h(. meth=ke Hdt.4.124, cf. Th.7.2, J.AJ14.16.2, Plu.2.841d.

h(mi-e/ths, es, (e)/tos)

h(mi-zu/gios [u^], on,
forming half a pair of scales, Arist.Mech.853b26.

-zwnon ( h(mi-zw/nion cod.),
semicinctum, Gloss.

h(mi/-zws,
half-alive, Hdn.Epim. 239.

half-dead, Str.2.3.4, LXX 4 Ma.4.11, Ev.Luc.10.30, AP11.392 (Lucill.), PAmh.2.141.13 (iv A.D.).

h(mi-qe/a, Ep. h(mi-qe/h, h(,

h(mi-qe/aina, h(,
demigoddess, Opp.C.3.245.

demigod, a)ndrw=n h(rw/wn qei=on ge/nos, oi(\ kale/ontai h(mi/qeoi Hes.Op.160, cf. h.Hom.31.19, 32.19, Pi.P.4.184, Pl.Ap.28c, Isoc.9.70, etc.; once in Hom. (if genuine), h(miqe/wn ge/nos a)ndrw=n Il.12.23. Pythag. name for
five, Theol.Ar.32.

h(mi/-qhr, hros, o(, h(,

h(mi-qh=ta, to/,

h(mi-qnh/s, h=tos, o(, h(, = h(miqanh/s, Ar.Nu.504, Th. 2.52, Plb.14.5.7, Gal.10.1021; of fear, Aeschin.3.159; u(/pnos baqu\s kai\ h(. Philostr.VA2.36.

h(mi/-qnhtos, on,
half-mortal, of the Dioscuri, Lyc.511, cf. Gal.17(1).235.
half-dead, LXXWi.18.18.

h(mi/-qraustos, on,

half-Jew, J.AJ14.15.2.

h(mi-ka/dion [a^], to/,

urna, Gloss.

of or
like h(mikrani/a, a)lgh/mata Gal.12.594; pa/qos Aët.6.49; oi( h(.

semicircular, Sch. A.R.4.1613:—also h(mi/-kuklos, on, stoa/ Philostr.Im.1.12, cf. Hld.8.14. as Subst., h(mi-ku/klion, to/,
semicircle, Arist.APo.41b17, Ph. 264b24;
hemisphere, Ach.Tat.Intr.Arat.27, Heph.Astr.2.11; of a tactical formation, kata\ to\ h(. Onos.21.5.
a place for public entertainment or

Place of assembly at Samos, Porph.VP9.

theatrical machine, described by Poll.4.127, 131.

h(mi-meqh/s, e/s,

h(mi-me/qu^sos, on, (mequ/w) = foreg., Poll.6.160.

h(mi-mei/lion, to/,

h(mi/-mhdos, o(,

h(mi/-mitron, to/,

h(mi-mnai=on, to/,

h(mi-mo/dion, to/,
half a modius, Gp.7.24.2.

h(mi-moiriai=os, a, on,

h(mi-moi/rion, to/,
half a part, Hp.Ulc. 12.
half a degree, Cleom.2.1, Ptol.Alm.1.10, al.
h(mi-mo/rion, to/, sine expl., Poll.6.160 (v.l. -moi/rion).

h(=mi-mn,
half-mn, <*>, a musical note, Alyp.4, al.

h(mi/na, h(,(h(/misus)
half, Leg.Gort.2.49, SIG525.13 (Gortyn, iii B.C.), prob. in Hsch. s.v. i)nimi/na. a Sicil. measure,= kotu/lh, Epich. [290], Sophr.105; h(. basilikh/,= h(mikotu/lion, Aristid.Or.49(25).32, cf. IG7.2712.66 (Acraeph.). (Hence Lat.
hemīna; Italic and properisp. acc. to Theognost.Can.101, but prob. orig. Greek.)

h(mi/-naulon, to/,
half-freight, PGoodsp.Cair.30xli 19 (ii A.D.), PFay. 104.7 (iii A.D.).
h(mi/-nauon, to/, prob. an Egyptian measure of length, PCair.Zen.383 (iii B.C.).
h(mi-neotelh/s, e/s, gloss on neotelh/s, Herm.in Phdr.p.159 A.(s. v.l.).

h(mi/-nhros, on, contr. for h(mine/aros,
half-fresh, and so of fish.
half-salted, Xenocr.77, Ath.3.118f.

h(mi/-ceston, to/,
half-ce/sths (Alexandrian, acc. to Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.3.121b), Dsc.1.25, Hippiatr.100, Sch.Ar.Pl.436.

h(mi/-chros, on,
half-dry, PFlor.118.3 (iii A.D.), AP9.137 tit., Suid. s.v. laiyhro/n.

h(mi-cu/rhtos [u^], on, （cu^ra/w)
half-shorn, D.L.6.33.

h(mi-o/gdoon, to/,=
two xo/es, Hsch.

h(mi-obo/lion, to/,
half-obol weight, Paul.Aeg. 3.29; in form h(mi-o/belin, on coins of Aegium, Head Hist.Num.2 413.
h(mi-o/delos, o(,= h(miwbe/lion, dub. in GDI2562.26 (Delph., iv B.C.).

h(mi-o/dion,
semita, Gloss.
h(mi-o/dios, on, prob. f.l. in Arist. Oec.1352b26.

h(miol-iasmo/s, o(,
multiplying by one and a half, Antipho Soph. 75.

h(miol-i/zw,
increase by one half, xre/os Schwyzer 418.8 (Elis).

h(mio/l-ios, a, on, hyperdor. a(m-, on, (o(/los)
containing one and a half, half as much or
as large again, Pl.Tht.154c; peri/metros Plb.6.32.7; hu)/chse ta\ do/rata h(mioli/w| mege/qei D.S.15.44: c. gen., ta\s pero/nas h(mioli/as . . tou= to/te katestew=tos me/trou
half as large again as . . , Hdt.5.88; [gwni/a] a(mio/lios ta=s me/sas Ti.Locr.98a; [o( gnh/sios a)eto\s] h(. tw=n a)etw=n Arist.HA 619a13; neut.,
half as much again, h(mio/lion ou(= pro/teron e)/feron X.An.1.3.21; h(mio/lion o)fle/tw o(/ ti sula/sai let him be fined
half as much again as the amount he seized, IG9(1).333.5 (Locr., v B.C.); of numbers,
half as many again, poih/sas h(mioli/ous tou\s nau/tas h)\ pro/sqen Plb.10.17.12.
in the ratio of one and a half to one (3:2), as in musical sounds, h(mioli/ai diasta/seis Pl.Ti.36a; to\ di' o)ceia=n h(. Philol.6; h( h(mioli/a
this ratio, th\n h(. tou= timh/matos Pl.Lg.956d; a)poti/nein th\n fe/rnhn su\n th=| h(. Mitteis Chr.280.15 (ii B.C.). Adv. -i/ws Nicom.Ar.2.20, Procl.in Ti.2.223 D. h(mioli/a nau=s
a light vessel with one and a half banks of oars, D.S.19.65; also h(mioli/a alone, Thphr.Char.25.2, D.S.16.61, Mus.Belg.14.20 (but -i/ous Plb.5.101.2, -ion Hsch.), etc.; used by pirates, Thphr.Char. l.c.; h(. lh|strikai/ Arr.An.3.2.5, etc.; expld. by di/krotos (q.v.) nau=s, Hsch. troxai+ko\s h(. (sc. sti/xos) trochaic verse
consisting of a metre and a half, Heph.15.2.
h(miol-i/s, i/dos, h(,= h(mioli/a nau=s, Poll.1.82.

h(mio/lkion, to/, (o(lkh/)
half-drachm, Archig. ap. Orib.8.46.16.

h(mion-a/grion, to/,
mule (produce of o)/nagros), PEdgar13.3 (iii B.C.).

h(mio/n-eios, a, on, Ion. h(mio/n-eos Hdt.1.188:—
of, belonging to a mule, a)/maca h(.
drawn by mules. Od.6.72, Il.24.189; zugo\n h(. ib.268; ko/pros h(mionei/h,= h(mioni/s, Pamphoap. Philostr.Her.2.19, cf. Suid. s.v. h(mio/neios po/a,= h(mio/nion 1, Dsc.Eup.2.100.

-hgo/s ( h(mion-a_go/s Gloss.), o(,
muleteer, PLond.ined.2358 (iii B.C.), Rev.Phil.50.67 (Didyma, ii B.C.), Str.14.2.24.

h(mion-iko/s, h/, o/n,= h(mio/neios, zeu=gos X.An.7.5.2; o(do\s h(. a road
only fit for mules, Str.6.3.7; h(. a(/rma
drawn by mules, BGU814.6 (iii A.D.).

h(mio/n-ion, to/,
milt-wort, Asplenium Ceterach, Thphr.HP9.18.7, Plin.HN27.34; = a)/splhnos, Dsc.3.134. Dim. of h(mi/onos, Str.5.3.6 (s. v.l.). a kind of
bird, Hsch. -i/s, i/dos, h(,
mule-dung, Hp.Nat.Mul.90.

h(mion-i/ths [ni_], ou, o(,
muleteer, PCair.Zen.4.69 (iii B.C.).

h(mion-i=tis, idos, h(,
of or
for a mule, i(/ppos h(mioni=tis a mare
in foal of a mule, Str.5.1.4. h(mioni=tis, idos, h(,
mule-fern, Scolopendrium Hemionitis, Dsc.3.135.

h(mion-o/kouros, o(,
mule-clipper, Gloss.

h(mi/on-os, h(, Il.2.852, Pi.O.6.22, Rev.Phil. 50.67 (Didyma, ii B.C.), etc.; o(, Il.17.742, Pl.Ap.27e, etc.: Aeol. ai)mi/- Sapph.Supp.20a.14:—
half-ass, i.e.
mule, Il.10.352, al., Arist. HA576b11, etc.; talaergo/s Il.23.654: prov., gnoi/hs o(/sson o)/nwn kre/ssones h(mi/onoi Thgn.996; e)f' h(mio/nwn on a car drawn by mules, Il.24.702; ei)s h(mio/nous poiei=n to write an ode on
a team of racing-mules, Arist.Rh.1405b26: prov., e)pea\n h(mi/onoi te/kwsi, i.e. never, Hdt.3.153: metaph., h(. basileu/s, i.e. half-Mede, half-Persian, Orac. ap. Hdt. 1.55. h(. a)grote/ra
wild ass, onager, Il.2.852; ai( e)n *suri/a| kalou/menai h(. Arist.HA491a2, cf. 580b1, al. as Adj., bre/fos h(mi/onon
a mule-foal, Il.23.266.

h(mi/-oplos, on,
half-armed, Gloss.

h(mi/-opos, on, (o)ph/)
with half its holes, h(. au)loi/ flutes
with only three holes, Anacr.20; h(. (without au)lo/s), o(, used metaph. of
something small, A.Fr.91. h(mi/opon: h(/misu, Gal.19.102.

half-roasted, Alex.175, Luc.Gall.2 (v.l.), Hld.2.19.

semuncialis, Gloss.

h(mi-ou/gkion, to/,

ounce, Lat.
semuncia, Epich.8:—written h(mi-ou/ggion in Gal.13.558.

h(mi-pa^gh/s, e/s,
half-congealed, half-hardened, Pl.Ti.59e,60d; dro/sos Arist.Mu.394a26; w)|a\ h(.
half-hard, medium-boiled eggs, Hp.Acut.（Sp.）53: metaph., h(. sofi/a Ph.1.322.

h(mi-pa^qh/s, e/s,

h(mi-pa^xh/s, f.l. for knhmopaxh/s, Thphr.CP3.4.3.

one-edged axe (the pe/lekus being double-edged), Il.23.851,858,883.

h(mi-pe/<pe>iros, on,
half-ripe, Hsch. s.v. blh/ssa.

h(mi-pe/pwn, on, gen. onos,
half-ripe, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.5.31.6.

h(mi-pe/rshs, ou, o(,
half a Persian, Oenom. ap. Eus.PE 5.21.

h(mi-ph/xeion, to/,

h(mi-phxu^ai=os, a, on,
half a cubit long, Dsc.3.129, Gp.10.4.1.

h(mi/-pleqron, to/,
half-ple/qron, Hdt.7.176, X.An.4.7.6.

h(mi/-plektos, on,
half-plaited, Philyll.31.
h(mi/-pleuros, v. h(mi/kopos.

h(mi-ple/ws, wn,
half-full, Poll.5.133.

h(mi-plhgh/s, e/s,
half-struck, Olymp.in Mete.200.15.

h(mi-plhgi/a, h(,
paralysis, Paul.Aeg.3.16.

h(mi-plh/c, h=gos, o(, h(,
half-felled, of a tree,
cleft, [peu/kh] A.R.4.1683.

h(mi-plh/rhs, es,
half-full, ku/sties Aret.CA1.6.

ingots of gold, Hdt.1.50, cf. IG12.314.82:—also h(mi/-plinqos, o(, Gloss.

h(mi/-pniktos, on, (pni/gw)

h(mi/-pnoos, on, contr. h(mi/-pnous, oun,
half-breathing, half-alive, Batr.252, Gal.UP6.3.

h(mi-podiai=os, a, on,
half a foot broad or
high, Apollod.Poliorc.146.7, Bito 45.4.

half-foot, IG12.372.49,163, al., Thphr.HP7.2.7, Plb.6.23.2, Hermes17.4 (Delos):
h(mi-po/dios, v.l. in Gp.4.12.2.

h(mi-poi/htos, on,
half-made, Poll.6.160.

h(mi/-polon, to/,
half the sphere, Hsch.

h(mi-po/nhros, on,
half-evil, Arist.EN1152a17, Pol.1315b10.

h(mi/-pous, podos, o(,
half-foot, Apollod.Poliorc.178.3.

h(mi/-ptwtos, on, (pi/ptw)

h(mi-pu/rgion, to/,

h(mi/-pu^ros, on, (pu=r)
half of fire, Arist.Mu.395a23, Cleom.2.4, Plu.2.928e.

h(mi-pu/rwtos [u^], on,
half-burnt, AP7.401.5 (Crin.).

h(miro/dion, to/,

Cultes Egyptiens 236 (Delos, ii B.C.).

h(mi-rra^gh/s, e/s,

h(mi-rrh/nion, to/,
half-grown sheep, Michel995D33:—fem. h(mi-rrhniai/a, h(, ib. 35 (Delph.).

h(mi-rrombiai=os, a, on,
like a h(mirro/mbion, Gal.18(1).788.
h(mi-rro/mbion, to/,= h(mi/tomos 11.2b, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.20.13, Gal. 18(1).797,838.

half turning the scale, i.e.
lightly, gently, opp. a)qro/ws, Hp.Epid.2.1.7.

h(mi/-rru^pos, on,
half-dirty, ei)/rion Id.Mul.2.205.

h(mi-sa/kion, to/, (sa/kos or sa/kkos)

h(mi^sa/kis, Adv.
half a time, Iamb.
inNic.p.14P.,al.; di\s kai\ h(. two and
a half times, Papp.556.16.

h(mi-sa/leutos [a^], on, （sa^leu/w)

h(mi-sa^ph/s, e/s, (sh/pomai)
half-putrid, Hp.Morb.1.31, Gal.7.301, al.
h(mi/seia, h(, h(mi/seon, to/, h(mi/seos, h(/misos, v. h(/misus.

h(miselh/nion, to/,

h(mi^seu/elpis, idos, o(, h(,

h(mi/s-euma [i^], atos, to/,
a half, LXXNu.31.36; parallhlogra/mmou Theol.Ar.39; name of a tax on vines, PSI4.434.4 (sg., iii B.C.), Raccolta Lumbroso123(pl., iii B.C.).
h(mis-euth/s, ou=, o(, gloss on h(mitieu/s, Hsch.

h(mis-seia/zw, Hero
*Geom.7.4 (Pass.), al.

h(mi-si/klion, Hsch.
h(mi/-sios, v. h(mi/qeos.

h(mi/-skouton, to/,
half-skou/ta, Hero
*Mens.14.

h(mi/-sofos, on,
half-wise, Luc.Herm.15,
Bis Acc.8.

h(mi-spa/qion [a^], to/,

h(mi-sta^diai=os, a, on,

h(mi-sta/thron [a^], to/,
half-stath/r, IG12.917 (prob.), SIG218.25 (Olbia, iv B.C.), Schwyzer 701 (Erythrae, v B.C.), Arist.Fr.529, cf. Hsch. s.v. h(mi/xa.

h(mi-stra^tiw/ths, ou, o(,

h(mi^su/-qlastos, on,
half-crushed, Hsch.

h(misu/nqesis, ews, h(,

h(/mi^sus, eia, u, gen. h(mi/seos Hdt.2.126, Th.2.78,4.83, X.Oec.18.8, Pl.Smp.205e, IG22.1612.267, D.23.213, etc. (h(mi/sews is sts. a v.l., as in Th. ll. cc., and is found in later writers, as Dsc.2.70); also as fem., Th.4.104; later contr. h(mi/sous D.H.4.17, Plu.Mar.34, etc. (as fem., LXX 3 Ki.16.9): nom. and acc. pl. masc., Ion. h(mi/sees, -eas, Il. 21.7, Hdt.9.51, Att. h(mi/seis Th.3.20, Pl.Tht.154c (h(mi/seas is preferred by Phryn.PSp.73B.): neut. pl. h(mi/sea Th.4.16, Pl.R.438c, later h(mi/sh D.36.36 (cod. S), al., IG22.1678.23, Thphr.Char.30.16, IG12 (5).872.107 (Tenos), SIG2588.4(Delos, ii B.C.), etc.: Ion. fem. h(mi/sea^ Hdt.5.111 (hyperion. -se/h Luc.Syr.D.14), acc. pl. -e/as Hdt.8.27, also acc. sg. h(mi/sean IG2.1055.16, 1059.14, gen. h(mise/as Pl.Men.83c: h(/musus (assim.), Rev.Phil.54.192 (Erythrae, v B.C.), IG22.43A45 (iv B.C.), PEleph.20.40(iv B.C.), IG11(2).161A23(Delos, iii B.C.), UPZ 54.6(ii B.C.), etc.: neut. h(/mison, to/, Berl.Sitzb.1927.8 (Locr., v B.C.),
SIG1011.7 (Chalcedon, iii/ii B.C.), ib.671 A13 (Delph., ii B.C.), BGU 183.41 (i A.D.): pl. h(/misa SIG56.7 (Argos, v B.C.); also h(/misson, to/, ib.306.14 (Arc., iv B.C.), 1009.20 (Ephesus, iii/ii B.C.): pl. h(/missa ib. 240P (Delph., iv B.C.): acc. pl. tou\s h(mi/sous Not.Arch.4.20 (Cyrene, Aug.):—
half, as Adj., h(mi/sees laoi/
half the people, h(. d' a)/ra laoi\ e)rhtu/onto . . h(. d' a)naba/ntes e)lau/nomen Od.3.155 sq., cf. Il.21.7 (elsewh. Hom. uses only neut. h(/misu as Subst. (v. infr. 11)); tou\s h(mi/seas a)poste/llein Hdt.9.51, cf. Th.3.20, X.Cyr.2.16, etc.; h(/misus lo/gos
half the tale, A.Eu.428 (lo/gou cod. Med.); to\ h(/misu tei=xos Th.2.78; o( h(/. a)riqmo/s Pl.Lg.946a: c. gen., like a Comp., to\ u(/yos h(/misu e)tele/sqh ou(= dienoei=to
half of what he intended, Th.1.93: metaph., ou)d' a)\n h(/misus e(autou= ge/noito pro\s a)reth/n Pl.Lg.647d (ou) di' h(/misun stands for ou) dih/m. '
half-and-half', ib.806c). in Prose also with the Subst. in gen. and giving its gender and number to h(/misus, tw=n nh/swn ta\s h(mise/as Hdt.2.10; tw=n a)ndrapo/dwn ta\ h(mi/sea Id.6.23; ai( h(mi/seiai tw=n new=n
half of the ships, Th.8.8; oi( h(mi/seis tw=n a)/rtwn X.Cyr.4.5.4; o( h(/misus tou= a)riqmou= Pl.Phd.104a; tou= xro/nou D.20.8: abs., oi( h(.
half of them, Th.3.20. as Subst. in neut., h(/. timh=s, e)na/rwn, a)reth=s, Il.9.616, 17.231, Od.17.322; to\ me\n . . , to\ d' h(/. Il.13.565; ple/on h(/. panto/s Hes.Op.40, Pl.R.466c; u(pe\r h(/. pa/ntwn X.Cyr.3.3.47; h(/. ou(= dei= Pl.Phd.77c, etc.; e)n h(mi/sei th=s nukto/s at
midnight, LXXJd.16.3: usu. c. Art., to\ h(/. tou= stratou= Th.4.83, etc.; also tw)/misu Hes.Op.559, Schwyzer701 (Erythrae, v B.C.); qh)/misu Ar.Lys.116: indecl., a)po\ tou= h(/. LXXEx.30.15; tw=| h(/. fulh=s ib.Nu.32.33: pl., th=s xorei/as ta\ h(mi/sea Pl.Lg.672e; a)/rtwn h(mi/sea X.An.1.9.26; r(afani/dwn ta\ h(. Thphr.l.c.: after Numerals, e)n duoi=n kai\ h(mi/sei h(me/ras IG22.1673.73; dekatetta/rwn kai\ h(mi/sous Str.2.5.39; mnw=n . . dw/deka kai\ h(mi/sous D.H.4.17; tetrapodi/an mi/an kai\ h(/misu IG 12.373.28; without kai/, muria/dwn e(pta\ h(mi/sous Plu.Mar.34: indecl., triw=n h(/misu stadi/wn Str.8.6.21, cf. PTeb.110.5 (i B.C.), Plu.Cat.Mi. 44, etc.: as Adv., h(/. me\n nu/mfhn . . , h(/. d' au)=te o)/fin Hes.Th.298, cf. Pi.N.10.87: so in pl., ta\ me\n h(mi/sea filo/ponos, ta\ de\ h(. a)/ponos Pl.R. 535d: with Preps., ou)d' ei)s h(/. not
half, Ar.Th.452: regul. Adv. h(mise/ws
half-done, Pl.R.601c. h(/misu, to/,= h(mi/ekton, Hsch. fem., h( h(mi/seia (sc. moi=ra）, th=| h(misei/a| th=s gh=s Th.5.31; h( h(. tou= timh/matos Pl.Lg.956d; ou) ga\r e)f' h(misei/a| xrhsto\n ei)=nai dei=
by halves, D. 19.277; e)c h(misei/as Luc.Cat.1, Artem.1.26, S.E.M.10.145. (h(misu- fr. h(mitu-, h(misso- fr. h(mitvo-, cf. h(mi/teia, h(mitu/ekton; enlarged fr. h(mi-.)

h(mi^su/-tri^ton, to/,
a third half, i.e.
one and a half, Archil.167.
h(mi^su-xoi=nic, ikos, h(,= h(mixoi=nic, Hdn.Gr.2.261.
h(mi^su/-xoiros, sine expl., ibid.

h(mi-sfa^gh/s, e/s,
half-slain, Gloss.

h(mi-sfai/rion, to/,
hemisphere, Alex.261.7, Pl.Ax.371b, Hero Spir.1.8, Porph.Antr.24, etc.: dual in Ph.2.155.
h(mi-sfh/kion, to/, dub. sens. in BCH35.243 (Delos, ii B.C.).

h(mi/-sxetos, on,
half-related (cf. a)/sxetos 3), sxe/sis Olymp.in Phd.p.19N.; to\ h(. th=s pronoi/as Dam.Pr.131. Adv. -tws ibid.

h(mi/-sxoinon, to/,
half a schoenus, Tab.Heracl.1.29, al., AB 263.

h(mi-taini/dion, to/,
half a taini/a, PSI7.858.9 (iii B.C.).

h(mi-ta^lantiai=os, a, on,
in which the prize is half a talent, a)gw/n CIG2810.19 (Aphrod.), IGRom.4.161 (Cyzicus).

h(mi-ta/lanton [ta^], to/,
a halftalent, as a weight, xrusou= Il.23.751, cf. IG12.371.6; pe/nq' h(mita/lanta Is.7.44; tri/ton h(mita/lanton
two talents and a half, e)/naton h(.,= 8 1/2, Hdt.1.50,51, cf. Poll.9.54, EM744.25.

h(mi-ta/ri_xos [a^], on,
halfsalted, = h(mi/nhros, Archestr.Fr.38.7, Ael.NA13.2.
h(mi/teia, h(, prob.= h(mi/ekton, SIG998.9 (Epid., v B.C.), IG11(2).147A8 (Delos, iv/iii B.C.).

h(mite/l-eia, h(, (te/los)
remission of half the tribute, h(. tw=n kakw=n e)de/doto Luc.Nec.14.

h(mite/l-estos, on, (tele/w)
half-finished, Th.3.3, dub. in D.H.1.59, etc.; of a lady's hair,
half-done, Aeschin.Socr.18; of a child, Nonn.D.1.5.

h(mitel-e/w,
complete one-half of, xro/non Ath.Mitt. 25.412 (Pergam.).

h(mitel-h/s, e/s, (te/los)
half-finished, do/mos h(. a house
but half complete, i.e. childless, Il.2.701; bi/os Str.7.3.3, cf. Luc. DMort.19.1; *)olu/mpion Dicaearch.1.1; h(. qa/lamos AP7.627 (Diod.); h(. ni/kh D.H.2.42; fwnai/ Id.Comp.14; e)ne/rgeiai Aret.SD1.7; of a child, Luc.Sacr.5; ou)de\n h(mitele\s katalei/pein X.Cyr.8.1.3; h(. a)fie/nai D.H.Th.9; h(. a)nh/r, opp. telei/ws a)gaqo/s, X.Cyr.3.3.38; h(. peri\ lo/gous D.H.Dem.23; h(. th\n a)reth/n Ph.2.199. Adv. -lw=s Longin. ap.Porph.Plot.19.
h(mi-tesse/rion, to/, a liquid measure, oi)/nou Inscr.Prien.362.16 (iv B.C.).

h(mi-te/tarton, to/, a weight,= 1/8 mna=,
Ann.dell' Inst.37.201. = 3/4, h(. u(/dreuma PFlor.50.99.

h(mi-tetra/gwnos [a^], hyperdor. a(m-, on,
forming half a square, of the isosceles right-angled triangle, Speus. ap.Theol.Ar.63, Ti.Locr.98a, 98b, Simp.in Cael.638.3.

h(mi-te/xnion, to/,
half (i.e.
trivial)
art, Sch.D.T.p.110H.
h(mitieu/s: h(miseuth/s, Hsch.: h(mi/tion: tetra/xoun, Id.
h(mi-tmh/s, h=tos, o(, h(,= h(mi/tomos 1, Man.4.6.
h(mi/-tmhtos, on, (te/mnw) gloss on h(mida/i+ktos, Sch.Opp.H.2.287.

h(mi-tomi/as, ou, o(, (tomh/)
half an eunuch, Sch.Theoc.3.4.

h(mi/-tomos, on, (te/mnw)
cut in two, cu/la IG12.313.98; a)/ntuc Mosch.2.88. of the moon,
half-full, Theol. Ar.12. as Subst., h(mi/-tomos, o(, a kind of
cup, Pamphil. ap. Ath.11.470d. h(mi/-tomon, to/,
half, Hdt.7.39, 9.37, Inscr.Délos 298A182 (iii B.C.), AP9.137; ku/klou Ael.NA15.4; h(mi/toma w)|w=n Alex.261.10: —also h(mi-to/mion, to/,
flat side of a half-bean, Dsc.2.105, v.l. in Luc. VH2.38.
lozenge-shaped bandage,= h(mirro/mbion, Hp.Off.7, Gal. 18(2).732.

h(mi-toniai=os, a, on,
consisting of a semitone, Aristox.Harm. p.52M., Theo Sm.p.53H.; u(peroxh/ Ptol.Harm.2.9.

h(mi-to/nion, to/,
semitone, Philol.6, Aristox.Harm.p.21 M., al., D.H.Comp.11, Arr. Epict.2.11.2, etc.
half the skein or
bundle of gut in a torsionengine, Ph.Bel.68.46, HeroAut.2.6.
one of the two frames containing the to/nos in such an engine, Id.Bel.90.4.

h(mi-trh/s, h=tos, o(, h(,
half-bored, Choerob.in Theod.1.185.

h(mi-tri^bh/s, e/s, (tri/bw)
half
worn out, xlamu/s PCair.Zen.92.5 (iii B.C.), cf. CPR27.8 (ii A.D.), Sch.Ar.Pl.729.
blunt, coi/+s BCH35.43 (Delos); lei/strion ib. 8.323 (ibid.).

h(mi-tri/gwnos [i^], hyperdor. a(m-, on,
forming half a triangle, tri/gwnon, of the triangles made by drawing a perpendicular from an angle of an equilateral triangle, Speus. ap. Theol.Ar.63: neut. as Subst., Ti.Locr.98a, Simp.in Cael.561.13.

h(mi-tri^tai=os, a, on,
half every three days, tro/pos h(., of
a semi-tertian fever, Hp.Epid.1.2, Gal.17(1).233:
h(mi-tritai+ko/s, h/, o/n, Ptol.Tetr.199.

h(mi/-tri^ton, to/,
the sixth part (of a mina), Inscr. on a weight, CIG8535.

h(mi/-triyis, ews, h(,
half-massage, Gal.18(2).873.
h(mi/trwtos, on, gloss on h(midah/s, Sch.Opp.H.1.716.

h(mitu/bion [u_], to/,
linen cloth, towel, napkin, Sapph.116, Hp.Art. 37, Ar.Pl.729; of a kind of material, Michel832.23 (Samos, iv B.C.). (Egypt. acc. to Poll.7.71:—in codd. sts. h(mitu/mbion, as in Aret.CD 1.3, v.l. in Lib.Decl.26.42, which is interpr. by Suid.,
a half (i.e.
small)
grave; but prob. this form is due to the copyists, who wished to find a meaning in the word.)
h(mitu/ekton, to/,= h(mie/ktewn, GDI4957a4 (Crete).

h(mi-tu/lion [u^], to/,
half a tu/lh, BGU40.12 (pl., iii A.D.).
h(mi-tumpa/nistos [a^], on, sine expl. (cf. a)potumpani/zw), Poll.6.160;= h(miqanh/s, Hsch. (-sth/s cod.).

h(mi/-u+pnos, on,
half-asleep, Gloss.

h(mi-u/+fantos [u^], on,
half-woven, Aen.Tact.29.6.

h(mi-fa^h/s, e/s,
half-shining,= h(mifanh/s, la/rnac AP 7.478 (Leon., sed leg. h(mixanei=).

h(mi-fa/lakros [fa^], on,
half-bald, ib.11.132 (Lucill.).

h(mi-fa^nh/s, e/s, (fai/nomai)
half-visible, Str.17.1.32.

h(mi-fa/rion [a_], to/, （fa=ros)
half-robe, Aristaenet.1.4, Suid., Hsch.

h(mi/-fa^tos, on,
half (cf. di/fatos), Id.

h(mi/-faulos, on,
halfknavish, Luc.
Bis Acc.8.

h(mi/-faustos, on,
half-lit, Poll.6.160.

h(/mi-fi, to/,
half-fi=, <*>, a musical note, Gaud.Harm.21, 22.

h(mi-fo/rion, to/,
half-subscription, SIG 1109.40 (Athens, ii A.D.).

h(mi-fo/rmion, to/,
half a formo/s, Demioprat. ap.Poll.10.169.

h(mi/-fraktos, on,
half-fenced, Id.6.160.

h(mi-fu^h/s, e/s, (fuh/)
half-grown, Men.1014.

h(mi/-fwnos, on,
half-pronounced, le/cis Aristaenet.1.10. Subst. h(mi/fwnon, to/,
a semi-vowel, as r s, Arist.Po.1456b27, Phld.Po.2.16, D.H.Comp.14, D.T.631.16, etc.
half able to speak, Gal.UP6.3;
half-vocal, of certain signs of the Zodiac, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.166, Vett.Val.5.24:—hence h(mi-fwni/a, h(, Steph.in Hp.1.184D.

h(mi-fwsw/nion, to/, a kind of
garment, Ar.Fr.784; cf. fw/sswn.

h(mi/xa: h(mista/thra, Hsch. h(mixanh/s, e/s,
half-open, v. h(mifah/s.

h(mi/-xi_on, to/, a measure,
half a xi=on, PCair.Zen.12.17 (iii B.C.), etc.

h(mi/-xlwros, on,
half-green, Gloss.

h(mi-xoai=os, a, on,
holding a half-xo/os, Thphr.HP9.6.4.
h(mi-xoei=os, a, on,= foreg., PCair.Zen. 353.16 (iii B.C.).

h(mi-xoini/kion [i^k], to/,
half-xoi=nic, Hp.Nat.Mul.50, IG22.1013.21, Dieuch. ap. Orib.4.7.18.

h(mi-xoi/ni^kos, on,
holding a half-xoi=nic: to\ h(.
a half-xoi=nic, Thphr.HP8.4.5, Dsc.5.72.

h(mi-xoi=nic, i^kos, h(,
half-xoi=nic, v.l. in Hp.Nat.Mul.50, Morb.3.17.
h(mi/-xoiron, to/,= h(misu/xoiros, Hsch.s.v. de/lixra.

h(mi-xolw/dhs, es,
half-bilious, dub.l. in Hp.Epid.7.29.

h(mi/-xoon, to/,
half-xo/os, Id.Int.42 (in pl. h(mi/xoa, as SIG1027.15 (Cos), Arist.HA627b3); also h(mi/xa IG11(2).199B80 (Delos, iii B.C.); -xo/ea Hp.Morb.3.17: contr. h(mi/-xoun Arist. Ath.69.2, IG12.188.22, PAmh.2.93.12 (ii A.D.).

h(mi-xo/rion, to/,
half-chorus, semi-chorus, Poll.4.107, Sch.Ar.Eq.586.

h(mi/-xrhstos, on,
half-good, Arist.Pol.1315b9.

h(mi-xru/sous [u_], o(,
half-stater, Anaxandr.5:
h(mi/-xru_sos CIG2855.31 (Milet., ii B.C.), Annuario 6/7.407.

h(mi-xw/nh, h(,
half-xw/nh, Kretschmer Griech.Vaseninschr.p.143.

h(mi-xw/rion, to/,
half of an office or
liturgy jointly undertaken, POxy.1413.1 (iii A.D.).

h(mi/-xwstos, on, (xw/nnumi) = Lat.
semirutus, Gloss.

h(mi-yi/lion [yi_], to/, yilh/
of half size, PSI7.858.3 (iii B.C.),
PLond.ined.2095 (iii B.C.).

h(mi/-yu_xos,
semianimis, Gloss.

h(mi-wbeliai=os, a, on,
costing or
worth half an obol, PCair.Zen.19.5 (iii B.C.):—less correctly written h(mi-wboliai=os, kre/a Ar.Ra.554;
as large as a half-obol, X.Mem.1.3.12. (-beliai=os shd. prob. be restored.)

h(mi-wbe/lion, to/,
half-obol, IG12.6.90, Eup.154, Aeschin.Socr.41, Arist.Rh.1374b26, IG11.(2).287A 40 (Delos, iii B.C.), etc.:—less correctly h(mi-wbo/lion, X.An.1.5.6 codd., Arist.Fr.589 codd.Poll., Thphr.Char.6.9, Dsc.4.175:

h(mi-w/bolon Thphr. Lap.46 (-os cod.), Sor.1.63 (v.l.), Hdn.Epim.204: Dor. h(mi-wde/lion, to/, GDI2562.26 (Delph.), IG14.2406.77: Boeot. e(mniwbe/lion, to/, Supp.Epigr.3.356.5, 7 (Acraeph., iii B.C.).

h(mi-wri/a, h(, (w(/ra)
half-hour, Dam.Pr.389.

h(mi-wriai=os, a, on,
lasting half an hour: neut. as Subst., Phlp.in Ph.802.15.
h(mi-w/rion, to/,= h(miwri/a, Men.1015, Str.2.5.36, Hipparch.2.4.2, Cleom.1.6, Apoc.8.1 (v.l. h(mi/wron), Dsc.1.33.
h(=mmai, v. a(/ptw.
h)/moros, on,= a)/moiros, Hsch., Phot.:—fem. h)mori/s, i/dos, A.Fr. 165: h)mo/ricen: a)/moiron e)poi/hsen, Hsch. (h)/moros Ion. form = Aeol. a)/mmoros (q.v.).)

h)=mos, Dor. a)=mos, Adv. of Time, correl. to th=mos,
at which time, when, in Hom., freq. in protasi with th=mos, th=mos a)/ra . . , th=mos dh/ . . , etc., in apodosi (v. th=mos）; a)=mos . . , ta=mos . . Theoc.13.25; h)=. . . , dh\ to/te Il.1.475, al.: folld. by dh\ to/t' e)/peita Od.17.1; by kai\ to/te dh/ Il.8.68; by kai\ to/t' e)/peita 1.477; by kai\ to/te dh/ r(a 16.779; by a)/ra or r(a/ alone, Od.2.1, 19.428, cf. S.Aj.935 (lyr.); by thnikau=ta Hdt.4.28; by to/te S.Tr.155: rarely without some particle in apodosi, as Od. 3.491, E.Hec.915 (lyr.); h)=. o(/te A.R.4.267,452,1310, Orph.A.120, IG 14.1389i25, etc.: rarely with Subj., without a)/n, h)=. d' h)e/lios . . ou)rano\n a)mfibebh/kh| Od.4.400; h)=. h(/lios du/nh| Hp.Mul.1.23, cf. Prorrh.2.
4 (v.l.). with pres.,
while, so long as, S.Tr.531: or impf., Id.OT1134.

h(mosu/nh, h(, (h(/mwn)
skill in throwing or
shooting, Hsch.

h)mu^o/eis, essa, en,
drooping, v.l. in Nic.Th.626.

h)mu/w, aor. h)/musa (v. infr.): pf. part. h)mukw/s Sch.Nic.Th.626; cf. u(p-emnh/muke:—Ep. Verb,
bow down, sink, Hom., only in Il., e(te/rws' h)/muse ka/rh ph/lhki barunqe/n 8.308; h)/muse karh/ati, of a horse, 19.405; of a corn-field, e)pi/ t' h)mu/ei a)staxu/essin 2.148: metaph., of cities,
totter, fall, tw= ke ta/x' h)mu/seie po/lis *pria/moio a)/naktos ib.373; rare in Trag., xro/nw| d' . . h)/muse ste/gos S.Fr.864; later, simply,
fall, perish, ou)/noma d' ou)k h)/muse *lewni/dou AP7.715 (Leon.). trans.,
cause to fall, ruin, po/lin Musae.Fr.22. (In Hom. u^ in pres., u_ in aor. 1; but u_ in pres. kat-hmu/ousin A.R.3.1400, cf. Opp.H.1.228, Nic.Al.453; u^ in aor., AP9.262 (Phil.), but u_ ib.7.715 (v. supr.); cf. a)mu/w, e)phmu/w.)

h)mfisbhthme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (a)mfisbhte/w)
in a questionable manner, [diale/ktous] prosfe/resqai dub. in Phld.Rh.Supp.p.56 S.
h(mwdi/an: ai(mwdi/an and h(mwdi/asan: e)na/rkhsan （h)na/rx- cod.), ai(mwdi/asan, Hsch.; Att. acc. to Moer.
h)/mwn, v. a)ma/w (A).

h(/mwn, onos, o(, (i(/hmi)
thrower, darter, h(/. a)/ndres Il.23.886.
h)/n (A), contr. fr. ei) a)/n and e)a/n (q.v.).

h)/n (B), Interject.
see there! h)/n, ou)x h(du/; Ar.Eq.26; h)/n, meqi/emen Id.Pl.75; a)ll' h)
 xitw/n soi Men.148; h)/n, to/te bakxi/aze . . xqw/n Philod. Scarph.14; also h)
 i)dou/ Pratin.Lyr.1.15, Ar.Ra.1390, Herod.1.4, Luc.DMort.10.10, Anach.1, Alciphr.Fr.6.6, cf. Theoc.8.26; folld. by kai\ dh/, E.HF867, Ar.Pax327:—also h)ni/de (i.e. h)
 i)/de) Pl.Epigr. 20, Theoc.2.38, Call.Del.132; with toi, Theoc.1.149, 3.10.

h)=n, v. fhmi/, ei)mi/ (
sum). h(=na, inf. h(=nai, v. ai(/nw.

h)nagkasme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (a)nagka/zw)
perforce, D.H. Pomp.3 (dub. l.).

h)nantiwme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (e)nantio/omai)
in opposite ways, diakei=sqai Phld.Mus.p.103 K.
h)/negka, h)/negkon, h)/neika, v. fe/rw.
h)/|neka, v. ai)ne/w.

h)nekh/s, e/s,
bearing onwards, i.e.
far-stretching, h)neke/essi tri/bois Nic.Al.592. Adv. -ke/ws
continuously, without break, to\ pa/ntwn no/mimon . . h). te/tatai Emp.135.2: neut. h)neke/s as Adv., Arat.445, Call. Aet.1.2.8; of Time, h)neke\s ai)e/n Emp.17.35, cf. Nic.Al.517, etc. (Found in early Ep. only in compds., such as dihnekh/s.)
h)ne/mion, to/,= a)nemw/nh, v.l. for h)re/mion in Dsc.2.176.
h)nem<o>eide/s: h)xw=des, Hsch.

h)nemo/-eis, Dor. a)nemo/eis [a_], essa, en, （a)/nemos)
windy, airy, di' a)/krias h)nemoe/ssas Od.9.400; proti\ *)/ilion h)nemo/essan Il.3.305, etc.; ptu/xas h)nemoe/ssas Od.19.432, cf. Tyrt.2.3, Pi.O.4.8, E.Heracl.781 (lyr.); of Places, Call.Del.11, D.P.472; ou)/rea h). Id.1129. of motion,
rapid, rushing, ai)gi/des A.Ch.592 codd. (lyr.); au)/ra S.Tr.953 (lyr.); lagwo/s Nic.Th.453; pe/teuron Man.6.444; a)nemo/en fro/nhma
high-soaring, airy thought, S.Ant.354 (lyr.).
stirred, waved by the wind, e)rineo/s Il.22.145;
filled by the wind, i(sti/on Pi.P.1.92.

h)nemo/-foitos, on,
walking on the wind, bronth/ Nonn.D.2.24; yuxh/ ib.37.85.
h)/neto, v. a)/nw (A),= a)nu/w. h)=nqon, es, e, Dor. for h)=lqon, v. e)/rxomai.

h(ni/a (A), Dor. a(ni/a, i/wn, ta/ (v. sub fin.),
reins, Il.5.226, Od.3.483, Hes.Sc.95, Pi.P.4.18, I.1.15: rare exc. in Poets, e)f' h(ni/a,= e)f' h(ni/an (v. sq.), Ael.Tact.19.12. sg., h(ni/on, to/,
bit, Poll.1.148. (I.-E.
[nmacrnull]siyo-, cf. Skt.
nāsyam 'nose-rein', Ir.
éssi 'reins'.)

h(ni/a (B), Dor. a(ni/a, h(, post-Hom.,= foreg.,
bridle, reins, in pl., Pi. P.5.32, A.Pers.193, etc.; pro\s h(ni/as ma/xesqai Id.Pr.1010; ei)s tou)pi/sw e(lku/sai ta\s h(. Pl.Phdr.254c: less freq. in sg., *(/hlie . . e)pisxw\n xruso/nwton h(. S.Aj.847; h(. xala=n E.Fr.409: the sg. for
one rein, e)/peita lu/wn h(. a)ristera/n S.El.743. metaph., *)/erws . . h(ni/as hu)/qune palinto/nous Ar.Av.1739; duoi=n gunaikoi=n a)/ndr' e(/n' h(ni/as e)/xein E.Andr.178; e)fei=nai kai\ xala/sai ta\s h(. toi=s lo/gois Pl.Prt.338a; paralabou=sai th=s po/lews ta\s h(. Ar.Ec.466; tou/tw| paradw/sw th=s pukno\s ta\s h(. Id.Eq. 1109; gastro\s pa=san h(. kratei=n Men.Mon.81; tw=| dh/mw| ta\s h(. a)nei/s Plu.Per.11; e)ndido/nai toi=s boulh/masi ta\s h(. D.H.7.35; para\ th\n h(. pra/ttein Philostr.Im.2.18; pro\s tai=s h(., of high officials, BCH32.431 (Delos); e)pi\ tw=n h(. LXX 1 Ma.6.28. as a military term, e)f' h(ni/an wheeling
to the left (
the left being the bridle hand), Plb. 10.23.2, Ascl. Tact.10.2, Polyaen.4.3.21; [to\n i(/ppon] perispa/sas e)f' h(ni/an tw=| xalinw=| Plu.Marc.6; e)c h(ni/as, opp. e)k do/ratos, Plb.11.23.6.
any leather thong, esp.
sandal-thong, h(ni/ai *lakwnikai/ Ar.Ec.508.
h)/nia, ta/, gen. pl. h)ni/wn,= tw=n kekomme/nwn, Hp. ap. Gal.19.103; cf. h(=na.

h)|nigme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (ai)ni/ssomai)
as in a riddle, obscurely, Plot.6.2.22.
h)ni/de, v. h)/n (B).

h(ni/ka^ [i^], Dor. a(ni/ka Pi.P.4.24, al., Theoc.5.41; Aeol. a)/nika Id.29.33:—Adv. of Time, relat. to thni/ka,
at the time when, usu. with past tenses of ind., Od.22.198 (nowhere else in Hom.), Pi. l.c., S. Aj.1144, al., Th.7.73, Ar.Nu.607, Lys.19.4, Pl.Grg.509e, D.21.78, etc.; h(ni/k' e)xrh=n du/nein, nu=n a)/rxetai h(du/nesqai Timo17: with pres. ind., h(ni/kaper X.Cyr.8.8.9; meta\ th\n zwh\n . . h(ni/k' ou)k ei)si/n Phld.Mort. 36; rarely
while, h(. h)=n e)/t' e)n fa/ei E.Ion726. h(ni/k' a)/n, like o(/tan, with Subj., of fut. time,
whenever, S.Ph.880, OT1492: to denote repeated occurrence in pres. time, Id.Ph.310, Ar.Pax1179, X.Cyr.1.2.4, etc.; a)/n shd. be restored in A.Fr.304.7; a)/n goes with Verb in h(ni/k' a)\n w)fe/lei
