when it would have been to his advantage, D.29.16; but h(ni/k' a)\n a)ne/bh h( nefe/lh, of repeated occurrence, LXXEx.40.36(30). with opt. in orat. obliq., or to denote an uncertain or repeated occurrence in past time,
whenever, S.Ph.705 (lyr.): also in orat. obliq., of future time, h(ni/ka . . a)pei/h
when he should have been absent, Id.Tr.164; but h(ni/k' a)\n h(mei=s mh\ dunai/meqa, with implied protasis, D.4.31; and so h(ni/k' <a)\n> katalamba/noimi, ei) tugxa/noimi X.Oec.11.14. c. gen., h(. tou= xro/nou
at which point of time, Ael.NA12.35. h(. xrh\ flebotomei=n
in which case . . , Orib.Syn.6.13. after Verbs of knowing or remembering, ou) mnhmoneu/eis . . h(ni/ka . . ; S.Aj.1273; oi)=d' h(ni/k' *ai)/as ei(=lke *kasa/ndran E.Tr.70, cf. Ar.Ec.815.
h(ni/on, to/, v. h(ni/a, ta/.

h(nio-poiei=on, to/,
saddler's shop, X.Mem.4.2.8.

h(nio-rra/fos [a^], o(,
saddler, Gloss.

h(niostrof-e/w,
guide by reins, drive, a(/rma E.Ph.172.

h(nio/strof-os (parox.), o(,
charioteer, S.El.731. h(nio/strofos, on, Pass.,
guided by reins, h(niostro/fon dro/mon A.Ch.1022 (sed leg. h(niostrofw=).

h(nioxara/ths, o(,
riding-master (Lacon.), Hsch.

h(niox-ei/a (-i/a v.l. in Pl.Thg.123d), h(,
chariot-driving, Id.Grg. 516e, al.: pl., Id.Lg.795a; h(. a(rma/twn Hdn.1.13.8: generally,
conduct, management, th=s mhxanh=s Plu.2.966f.

h(niox-eu/s, e/ws, Ep. h=os, o(, poet. for h(ni/oxos, u(po\ d' e)/strefon h(nioxh=es Il.5.505; qrasu\n *(/ektoros h(nioxh=a 312, cf. APl.5.337;
the constellation Auriga, Nonn.D.1.178, al.
h(niox-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,= h(nioxiko/s, a)reth/ Sch.Pi.O.10(11).83. Adv. -kw=s Et.Gud. 672.29.

h(niox-eu/w, Dor. a(n-, poet. form of h(nioxe/w,
act as charioteer, o( me\n no/qos h(nio/xeuen Il.11.103, cf. 23.641, Od.6.319: metaph.,
direct, guide, phdali/w| . . a(nio/xeuen Alex.Aet.2: c. gen., th=s e)mh=s yuxh=s h(. Anacr.4: c. acc., xoro\n h(. IG3.82a.

h(niox-e/w, Lacon. a)nioxi/w (v. a)nioxi/wn), prose form of h(nioxeu/w,
hold the reins, a)nwte/rw, . . katwte/rw tai=s xersi/n higher up or lower down, i.e. longer or shorter, X.Eq.7.10: c. acc.,
drive, a(/rmata Hdt.4.193; le/ontas Luc.DDeor.12.2: metaph., *mousw=n sto/maq' h(nioxh/sas Ar.V.1022; th\n dia/noian Luc.Am.37; e)/qnea . . fresi\n h(. Epigr.Gr.922 (Emesa); th=s i(era=s kefalh=s th=s pa/nta -ou/shs Lib.Ep.987.5; basileu/ei kai\ h(. Plu.2.155a: rarely c. gen., sunwri/dos Pl.Phdr.246b:—Pass.,
to be guided, ib.253d, X.Cyr.6.1.29: metaph., of the months,
AP77.482.
h(nio/x-h, h(, fem. of h(ni/oxos, a name of Hera, Paus.9.39.5.
h(nio/x-hsis, ews, h(,= h(nioxei/a, Pl.Phdr. 246b, D.Chr.36.42; nefe/lhs o)pisqofulakou/shs Ph.2.174.
h(niox-htiko/s, h/, o/n,= sq., Procl.in Prm.p.520S. (v.l. -oxiko/s).

h(niox-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for driving, ei)=dos Pl.Phdr.253csq.; xitw\n h(. a
driver's coat, Callix.2; stolh/ Jul.Or.3.122c: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh)
the art of driving, Pl.Ion538b. Adv. -kw=s Eust.1303.35.

h(ni/ox-os, Dor. and Aeol. a)n- Pi.P.5.50 (v.l. a(n- as in N.6.66, but cf. a)nioxi/w), Sapph.Supp.20a.19, o(: (h(ni/a, e)/xw):—
one who holds the reins, driver, charioteer, Il.8.89, etc.: sts. opp. paraiba/ths, 23.132; h(. qera/pwn 5.580, 8.119; parebebh/kee de/ oi( h(. Hdt.7.40. generally,
chariot-driver, as in the games, etc., Pi. P.5.50, Ar.Pax905 (pl.), X.HG3.2.21, Pl Phdr.254b, PPetr.3p.180 (pl., iii B.C.), etc.; u(popte/rwn i(/ppwn h(. Pl.Criti.116e.
rider, Thgn. 260. o( h(. th=s new/s
the helmsman, Poll.1.98. metaph.,
one who guides, governs, xeirw=n kai\ i)sxu/os a). Pi.N.6.66; palaismosu/nas decio\s h(. Simon.149; h(. te/xnhs tragikh=s IG2.2263 (iv B.C.); pantoi/hs a)reth=s ib.7.2539.2 (Thebes); h(. kiqa/ras, of a harper, Epigr. ap. St.Byz. s.v. *mi/lhtos: fem., ai)gi/dos h(., of Athena, Ar.Nu.602; in Prose with oi(=on prefixed, Pl.Plt.266e, etc.; of love, Plu.2.759d, Hermesian.7.84. as Adj.,
guiding, gnw/mh Carm.Aur.69; a)/nemoi Man.5.153. h(ni/oxoi, oi(, at Athens, a class of rich citizens
who had to furnish chariots for public service, Ael.Dion.Fr.196, Phot. in pl., also,= e)/kforoi （e)/kforos 111), Id.
the constellation Auriga, Arat.156, Eudox. ap. Hipparch.1.2.10, etc.
h)ni/pa^pe, v. e)ni/ptw.

*h)/ni_s, h(, epith. of cows, of uncertain meaning (
yearling, fr. e)/nos (c), acc. to EM432.2, Hsch.), used by Hom. only in acc. sg. and pl.: gen. h)/ni^os A.R.4.174:—bou=s . . h)/ni_s h)ke/stas Il.6.94,275,309; bou=n h)/nin eu)rume/twpon a)dmh/thn 10.292, Od.3.382. (h)=nin codd. and Ptol. Oroandae ap. Hdn.Gr.2.71; h)/nin Tyrannioibid.: perh. a stem in i_.)

h(ni/skos, o(, Dim. of h(ni/a (B) 11,
small thong or
strap, cj. in Herod. 7.22.
h)=non, v. a)/nw (A),= a)nu/w.

h)=noy, opos, o(, h(, perh.
gleaming, h)/nopi xalkw=| Il.16.408, 18.349, Od.10.360; ou)rano/s Call.
Fr.anon.24; puro/s ib.28. (Expld. as,= a)/n-oy,
not to be looked at, dazzling, by Scholl.in Lexx., but vh=noy is prob. in Hom.）
h)/nper, related to ei)/per, as h)/n （e)a/n) to ei), X.An.3.2.21.
h)/nsei, Lacon. 3sg. impf. of a)nqe/w, Ar.Lys.1258.

h)/nustron, to/,
fourth stomach of ruminating animals, Arist.PA 674b15, HA507b9 (not the
first stomach, as Poll.2.204, Hsch.); as a dish, Ar.Eq.356, 1179, Alex.273: pl., Diox.1:—written e)/nustron in LXX De.18.3, Ma.2.3, e)/n- condemned by Phryn.140.
h)nw/gea, h)nw/gei, v. a)/nwga.
h)nw/xloun, v. e)noxle/w. h)=|ca, v. a)i/+ssw, a)/ssw:—but h)=ca, v. a)/gnumi.

h)cis, ews, h(, (h(/kw)
coming, v.l. for i(/cis in E.Tr.396ap.AB99.
*)hoi=ai, ai(, title of a poem of Hesiod, of which each section began h)/ oi(/h, Paus.9.31.5, Ath.10.428b.

h)oi=os, a, on, Ion. h)oi=os, Dor. a)oi=os,= e(w=|os,
of the morning, a)sth/r Ion Lyr.Fr.10; h)oi=ai sai/reskon Euph.53.2; h( h)oi/h (sc. w(/ra)
the morning, pa=san d' h)oi/hn . . Od.4.447, cf. Hsch.
toward the dawn, eastern, h)e\ pro\s h)oi/wn h)= e(speri/wn a)nqrw/pwn Od.8.29; pro\s qala/sshs h)oi/hs Hdt.4.100; pro\s tou\s h). tw=n *libu/wn ib.160; pro\s h)oi/hn (sc. gh=n) towards
the East, Call.Del.280. (Cf. h)w=|os.)

h)/omen, 1pl. impf. of ei)=mi (
ibo).
h(onh/, coined (fr. o)/nhsis) as etym. of h(donh/, Pl.Cra.419c.

h)o/nios, h, on, contr. from h)i+o/nios,
on the shore, sw=ma AP7.383（Phil.); ya/mmos ib.365 (Zonas or Diod.).

h)pa^na/w and h(niox-e/w,
to be in want, Hsch.: h)pa^ni/a, h(,
want, Id., EM 433.17, prob. l. in AP5.238 (Paul. Sil.).

h)p-a/omai,
mend, repair (rare word for the common a)ke/omai）, ta\ r(age/nta tw=n i(mati/wn Gal.Thras.25: abs., Id.UP3.1:—Med., aor. 1 inf. h)ph/sasqai Hes.Fr.172; ko/skinon Ar.Fr.227; r(age\n i(ma/tion Gal.Thras. 5: pf. part. Pass., i(ma/tia h)phme/na Aristid.2.307 J., cf. BCH51.326.

h(=par, a^tos, to/, (v. sub fin.)
liver, Od.9.301, Gal.2.575, etc.; of various animals, as a favourite dish, ka/prou Ar.Fr.318.5; kapri/skou Crobyl.7; [e)ri/fon] Euphro 1.23; ei) mh\ su\ xhno\s h(=par e)/xeis Eub.101, cf. Ath.3.106fsq., Poll.6.49; fasga/nw| ou)=ta kaq' h(=par Il.20.469; pai=sai u(f' h(=par or pro\s h(=par, S.Ant.1315, E.Or.1063; u(f' h(=par peplhgme/nh S.Tr.931; u(f' h(/patos fe/rein, of
pregnant women, E.Supp.919 (lyr.): as the seat of the passions, anger, fear, etc., A.Ag.432 (lyr.), 792 (anap.), Eu.135, E.Supp.599 (lyr.); xolh\n ou)k e)/xeis e)f' h(/pati Archil.131; xwrei= pro\s h(=par . . du/h S.Aj.938; th/kein h(=. Call.Aet.Oxy. 2079.8, cf. Fr.222; of love, xalepo\s ga\r e)/sw qeo\s h(=par a)/mussen Theoc. 13.71; to\ me\n qumoeide\s peri\ ta\n kardi/an, to\ d' e)piqumatiko\n peri\ to\ h(=par Ti.Locr.100a, cf. Plu.2.45of.
fruitful land, Agroetas ap. Sch.A.R.2.1248. = h(/patos, Plin.HN32.149. (I.-E.
yēq[uglide]ṛt, cf. Lat.
jecur, Skt.
yákṛt.）
h(pa^t-hro/s, a/, o/n, = h(patiko/s, dusenteri/a Steph.in Hp.1.130 D., Paul.Aeg.3.42.
h(pa^t-iai=os, a, on,= h(patiko/s 1, lobo/s Hp.Oss. 18.
h(pa^t-i/as, on, o(, = h(patiko/s 1, loboi/ Poll.2.215.

h(pa^t-i/zw,
to be liver-coloured, Dsc.3.22, Aët.16.104(94).
suffer from hepatic dropsy, Diocl.Fr.46 (prob.l.).

h(pa^t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of the liver, pa/qos Plu.2.733c; to\ h(patiko/n
divination from the liver, Sch.rec.A.Pr.484.
suffering from liver-complaint, Dsc.2.70, Philagr. ap. Orib.5.19.7, POxy.1088.48; dia/qesis Dsc.1.109.
for liver-complaint, fa/rmakon Gal.11.749.
h(pa^/t-ion, to/, Dim. of h(=par, a common dish at Athens, Ar.Fr.506, Alc.Com.25, Alex.110.16, PLond.3.1259.36 (iv A.D.), etc.

h(pa^t-i=tis, idos, h(,
of or
in the liver, dusenteri/a Gal.18(1).145; h( h(. (sc. fle/y) the
vena cava ascendens, Hp.Oss.10, Diog.Apoll. 6, Arist.HA512a6.
liver-coloured, a)lo/h Gp.6.6.2, Alex.Trall. 7.6;
hepatitis [gemma], Plin.HN37.186. as Subst.,
liver-wort, = eu)patw/rion, Ps. -Dsc.4.41.

h(pa^toeidh/s, e/s,
liver-like, tw=| xrw/mati Dsc.5.85.
h(/pa^tos, o(, a fish of uncertain kind, Eub.61, Arist.HA508b19, Speus. ap. Ath.7.300e, Philotim. ap. Gal.6.720.

h(pa^toskop-e/w,
inspect the liver for soothsaying, LXXEz.21.21 (26).

h(pa^toskop-i/a, h(,
inspecting of the liver, Hdn.8.3.7.

h(pa^toskop-iko/s, h/, o/n,
connected with soothsaying, te/xnh Phleg.Macr.4, cf. Jul.Gal.298b.

h(pa^to/skop-os, on,
inspecting the liver, soothsaying, Artem.2.69; h(. i(era/, Hsch. s.v. r(uta/.

h(pa^tourgo/s, o/n,
liver-destroying, epith. of Perseus, who killed the sea-monster by leaping down its throat sword in hand, Lyc.839.

h(pa^tofa^ge/omai, Pass.,
to have one's liver eaten, u(po\ gupw=n S.E.M. 1.286. h)/pa^fe, v. a)pa^fi/skw.

h)peda^no/s, h/, o/n,
weakly, Il.8.104;
halting, of Hephaistos, Od.8.311; a)/ndres, xe/res, A.R.2.800, 3.82; le/wn Babr.Fab.Hex.9; no/os Man.2.160; in Ion. Prose, h). pu=r
a slight, trifling fever, Hp.Mul.1.4; of a child,
weakly, ib.27; ta\ h). ib.78; h). u(/pnos
light, slight, dub. in Ion Trag.4; of ghosts, prob. cj. in Euph.134. c. gen.,
void of, fa/mas e)/sseai h)pedana/ AP9.521. Act.,
weakening, dei=ma Orph. L.382, cf. Fr.142. (Derived by Gramm. fr. a)- priv., pe/don, cf. EM 433.26, and v. nhpedano/s: better fr. a)- and pou/s, Hsch.; for the termination perh. cf. ou)tid-ano/s.)

h)peigme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (e)pei/gw)
hurriedly, Hsch.

h)peirogenh/s, e/s, (gene/sqai)
born or
living in the mainland, e)/qnos, of the Lydians and Ionians, A.Pers.42.

h)peiro/qen, Adv.
from the mainland, Arat.1094.

h)/peir-os, Dor. a)/p- [a_], h(,
terra firma, land, opp.
the sea, Od.3.90, 10.56, Il.1.485, Hes.Op.624, etc.; kat' h)/peiron by
land, Hdt.4.97, 8.66; mh/t' e)n qala/tth| mh/t' e)n h)pei/rw| Ar.Ach.534, cf. Timocr.8: hence, even of an island, h)/peiro/nde Od.5.56; but, esp.
the mainland of Western Greece, opp. the neighbouring islands, Od.14.97, al.; h)/peiro/nde 18.84, cf. Th.3.114 (so as pr. n., Pi.N.4.51, X.HG6.1.7, etc.): generally,
mainland, opp. islands, Hdt.1.148,171, al., Th.1.5, Philostr. VA1.20, etc. later,
a continent, esp. of Asia. Hdt.1.96, 4.91, A.Pers.718 (troch.), X.HG3.1.5, D.60.11, etc.; r(ei=qron h)pei/roin （-wn codd.) o(/ron, of the Tanais or Phasis, A.Pr.790; so dissai\ a)/peiroi, i.e. Europe and Asia, S.Tr.101 (lyr.); tw\ du/' h)pei/rw Id.Fr.881; e)f' e(kate/ras th=s h). Isoc.4.35; h)/. doiai/, di/dumai, a)mfo/terai, Mosch. 2.8, AP7.18 (Antip. Thess.), 240 (Adaeus), Lib.Ep.783.3; r(i/zan a)pei/ron tri/tan, of Libya, Pi.P.9.8.
plain, opp. mountain, h)/peiro/nde A.R.2.734,976. in Egypt,
land above inundationlevel, PGiss.48.8 (iii A.D.); more freq., gh= h)/. PLond.3.1201.2 (ii B.C.), etc. (Fr. a_)per-
yos, cf. Germ. Ufer.）

h)peir-o/w,
to make into mainland, opp. qalatto/w, Arist.Mu.400a28; buqo/n AP9.670:—Pass.,
to become so, Th.2.102, Ph.2.511.

h)peir-w/ths, on, o(, fem. h)peir-w=tis, idos,
landsman, Luc.Ind.19; a)/gein a)peirw/tan [i)xqu/n] to treat it
as a landsman, Theoc.21.58 (prob. l.); i(/ppoi Philostr.Im.1.30. Subst. -w/ths, o(,
dweller on the mainland, opp. nhsiw/ths, Hdt.6.49, cf. 1.171, Isoc.4.132: fem. Adj., ai( h)peirw/tides *ai)oli/des po/lies, opp. to those in islands, Hdt.1.151, cf. 7.109, Th.1.5, al.; also h). cummaxi/a alliance
with a military power, opp. nautikh/, ib.35, cf. 4.12; po/leis th=| paraskeuh=| h)peirw/tidas Id.6.86. Asiatic, yuxh/ E.Andr.159: Subst. fem., ib.652. *)hpeirw/ths, ou, o(,
an Epirote, Arist.Fr.494.

h)peir-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
continental, e)/qnh X.HG6.1.12, Arist.Pol.1338b22.
of a landsman, bi/os Max. Tyr.19.7, cf. 8.9, al.
of Epirus, pa=n to\ *)hpeirwtiko/n Th.3.102; *)h. [mh=la] Dsc. 1.115.

h)/per, poet. h)e/per, (h)/)
than at all, than even, after a Comp., v. h)/ (A).

h(=per,
in the same way as, v. o(/sper 11.4.

h)pero/p-euma, atos, to/,
cozener, gunaikw=n Critias 1.3 D.
h)perop-eu/s, e/ws, Ep. h=os, o(, = h)peropeuth/s, h)peroph=a/ t' e)/men kai\ e)pi/klopon Od.11.364; of Bacchus, AP9.524.8; of dreams, A.R.3.617.

h)perop-euth/s, ou=, o(,
a cheat, deceiver, of Paris (cf. sq.), gunaimane/s, h)peropeuta/ (Ep. voc.) Il.3.39, cf.h.Merc.282, etc.

h)perop-eu/w, Ep. Verb, used only in pres. and impf.,
cheat, cajole: c. acc. pers., esp. of
seduction, gunai=kas a)na/lkidas h)peropeu/eis Il.5.349; ta/ te fre/nas h)peropeu/ei qhlute/rh|si gunaici/ Od.15.421; so of Aphrodite, ti/ me tau=/ta lixai/eai h)peropeu/ein; Il.3.399: generally, 23.605, Od.14.400, 15.419; e)ma\s fre/nas 13.327, Hes.Op.55.

h)perop-hi/+s, i/+dos, h(, pecul. fem. of h)peropeu/s, h). te/xnh
cheating arts, [Hom.] ap.Str.1.2.4, etc.

h)/p-hsis, ews, h(,
mending, Eust.1647.60:

h)p-hth/s, ou=, o(,
repairer, mender, Batr.184, POxy.2149.21 (ii/iii A.D.), v.l. in X.Cyr.1.6.16; condemned by Phryn.73; prosta/ths tw=n h). Sammelb.3939, cf. 3962: —fem. h)p-h/tria, h(,
needlewoman, UPZ91.16 (ii B.C.), POxy.1679.5 (iii A.D.), Hsch. (pi/t- cod.) (Dor. a)ph/tria Id.):

h)p-hth/rion, to/,
needle, Ael.Dion.Fr.29, Gloss.

h)/p-htron, to/, in pl.,
mender's wages, POxy. 736.10 (i B.C./i A.D.), PTeb.120 Intr.(i B.C.).

h)pi^ai/nw, (h)/pios)
mitigate, prob. in Arist.Mu.397b1.

h)pi^a^l-e/w,
have a fever or
ague, Ar.Ach.1165 (lyr.), Arist.Pr.947b21.

h)pi^a^/l-hs, htos, o(, = e)fia/lths,
nightmare, personified in Sophr.68: acc. *)hpia/lhta Id.70: -o/lhs Hdn.Gr.2.518; cf. sq.

h)pi^/a^l-os, o(,
ague, Thgn.174, Gal.7.347; h). pureto/s Hp.Superf.34, Dsc.4.68; h). puretou= pro/dromos Ar.Fr.332: in pl., h). kai\ puretoi/ Hp.
Aër.3: metaph., a)hdo/nwn h).
ague to nightingales, Com. name of a bad poet, Phryn. Com.69. = foreg.,
nightmare, Ar.V.1038, as expld. by Did. ap.Sch. (but coupled with puretoi/).

h)pi^a^l-w/dhs, es,
like the h)pi/alos,
aguish, puretoi/ Hp.Epid.4.20.
h)pia/rguron: to\ ba/lsamon, Hsch.
h)pia/w, aor. 1 Pass. h)pih/qh, = e)tapeinw/qh, Hsch. (s.v.l.).

h)pi^o-di/nhtos [di_], on,
softly-rolling, ble/fara AP5.249 (Paul. Sil.).

h)pi^o/-dwros, on,
soothing by gifts, bountiful, fond, mh/thr Il.6.251; *ku/pris Stesich.26; *mou=sai Opp.H.4.7, etc.

h)pi^o-dw/ths, ou, o(,
giver of h)/pia （fa/rmaka), of Asclepius, Orph.*eu)xh/ 37.

h)pi^o/-qu_mos, on,
gentle of mood, APl.4.65, Orph.H.59.15.
h)pio/lhs and h(p-, ou, o(, v. h)pia/lhs and h(pi/olos.
h)pio/lion, to/, Dim. of h)pi/alos, Hsch.

h(pi/olos, o(,
moth, Arist.HA605b14 (v.l. h(pio/lhs).

h)pio/-moiros, on,
of kindly fate, Castorio 1 codd.Ath.(sed leg. h(lio/morfos, q.v.).

h)pio/-mu_qos, on,
soft-speaking, Max.68.

h)/pi^os, a, on, also os, on Hes.Th.407, E.Tr.53, etc. of persons,
gentle, kind, path\r w(\s h)/pios ai)ei/ Il.24.770, cf. Od.2.47,234; of a monarch, a)gano\s kai\ h)/. ib.230, 5.8. cf. 14.139; h(ni/oxos Il.23.281: c. dat. pers., e)qe/lw de/ toi h)/pios ei)=nai 8.40, cf. Od.10.337, etc.; h)/. a)nqrw/poisi kai\ a)qana/toisi qeoi=si Hes.Th.407; h)piw/teros tou= patro/s Hdt. 5.92.z/; of the gods, swth=ras . . h)pi/ous q' h(mi=n molei=n S.Ph.738; qeo\s a)nqrw/poisin -w/tatos E.Ba.861; cf. Ar.V.879 (lyr.); e)xi/dnhs ou)de\n -wte/ra E.Alc.310; ou)de/ pw h)/pios
appeased, Id.Med.133: later in Prose, 1 Ep.Thess.2.7, 2 Ep.Ti.2.24. of feelings, words, etc., ei)/ moi krei/wn *)agame/mnwn h)/pia ei)dei/h had
kindly feeling towards me, Il.16.73; o(mw=s de/ toi h)/pia oi)=de Od.13.405, cf. 15.557; h)/. dh/nea oi)=de Il.4.361; mu=qos h)/. Od.20.327; o)rgai/, fre/nes, E.Tr.53, Fr.362.6; pro\s to\ -w/teron katasth=sai/ tina Th.2.59. of heat and cold,
mild, less intense, to\ pni=gos -w/teron ge/gonen Pl.Phdr.279b, cf. Ti.85a (Comp.); h)piw/terai ai( qe/rmai, of a fever, Hp.Epid.7.1; ta\ tou= puretou= h)/pia ib.5.73; ai)qe/rion pu=r h)/. o)/n Parm.8.57; of river-currents, -w/tera r(eu/mata Meno Iatr.16.26. Act.,
soothing, assuaging, fa/rmaka Il.4.218, 11.515; opp. i)sxura/, Hdt.3.130, cf.7.142 (Comp.); a)ke/smata A.Pr.482; fu/lla S.Ph.698 (lyr.); poth/mata
soft drinks, opp. farmakw/dh kai\ drime/a, Sor.2.44: Sup., Phld.Ir.p.44 W. h)/pion h)=mar c. inf., a day
favourable for beginning a thing, Hes.Op.787. Adv. -i/ws Hdt.7.105,143, S.El.1439 (lyr.); h). a)mei/yasqai Hdt.8.60; xrh/set' au)th/ soi to/t' h). Men.Epit.495: Comp. -wte/rws, e)/xein pro/s tina D.56.44; -w/teron kai\ khdemonikw/teron Phld.Piet.65: Sup. -wta/tws Hsch.

h)pio/ths, htos, h(,
gentleness, Epicur.Fr.462, Hecat.Abd. ap. J.Ap. 1.22, LXX Es.3.13（13.2), Phld.Hom.p.33 O., Ph.2.267.

h)pio/-frwn, onos, o(, h(,
gentle-minded, h). filo/thtos . . o(rmh/ Emp.35.13; *ai)/gina B.12.78; *)asklhpio/s IG3.171.

h)pio/-xeir, xeiros, o(, h(,
with soothing hand, AP9.525.8, prob. in Orph.H.23.8, 84.8.

h)pio/w, intr.,
feel easier, h)pi/wse tw=| sw/mati Hp.Epid.5.20 (nisi leg. h)pi/ws <ei)=x>e):—Pass.,
to be softened, h)piou=sqai u(po\ th=s mousikh=s Phld. Mus.p.33 K.: aor. h)piw/qhn Sch.Il.1.146.
h)pi/tades: e)pi/thdes, Hsch.
h(plwme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (a(plo/w) gloss on e)ktetame/nws, prob. in Hsch.

h)=pou or h)= pou,
I ween, h)= pou sofo\s h)=n o(/stis e)/fasken . . Ar.V.725; h)= pou ne/os g' w)\n h)=sq' u(bristh/s Id.Th.63, cf. Il.3.43, 16.830; ironical,
S.Aj.1008, E.Med.1308; xalepo\n po/lin kataskeua/sasqai, h)= pou dh/ . .
much more . . , Th.1.142; so h)= pou alone, Lys.30.17, Pl.Phd.84d; h)= pou/ ge lsoc.1.49; also h)= pou dh/ . .
much less, prob. in Th.8.27; also h)= pou/ ge dh/ Id.6.37: and with a neg., h)= pou . . ge . . ou) dei= xrh/sasqai And.1.86. to make a hesitating suggestion,
surely . . ? Od. 13.234, A.Pr.521, Ar.Pl.970.

h)pu/ta^ [u^], o(, Ep. for h)pu/ths (which is not found), (h)pu/w)
calling, crying, h)pu/ta kh=ruc the
loud-voiced herald, Il.7.384; h). su=rigc the
shrill pipe, Q.S.6.170; po/ntos Opp.C.2.136.

h)pu/w, Dor. and Arc. a)pu/w [a_], IG5(2).6.3 (Tegea, iv B.C.), and Trag. (who use the Verb only in lyr., exc. aor. 1 h)/pu_sa E.Rh.776): [u^ in pres., exc. in Mosch. (v. infr.); u_ in fut. and aor.]:—
call to, c. acc., o(/qi poime/na poimh\n h)pu/ei Od.10.83, cf. 9.399; a)lla/ me *puqw\ . . a)pu/ei Pi.P.10.4;
invoke, a)/puen *eu)tri/ainan Id.O.1.72, cf. P.5.104; i)ale/mw| tou\s qano/ntas a)pu/eis E.Tr.1304: c. dupl. acc., ti/ me to/de xre/os a)pu/eis; why
callest thou
on me for this? Id.Or.1253: c. dat. pers., h)/pusa d' au)toi=s mh\ pela/zesqai
called to them not . . , Id.Rh.776. abs., of the wind,
roar, ou)/t' a)/nemos to/sson peri\ drusi\n u(yiko/moisi h)pu/ei Il.14.399; of the lyre,
sound, e)n de/ te fo/rmigc h)pu/ei Od.17.271;
sing, *ludi/ois a)pu/wn e)n au)loi=s Pi.O.5.19: c.acc. cogn., me/los h)pu/ontes Mosch. 2.124.
utter, speak, patro\s o)/nom' a)pu/eis A.Pr.593; ti/ pot' a)pu/sw; E.Hec.154; a)pu/sat' a)nti/fwn' e)mw=n stenagma/twn Id.Supp.800; pro\ sou= ga\r a)pu/w (Com. for u(laktw=) Ar.Eq.1023. folld. by an interrog., ti/s a)\n a)pu/oi ei) . . ;
would tell whether . . ? S.Aj.887; a)pu/sei ti/s o(/de . . ; E.Ba.984 (nisi leg. a)pu/sei: ti/s . . ;). Med.,
summon, prosecute, a)pue/sqw o( a)dikh/menos to\n a)dike/nta IGl.c.
h)r, contr. for e)/ar. h)/r, v. h)=ra (B).
h)/ra_, 3sg. impf. of e)ra/w. Boeot. for h)/rw, 2sg. aor. 1 Med. of ai)/rw, Ar.Ach.913 (v.l. h)/rw).

h)ra^ (A), 1sg. aor. 1 of ai)/rw:—but h)/ra', i.e. h)/rao, Ep. for h)/rw, 2sg. aor. 1 Med. of ai)/rw, Od.24.33. contr. fr. h)= a)/ra in dialects other than Att., as Sapph.102, Alc.94, Alcm.61, Pi.P.9.37, B.5.165, Sophr.1 D., Hp.Prorrh.1.117,120,121 (a)=ra ibid.), Herod.4.21, 5.14, Call.Fr.1.51 P., cf. A.D.Conj.223.25.

h)ra (B), acc. sg.,= xa/rin,
service, gratification, qumw=| h)=. fe/rontes Il. 14.132; mhtri\ fi/lh| e)pi\ h)=. fe/rwn 1.572, cf.578; e)p' *)atrei/+dh| *)agame/mnoni h)=. fe/rontes Od.3.164; laoi/ . . e)f' h(mi=n h)=. fe/rousin 16.375; e)p' *)/irw| h)=. fe/rwn 18.56; h)=. komi/zein Orph.L.761. later c. gen., = xa/rin,
for the sake of, on account of, for, h)=. pa/las B.10.21; h)=. filoceni/hs Call.Fr.41, cf. Dosiad.Ara18; ti/nos h)=.;
wherefore? APl.4.299. (Hdn.Gr.1.398 rightly makes it acc. of a Subst. h)/r; Aristarch. took e)pi/hra as one word, Sch.Il.1.572, Apollon.Lex., but there is no e)pi/ in Il.14.132, and e)pi/hra (q.v.) in later poets proves nothing for Hom.: —prob. (v（h=ra, perh.cogn. with ONorse
váé 'snug', 'comfortable', OHG.
alawâri 'friendly' (Germ.
albern), Goth.
unwērjan ( = a)ganaktei=n), Gr. e)ri/hros, bri/hron.)

*(/hra, Ion. *(/hrh,, h(, Hera, Il.16.432, etc.; nh\ th\n *(/hran, an oath of Athen. women, X.Mem.1.5.5. applied to the Empresses of Rome, as *zeu/s to the Emperors, IG9(2).333 (Thess.), CIG3956b (add.). Pythag. name for
nine, Theol.Ar.58. the planet Venus, Arist.Mu.392a28, Ti.Locr.96e. (Perh. connected with h(/rws and Lat.
servo, cf. *(hrvaw=|oi,=
inhabitants of Heraea.）
h)rainei= (sic): lhrei=, Hsch.; cf. h)/rhs.

*(hrai=os, a, on,
of Hera, *(/hraion or *(hrai=on (sc. i(ero/n), to/,
temple of Hera, Hdt.1.70, Th.3.68, Duris 60 J., etc.: *(hrai=a (sc. i(era/), ta/,
her festiual, *(h. ta\ e)n *)/argei SIG1064.9 (Halic.), cf. Paus.2.24.2; epith. of Zeus, *dii\+ *(hrai/w| xoi=ros IG12.840.21. *(hrai=os, o( (sc. mh/n), a month at Delphi, GDI1693, al.; at Olus, ib.5075: Aeol. *)/hraos OGI265.15 (Temnos, from Pergam.):—also *(hraiw/n, w=nos, at Tenos, IG12(5).875.23; and Magnesia, SIG589.13.
h)raiwme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (a)raio/omai) gloss on a)pokrido/n, Sch.Opp.H.1.547.
h)/raken: h)ni/asen, Hsch.

*(hrakle/hs, contr. h)pio-klh=s, o(, the former in Ep., Pi., Hdt., and E. Heracl.210, Ion1144, HF924; the latter also in E., S., and Att. Prose: the orig. forms of the obl. cases *(hrakle/eos, -kle/ei+, -kle/ea^ nowhere appear in use; but in Att. the contracted forms *(hrakle/ous Ar. Nu.1050, *(hrakle/ei E.Heracl.8,988, Ar.Av.567, *(hrakle/a_ Id.V.757 (anap.) (also in h.Hom.15.1, Hes.Sc.448, Theoc.24.1); in Ion. and Ep., *(hraklh=os, -klh=i+, -klh=a （-klh=i+ Pi.I.5(4).37, -klh=os dub. in E. Heracl.541):—these forms are still further shortd., *(hrakle/os Hdt.2.42 (v.l. -e/ous), Pi.O.3.44 (scanned -^- P.10.3), E.HF806 (lyr.), *(hrakle/i= Hdt.2.145, Theoc.25.71; *(hrakle/a^ Hdt.2.42 sq., Pi.O.10(11).16, AP9.391 (Diotim. or Call.) (scanned -^- S.Tr.233, Ar.Th.26); again contr. *(hra^klh= S.Tr.476 cod. A, interpol. in Pl.Phd.89c, Ael. VH1.24; *(hraklei= B.8.9, Th.7.73: irreg. acc. *(hrakle/hn A.R.2.767, dub.l. in Theoc.13.73; contr. *(hraklh=n v.l. in Paus.8.31.3 and Epigr. ap.Alcid.Od.24, BGU166.12 (ii A.D.): voc. *(hra/klees Archil.119, Pi. N.7.86, E.HF175; Att. *(hra/kleis Pl.Euthd.303a, etc., later *(/hrakles Orph.H.12.1 [a^], AP9.468 [a_], Gramm. ap. Lib.Ep.255: pl. *(hrakle/es Pl.Tht.169b (but *(hraklei=s Hdn.Gr.1.424), acc. -e/as Ar.Pax 741: dual *hrakle/e Philostr.VA5.5: (*(/hra, kle/os):—Heracles, Il.14.266, etc.; *(hrakle/os sta=lai (v. *(hra/kleios), prov. of going to the farthest point, Pi.O.3.44; *(hrakle/ous o)rgh/n tin' e)/xwn a temper
like Heracles, Ar.V.1030, Pax752; prov. of close friendship, a)/llos *(hraklh=s, a)/llos au)to/s (Mss. ou(=tos) Arist.EE1245a30; but a)/llos ou(=tos *(hraklh=s 'a second Heracles', Id.MM1213a13, Varr.Sat.Men.tit.: voc. *(hra/kleis as an exclamation of surprise, anger, or disgust, Ar.Ach.284, Nu.184. the planet Mars, Arist.
Mu..392a25, Ach. Tat.Intr.Arat.17. [a^, long by position in Ep. and E., as Heracl. 123.]

*(hraklei=dai, oi(,
the Heraclidae or
descendants of Heracles, Hdt.1.7, etc.; title of play by Euripides.

*(hra/kleios, a, on, also os, on S.Tr.51; Ep. h)pio-h/eios, in Ion. Prose h)pio-h/i+os, h, on:—
of Heracles, bi/h *(hraklhei/h, i.e.
Heracles himself, Il. 11.690, al., Theoc.25.154, etc.; *(h. sth=lai the opposite headlands of Gibraltar and Apes' Hill near Tangier, Hdt.2.33,4.8 (where -kle/wn is the best reading); sta=lai *(h Pi.I.4(3).12. Adv. -ei/ws
like Heracles, Luc.Peregr.33. *(hra/kleion or h)pio-ei=on, Ion. -h/i+on (sc. iero/n), to/,
temple of Heracles, Hdt.2.44, al.; also,
a huge drinking-cup, such as Heracles used, Ath.11.469c. *(hra/kleia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
his festival, Ar.Ra.651, IG3.129; *(h. qu/ein D.19.86, etc. *(hraklei/a, h(,
frothy poppy, Silene viscosa, Thphr.HP9.12.5,9.15.5, Dsc.4.66. title of poem by Rhianus. nou=sos *(hraklei/h
epilepsy, Hp.Mul. 1.7, cf. Gal.17(2).341; but *(h. pa/qos
elephantiasis, Aret.SD2.13. *(hra/kleia loutra/
hot baths, Ar.Nu.1051, ubi v. Sch. (also *(hrakle/ous koi=tai soft bedding, Megaclid. ap. Ath.12.512f). li/qos *(hraklei/a or *(hra/kleia, h(,
the magnet, Pl.Ti.80c, Ion533d, Epicur.Fr.293; from Heraclea in Lydia, acc. to Hsch. pa/nakes *(hra/kleion
opopanax, Zopyr. ap. Orib.14.62.1. *(hra/kleios, o( (sc. mh/n), a month at Delphi, GDI1685, al.; at Halicarnassus, SIG1015.1.

*(hraklei/t-eios, a, on,
of Heraclitus, h(/lios Pl.R.498b; *h., oi(,
his disciples, Id.Tht.179e, D.L.9.6.

*(hrakleit-i/zw,
to be a follower of Heraclitus, Arist.Metaph.1010a11.

*(hrakleit-isth/s, ou=, o(,
follower of Heraclitus, D.L. 9.15.
*(hraklew/n, w=nos, o(, name of month at Stratonicea, BCH11.226; at Lagina, ib.44.70.

*(hraklew/ths, ou, o(,
a man of Heraclea, Arist.Pol.1327b14, IG22.1271 (-eiw/ths ib.12.145):—Adj. *(hraklewtiko/s, h/, o/n,
of Heraclea, Arist.HA525b5; a(/mma Heracl. ap. Orib.48.8.1; [karu/a] Thphr.HP 1.10.6, 3.6.5, cf. Zopyr. ap. Orib.14.50.2; a)mu/gdala Diocl.Fr.126; o)ri/ganos -kh/ Philum.Ven.16.9; but sku/fos *(hraklewtiko/s is said to derive its name directly from Heracles, Ath.11.500a:—fem. also *(hrakleit-w=tis Thphr.HP3.3.8, al.

*(hraklhi/+s, i/+dos, h(, Heracleid, a poem
on Heracles, Arist.Po.1451a20; cf. karu/a.
*(hraklh=s, o(, contr. from *(hrakle/hs (q.v.).
*(hrakli/skos, o(, Dim. of *(hraklh=s, title of Theoc.24:—a form *(hraklei/+skos mentioned as dub. by Choerob. in An.Ox.2.268.
h)ra/nqemon, to/, = a)nqemi/s, Dsc.3.137.

h)/ra^nos, o(,
keeper, mh/lwn A.R.2.513; *(hsi/odos pa/shs h)/. i(stori/hs Hermesian.7.22; *mousai=os *xari/twn h)/. ib.16; h)/ran' a(li/wn muxw=n Simm.13; glossed by basileu\s h)\ bohqo/s, EM436.28, cf. Hsch.: h)rave/wn: bohqw=n, xarizo/menos, Id. (Cf. e)pih/ranos 11.)
*)/hraos, v. *(hrai=os 11.

h)/ra^re, v. a)rari/skw. h)rasa/mhn, v. e)ramai. *(hra/sios, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Sparta, Hsch. h)/ra^to, 3sg. aor. of a)/rnumai, Hom. 3sg. impf. of e)/ramai, Thgn.1346, Pi.P.3.20. h)ra=to, v. a)ra/omai. h)ra=ton: to\n h)re/a stra/tion, Hsch.

h)re/ma^ ( h)re/ma^s before a vowel in A.R.3.170), Adv.
gently, softly, h(/suxos, h)., said as to a horse, Ar.Pax82 (anap.); yh/xein h). to\n bouke/falon Id.Fr.42; h). e)pigela/sai Pl.Phd.62a; e)/xe h). keep
still, Id.Cra. 399e; h). h)ro/mhn Id.Prt.333e. on the stage,
aside, in a stagewhisper, Sch.E.Hec.1023, Or.671, Sch.A.Ch.46.
slightly, h). r(ilou=n Pl.Tht.152b; a)ganaktei=n Id.Phlb.47a; da/ktuloi . . h). dihrqrwme/noi Arist.HA517a32: sts. with an Adj., e)n h). prosa/ntei Pl.Phdr. 230c; h). leuko/s Arist.Mete.375a21; h). qermo/s Id.GC326a12; h). paqhtiko/s ib.328b7; h). o(moi=os Id.Top.117b23; h). yekto/s Id.EN1126b8; h). kai\ geloi=on
rather ludicrous, dub. in Luc.Merc.Cond.28 codd.
slowly, perife/resqai Pl.R.617a.

h)rem-a/zw,
to be still, silent, esp. from grief, LXX2 Es.9.3.

h)rem-ai=os, a, on,
quiet, gentle, lu=pai, h(donai/, Pl.Lg.734a; ge/nesis Id.Plt.307a; pu=r h).
a slight fever, Hp.Mul.1.38; smikra\ kai\ h)., opp. mega/la kai\ sfodra/, Pl.Lg.733c: Comp., po/lin -ote/ran poiei=n Plu.Sol.31: irreg., h)reme/steros X.Cyr.7.5.63, Thphr.Vent.29. Adv. -ai/ws, = h)re/ma, X. Eq.9.5, Gp.12.14.1: Comp. -ai/teron (v.l. -aio/teron) Arist.Mete.368a12; -este/rws e)/xein X.Cyr.3.1.30.

h)rem-aio/ths, htos, h(,
tranquillity, Hp.Praec.2.
h)rem-ei/, v. h)remi/.

h)rem-e/w, hyperdor. a)rem- Ti.Locr.95d:—
to be still, keep quiet, be at rest, opp. kine/omai, Hp.Fract.6, Arist.Ph.238b23,al., Aristox.Harm. p.12 M.; to\ h)remou=n, opp. to\ kinou/menon, Pythag. ap. Arist.Metaph. 986a24; of the object of knowledge, Pl.Phd.96b, Arist.APo.100a6; e)n toi=s no/mois h)remou=ntes diame/nein X.Ages.7.3;
acquiesce in a verdict, Pl.Lg.956d; h). th=| dianoi/a| Arr.Epict.2.21.22: acc. to Stoics, only of animate beings, Stoic.2.161.
to be unmoved, remain fixed, mo/nos ou(=tos h). o( lo/gos Pl.Grg.527b, cf. Lg.891a. c. inf.,
refrain from doing . . , Luc.Jud.Voc.4 (s.v.l.).

h)rem-hte/on,
one must keep quiet, Ph.1.89, Archig. ap. Gal.13.168.

h)re/m-hsis, hyperdor. a)re/m-, ews, h(, Ti.Locr.104b:—
rest, opp. ki/nhsis, Arist.Ph.251a26, al.; h( no/hsis e)/oiken -h/sei ma=llon h)\ kinh/sei Id.de An.407a32; e)n a)remh/sei, of e)piqumi/a, Ti.Locr.l.c.
h)rem-i/ [i_], Adv. for h)re/ma, Ar.Ra. 315, v.l. in Aristaenet.1.22 (h)rem-mei/ Theognost.Can.165).

h)rem-i/a, h(,
rest, opp. ki/nhsis, Arist.Ph.202a4; e)n h). ei)=nai Id.Metaph.988b4, cf. Aristox.Harm.p.12 M., Sor.1.46. of the mind,
quietude, h). yuxh=s peri\ ta\ deina/ Pl.Def.412a, cf. Arist.de An.406a27 (pl.); e)pi\ pollh=s h). u(mw=n leaving you entirely
at rest, v. l. for e)rhmi/as, D.13.8 (h)remi/h koi/ths is perh. a mistake for e)rhmi/h, Epigr.Gr.321.11).

h)rem-i/zw,
bring to rest, stop, i(/ppon X.Eq.7.18; o(rmh/n Arist.EE1224b8:—Pass., Id.APo.87b9, Ph.238b25, al.; kaqi/statai kai\ -i/zetai is calmed and
brought to rest, ib.248a2. intr.,= h)reme/w, X.Lac.1.3.
h)re/m-ios, a, on, = h)remai=os, Procl.in Prm.p.803 S. -ion, to/, = a)nemw/nh, Dsc.2.176 (v.l. h)ne/mion).

h)re/m-isis, ews, h(,
tranquillizing, pra/u+nsis h). o)rgh=s Arist.Rh.1380a8 (-hsis codd.).

h)re/m-isma, atos, to/,
point of rest, Simp.in Ph.1311.32.

h)/rem-os, on, later form for h)remai=os,
quiet, h)/. kai\ h(su/xios bi/os 1 Ep.Ti.2.2, cf. OGI519.10 (iii A.D.), Procl. in Prm.p.536 S.; h). pou/s Luc.Trag.207; h)/remon e(auto\n pare/xein IPE12.40.24 (Olbia, ii/iii A.D.); -w/teros e)pispasmo/s
gentler traction, Sor.1.73. to\ h)/.
smoothness, of pigments, Thphr.Lap.62. Adv. -mws
quietly, Asp.in EN120.13. (Cf. Lith.
rìmti 'grow still', Goth.
rimis (= h(suxi/a), Skt.
ramṇāti 'set at rest'.)
h)rem-o/ths, htos, h(,= h)remi/a, yuxh=s Cleonid.Harm.13.

h)resi/des, ai(,
priestesses of Hera at Argos, EM436.49 (which derives the word from *(/hra or a)ru/w).
h(/|reun, Ion. impf. of ai(re/w, Hes.Sc.302. h)rh/rei, v. a)rari/skw. h)rh/reinto, h)rh/reisto, v. e)rei/dw. h)/rhs: a)/frwn, Hsch.

h)rem-h/rhs, an Adj. termin., from a)rar-ei=n, a)rar-i/skw, as in qumarh/s, frenh/rhs, xalkh/rhs, eu)h/rhs. from e)re- （e)re/-ths), as in a)mfh/rhs, a(lih/rhs, trih/rhs, etc. prob. from (v）hr- (cf. h)=ra B) in pr.n. *perih/rhs, *diw/rhs (fr. *dioh/rhs).

h)=ri, Ep. Adv. (Boeot. acc. to AB1095)
early, h)=. ma/l' Il.9.360; ma/l' h)=. Od.20.156; h)w=qen de\ ma/l' h)=. 19.320;
in the morning, manteu/esqai Schwyzer789 (Cumae). (a_)（
y）eri, cf. h)e/rios, a)/riston.)

h)ri^-ge/neia, h(, (h)=ri, gene/sqai)
early-born, child of morn, epith. of *)hw/s, Od.4.195, etc.: also abs.,= *)hw/s, 22.197, 23.347; kaqara=s a(/per h)rigenei/as as at clear
morn, Theoc.24.39; gene/qlion h)rige/neian a birthday
morning, AP9.353 (Leon.Alex.); later, epith. of the Moon, Hymn.Mag.5.3. in later Ep.,
a day, Nonn.D.38.271, Q.S.10.478. (e)/ar)
bearing in spring, le/aina A.Fr.426 (nisi leg. h)ug-).
h)ri^-ge/neion, to/, = peristerew\n u(/ptios, Ps.-Dsc.4.60; = h)ru/ggion, Hsch.

h)ri^-genh/s, e/s,= h)rige/neia, epith. of *)hw/s, A.R.3.1224: abs.,= *)hw/s, Id.2.450;
a day, Orph.Fr.275.

h)ri^-ge/rwn, ontos, o(,
early-old, name of groundsel, from its hoary down,
Senecio vulgaris, Thphr.HP7.7.1, Dsc.4.96.
*)hri^da^no/s, o(, Eridanus, a legendary river, Hes.Th.338, Hdt.3.115; later identified with the Po, E.Hipp.737 (lyr.), etc. a river in Attica, Call.Fr.100e, Paus.1.19.5.

h)ri-ergh/s, o(, (h)ri/on)
grave-digger, Hsch.

h)ri-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
a corpse, Id.
*)hrika^pai=os or *)hrikep-, o(, a bi-sexual Orphic divinity, *)h. prwto/gonos Orph.Fr.167a.1, cf.H.6.4, Fr.60, al.; epith. of Dionysus, Hsch.
h)/ri^ke, v. e)rei/kw.
h)rino/-qermon: to\ a)/nqemon, Hsch.

h)rino-lo/gos, on,
talking in spring, te/ttic, Id.

h)ri^no/s, h/, o/n, （h)=r） = e)arino/s, a)/nemos Sol.13.19; fu/lla Pi.P.9.46; ka/lukes Cratin.98; leimw/n E.Supp.448; fqe/gmata Ar.Av.683(lyr.); xro/nos X.HG3.2.10: neut. as Adv.,
in spring, gh= t' h)rino\n qa/llousa E.Fr.316.3; o(/tan h)rina\ . . xelidw\n keladh=| Ar.Pax800.

h)ri/on, to/,
mound, barrow, tomb, e)/nq' a)/r' *)axilleu\s fra/ssato *patro/klw| me/ga h). Il.23.126, cf. SIG11 (Delph.), IG12(1).168 (Rhodes), A.R.1.1165, etc.; h)ri/a neku/wn, *koru/qoio, Theoc.2.13, Nic.Fr.108; ei(/sato bwmo/n . . , h). o)/fra ge/noito Epigr.Gr.411 (Patara); kata\ xqono\s h)ri/a teu=xon AP7.180 (Apollonid.), cf.Epigr.Gr.214.1 (Rhenea); in Prose, Arist.Ath.55.3, D.57.67, prob. in Din.2.17, cf. Lycurg.109, Plu.TG9, etc.: metaph., h)ri/a tw=n yuxw=n ta\s bi/blous Them.Or.4.59d. (Derived from e)/ra by Harp., etc.: vhri/on prob. in Hom.）

h)ri-po/lh, h(, (pole/w)
early-walking: hence,
dawn, AP5.227 (Paul. Sil.), 253 (ld.).
h)ri-sa/lpigc, v. e)ri-.
h)ri/skos, o(, perh. Dim. of h)=ros, IG11(2).199B35 (Delos, iii B.C.).

h)ri/strion, to/,
spring-garment, formed like qeri/strion, Hsch.
h)ri/fakon: qamni/skon (Lacon.), Hsch.

h)|rme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (ai)/rw)
loftily, Poll.9.147.

h(rmosme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (a(rmo/zw)
fitly, D.S.17.19.

h)roa/nqia, ta/, a feast of the Peloponnesian women
at which they wore spring flowers, Phot.: h)rosa/nqeia, Hsch.
h)roika/kai: koilw/mata th=s gh=s, Hsch.
h(roi+ko/s, h/, o/n, in late Poets for h(rwi+ko/s, Man.1.13, IG12(7).125 (Amorgos).
h)=ros, o(, dub. sens. in IG11(2).144A72 (Delos, iv B.C.); h)=ron w)noume/nwn e)/dwken . . , to\n h)=ron e)ndh/santi . . , te/los e)n *pa/rw| tou= h)/rou, ib.203A 39, 40 (iii B.C.); cf. h)ri/skos.
*(hrofa/neia, ta/, festival at Megara, IG7.48 (ii B.C.).
h)ro/xia: ta\ *qeodai/sia: oi( de\ e(orth/n, oi( de\ i(era/, Hsch.

h(rpagme/nws,
raptim, Gloss.
h)=rsa, v. a)rari/skw.
h)ru/gg-ion, to/, v. h)/ruggos.

h)rugg-i/s, i/dos, h(,
of or
belonging to the h)/ruggos, r(i/zai Nic.Al.564.

h)/rugg-os, h(,
eryngo, Eryngium creticum, Id.Th. 645,849: more freq. as Dim., h)ru/ggion, to/,
E. campestre, Thphr. HP6.1.3, Plu.2.700d,776f (both forms in Dsc.3.21, h)ru/ggion also = a)lo/h, Ps.-Dsc.3.22):—also h)ru/ggh, h(, Plin.HN22.18, Phot.; = po/lion, Hp. ap. Erot. (perh. to be read in Ulc.11); h)ruggi/ths [i_], ou, o(, Plu.2.558e, Suid. h)/ruggos, o(,
goat's beard, Arist.HA610b29 (s.v.l.).
h)/ru^ge, v. e)reu/gomai. h)ru/ka^ke, v. e)ru/kw.
h(/rus or h(ru=s, h(, fem. of h(/rws, Glotta 15.306 (Lilybaeum, ii B.C.).
h(/rw|, poet. dat. sg. of h(/rws: h(/rw, gen. and acc. of same.
h(rw/assa, h(, Cret.,= h(rwi/+nh, GDI4952 (Dreros).
h(rw/eion, to/, = h(rw=|on (q.v.).

h(rw-i/ambos [i^], o(,
poem consisting of hexameters and iambics, Tz. H.4.868.

h(rw-i/zw,
write heroic verse or
an epic poem, Eust.4.1:

h(rw-ismo/s, o(,
worship of heroes, IG12(2).29 (Mytil., spelt h(rw-oismo/s):— hence h(rw-oi+stai/, oi(, IG22.1339 (i B.C.); h(rw-weistai/ Annuario 4/5.482; h(rw-wiastai/ BCH50.15 (Delph., iv B.C.), 22.255 (Acraephia): later h(rwsth/s (q.v.).

h(rw-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of the heroes, kata\ tou\s h(. xro/nous (cf. h(/rws 1.1) Arist.Pol.1285b4; h( xlai=na h(. fo/rhma Ammon.Diff. p.140V.
of or
for a hero, heroic, fu=lon Pl.Cra.398e; h(. sw/mata
of heroic stature, Phld.Po.2.43; a)reth/ Arist.EN1145a20; h(rwi+ka\ fronei=n Luc.Am.20. Adv. -kw=s
like a hero, teleuth=sai to\n bi/on D.S. 2.45; cf. h(roi+ko/s. in Metre, h(. sti/xos
heroic verse, hexameter, Pl.Lg.958e; me/tron Arist.Po.1459b32; ei)s th\n h(. ta/cin e)panh=xqai to be brought into an Epic poem, D.60.9. Adv. -kw=s, th\n tragw|di/an a)nagnw=nai D.T.629.18.

h(rw-i/nh [i_], h(, fem. of h(/rws,
heroine, Theoc. 13.20, 26.36, Call.Del.161, D.P.1022, Luc.Nec.15, D.C.48.50: contr. h(rw/|nh, Ar.Nu.315, IG14.1389i55, 22.1358.8, al.; h)roi/+na ib.12(2).228 (Mytil.).
a deceased woman (cf. h(/rws 11), CIG2259 (Samos), IG3.889; of a deified Empress, Jul.Caes.334b.
h(rw/-ios, a, on,= h(rwiko/s, a)retai/ Pi.O.13.51; pompai/ Id.N.7.46 [w^].

h(rw-i/s, i/dos, h(, = h(rwi/nh 1, Id.P.11.7, Call.Fr.126. = h(rwi/nh 11, IG12(7).51 (Amorgos), Rev.Phil.36.55 (Iconium), AJP48.33 (Apamea). as fem. of h(rwiko/s, timai/ A.R.1.1048; a)oidh/
Epic, AP9.504. (sc. e)nneethri/s)
nine-yearly festival at Delphi, Plu.2.293c.
h(rw/-i+ssa, contr. h(rw=|ssa, = h(rwi/nh, A.R.4.1309, 1358, IG5(1).610 (Sparta), al., 12(5).325 (Paros), AP6.225 (Nicaen.).
h(rw-i+sth/s, v. -i/zw.
*(/hrwn, wnos, o(, name of a god, BCH24.374 (Bithynia), Annales du Service 20.238 (Theadelphia), etc.; also *(/hrws, wos, o(, Epigr.Gr.841 (Thrace), Call.Epigr.26.

h)rw/na, a(, perh.
service, office, e)pitele/ssanta tai\s h)rw/nais pai/sais (acc. pl.) dub. in IG12(2).242 (Mytil.).
h(rwo-goni/a, h(, a poem of Hesiod, Procl.Vit.Hes.p.8G.

h(rwo-loge/w, (l:e/gw)
tell of heroes, Str.11.6.3.

h(rwo-logi/a, h(,
tale of heroes, title of work by Anaximander, Ath.11.498b.

h(rw=|on, Ion. h(rwo-w/i+on, to/, (sc. i(ero/n or e(/dos)
shrine of a hero, Hdt. 5.47, 67, Th.2.17, etc.; qh)rw=|on, i.e. to\ h(rw=|on, Ar.V.819.
tomb, IG12(7).478 (Amorgos), IGRom.4.799 (Apamea, iii A.D.), etc.:—in form h(rw/eion, CIG4418 (Cilicia), etc. (sc. me/tron)
hexameter, Plu.Num.4, etc. h(rw=|a (sc. i(era/), ta/,
festival of a hero, deipnei=n Id.2.811d, cf. IG22.974.

h(rw=|os, a, on, contr. for h(rw/i+os (q.v.); o( h(. (sc. r(uqmo/s)
the heroic measure, hexameter, Pl.R.400b, cf. Arist.Rh.1408b32; h(. [me/tron] Id.Po.1460a3; pou\s h(.
dactyl, AP7.9 (Damag.), etc.
h(rw/ptei: skw/ptei, Hsch.; cf. h)ro/ptw: skw/ptw (v.l. ko/ptw), EM 437.27.

h(/rws, o( (also h( in signf. 111), gen. h(/rwos （h(/rws codd. in Od.6.303, fort. leg. h(/rw^os), IG22.1641.6 (iv B.C.), etc.; also h(/rw D.19.249, IG2.1191 (iii B.C.), Paus.10.4.10: dat. h(/rwi+, mostly in form h(/rw| Il.7.453, Od.8.483, Pl.Com.174.18, Orac. ap. D.43.66: acc. h(/rwa Pl.Lg.738d, IG3.810 (h(/rw^a Epigr.Gr.774 (Priene)); usu. in form h(/rw IG2.1058.25 (iv B.C.), Pl.R.391d, A.R.2.766, etc., also h(/rwn Hdt.1.167:—Plur., nom. h(/rwes （w^ Pi.P.4.58), rarely contr. h(/rws, as in Ar.Fr.304: dat. h(/rwsin A.Fr.55, Ar.Av.1485; h(rw/nessi Sophr.154: acc. h(/rwas （w^ Pi.P.1.53), rarely h(/rws, as in A.Ag.516, Luc.Dem.Enc.4:—
hero, h(/rwes *danaoi/, *)axaioi/, Il.2.110,19.34; sti/xas a)ndrw=n h(rw/wn Od.1.101; h(rw/wn a)gora/s, of the Phaeacians, 7.44; h(/rw| *dhmodo/kw| 8.483; oi( h(gemo/nes tw=n a)rxai/wn mo/noi h)=san h(/rwes, oi( de\ laoi\ a)/nqrwpoi Arist.Pr. 932b18, but cf. Il. cc.
the Fourth Age of men, between dai/mones and a)/nqrwpoi, Hes.Op.172, cf. Pl.Cra.398c.
heroes, as objects of worship, h(/. a)nti/qeoi Pi.P.1.53,4.58; h(/. qeo/s, of Heracles, Id.N.3.22; but [*(hrakle/i+] tw=| me\n w(s *)olumpi/w| qu/ousi, tw=| de\ e(te/rw| w(s h(/rwi e)nagi/zousi Hdt.2.44; *si/sufos h(/. Thgn.711; twice in A., Ag.516, Fr.55; once in E., Fr.446(lyr.); ou)/te qeou\s ou)/q' h(/rwas ai)sxunqei=sa Antipho 1.27; esp. of
local deities, founders of cities, patrons of tribes, etc., Hdt.1.168, Th.4.87, Pl.Lg.l.c., Arist.Pol.1332b18, etc.; at Athens, h(/. e)pw/numoi
heroes after whom the fulai/ were named, Paus.1.5.1,2, cf. Hdt.5.66; of historical persons to whom divine honours were paid, as Brasidas at Amphipolis, Th.5.11, cf. Hdt.5.114,7.117: hence,= Lat.
divus, h(/rwa a)pedei/cate [to\n *au)/gouston] D.C.56.41; also,= Lares, D.H.4.14; o( kat' oi)ki/an h(/.,=
Lar familiaris, ib.2. later,= makari/ths,
deceased, Alciphr.3.37, Hld.7.13: pl., PMag.Par.1.1390: freq. in Inscrr., h(/rws xrhste/, xai=re IG9(2).806, cf. 14.223, etc.; even of women, ib.9(2).961 (Larissa), al.; qeoi=s h(/rwsi,=
Dis Manibus, ib.14.1795 (Rome), etc.; u(bri/santas tou\s h(/rwas tw=n te/knwn h(mw=n SIG1243.23 (Acraeph.). h(/. poiki/los, = stigmati/as, Hsch., Phot. bou=s h(/., = h(gemw/n, IG22.1126.32. v. *(/hrwn.

h(rw=|ssa, v. h(rw/i+ssa. h(rwsth/s, = h(rwi+sth/s, Keil-Premerstein
Dritter Bericht117（Tire).

h(rwfo/ros, on,
bearing heroes, EM230.40.

h)=s, Dor. and Aeol. 3sg. impf. of ei)mi/ (
sum). h(=s, gen. sg. fem. of o(/s. Dor. for ei(=s,
one.

h)=|sa, aor. 1 of a)/|dw; but, h(=sa, aor. 1 of h(/dw. h)=|san, Att. for h)/|desan, 3pl. plpf. (used as impf.) of oi)=da. Att. for h)/i+san, 3pl. impf. of ei)=mi (
ibo). h(/sato, v. h(/domai.
h(/sqhma, atos, to/, （h(/domai） = h(donh/, Eup.131.

h(si^eph/s, (i(/hmi)
throwing words, i.e.
babbler, EM669.7.
*(hsi/odos, o(, Hesiod, Pi.I.6(5).67, etc.; Aeol. *ai)s-EM452.37:— Adj. *(hsio/deios, a, on, Pl.Lg.658d, Plu.2.657d.

h(=sis, ews, h(, （h(/domai） = te/ryis, Suid.; but hsei,= h)=san (3pl. impf. of ei)mi/), PLond.3.1170v387, al. (iii A.D.); hsin,= h)=san, Bell
Jewsand Christians in Egypt 1914.16 (iv A.D.); also hsei, perh. = h)=|san (3pl. impf. of ei)=mi), Sammelb.7194r14 (ii A.D.).
h)/sixer: dayilh/s, Hsch.; cf. a)sixh/r.

h)skhme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (a)ske/w)
in a practised manner, Poll.1.157.
h)=smen, Att. for h)/|deimen, v. *ei)/dw. h(=so, v. h(=mai.

h(=ssa, Att. h(=tta, hs, h(,
defeat, discomfiture, Th.5.12,7.72, Pl.Lg. 638b; pole/mou in war, Id.La.196a; h(=tta . . pole/mou kai\ dikw=n kai\ a)gorw=n Aeschin.3.111, cf. Plu.2.840c; mh\ di' h(=ttan, a)lla\ dia\ proai/resin Arist.EN1150a24; h(=ttan prosi/esqai to let oneself be
conquered, X.Cyr.3.3.45: c. gen. rei,
yielding or
giving way to a thing, h(donw=n, e)piqumiw=n, Pl.Lg.869e (pl.); h( e)n toi=s toiou/tois h(=. kalh/ D.Ep.3.45; h( u(po\ tw=n liparou/ntwn h(=. Plu.Brut.6.

h(ss-a/omai, Att. h(tt-, S.Fr.936, Th.3.57: fut. h(sshqh/somai E.Hipp. 727, 976, h(tt- Lys.20.32, X.Cyr.3.3.42: fut. Med. h(tth/somai in pass. sense, Lys.28.9, X.An.2.3.23: aor. h(ssh/qhn E.Andr.917, etc.: pf. h(/sshmai S.Aj.1242, E.Alc.697: plpf. h(/tthto D.19.160: Ion. e(sso/omai, part. e(ssou/menos Hdt.1.82: impf. e(ssou=to (without augm.) Id.7.166, 8.75: aor. e(ssw/qhn Id.2.169, etc.: pf. e(/sswmai Id.8.130 (and v.l. in 7.9.b/), Herod.8.19: (h(/sswn):—
to be less or
weaker than, inferior to, c. gen. pers., E.Alc.697: c. gen. pers. et part., h(tta=sqai/ tinos eu)= poiou=ntos X.An.3.2.23, cf. Cyr.5.4.32; h(tta=sqai/ tino/s tini ib.8.2.13; e)/n tini in a thing, ib.3.3.42, etc.: c. gen. rei, to\ mh\ di/kaion th=s di/khs -w/menon E.Ion 1117: c. neut. Adj. in acc., o(\ h(ttw=|to wherein he
had proved inferior, X.Cyr.1.4.5. as a real Pass.,
to be defeated, discomfited, u(po/ tinos Hdt.3.106, And.4.28, Th.2.39; u(p' e)/rwtos, u(p' e)/xqras, Pl.Phdr.233c, Plt.305c, etc.; pro\s ta)frodi/sia Id.Lg.650a: c. gen. pers., E.Hec.1252, Ar.Av.70, Th.3.57, etc.: c. gen. rei, tou= ko/pou ga\r e(/sswmai Herod. l.c.: c. dat. modi, e(sswqh=nai ma/xh| u(po/ tinwn Hdt.5.46, etc.; toi=s o(/lois D.9.64, etc.; also c. acc., ma/xhn Isoc.5.47, D.19.320; a)gw=na D.C.63.9: c. dat., tw=| qumw=|
to be broken in spirit, Hdt.8.130; e(sswqe/ntes th=| gnw/mh| pro\s *ku/rou Id.9.122; h(. peri/ ti Pl.Sph.239b: abs., oi( h(ssw/menoi, opp. oi( kratou=ntes, A.Th. 516, cf. Hdt.7.9.b/ ; th\n gnw/mhn au)tw=n ou)x h(ssh=sqai Th.6.72. as law-term,
to be cast in a suit, S.Aj.1242, Ar.Pl.482, etc.; h(tt. e)n toi=s dikasthri/ois X.Mem.4.417; di/khn, paragrafh/n, Pl.Lg.880c, D.45.51.
give way, yield, c. gen. pers., oi( fu/santes h(ssw=ntai te/knwn S.Fr.936; ei) paqw/n ge sou= ta/d' h(sshqh/somai E.Hipp.976;
give way, be a slave to passion and the like , nhdu/os h(sshme/nos Id.Fr.282.5; tou= paro/ntos deinou= Th.4.37; tw=n fo/bwn Pl.Lg.635d; h(donh=s X.Ages.5.1; u(/pnou Id.Cyr.1.5.11; [xrhma/twn] Lys.28.9; th=s tou/twn paraskeuh=s ib. 11; qnhtou= ka/llous Isoc.10.60; pikrou= e)/rwtos E.Hipp.727: c. gen. pers.,
to be in love with . . , Plu.2.771f; of other things, h(tt. tou= u(/datos X.HG5.2.5; tou= dikai/ou ib.5.4.31; th=s a)lhqei/as D.18.273; to\ di/kaion h(tt. tou= fqo/nou D.25.75. c. dat.,
to be overcome by . . , a)koh=s h(donh=| h(ssw/menoi Th.3.38, cf. 7.25; u(/pnw| Ael.NA13.22; toi=s dikai/ois Plu. Cat.Mi.16. later in Act. h(tta/w,
overcome, tina Corn.ND9, Arr.Epict.2.22.6, al.: aor. 1 h(/tthsa, ta\s yuxa\s tw=n u(penanti/wn Plb.1.75.3; tai=s yuxai=s tou\s u(penanti/ous Id.3.18.5, cf. Heraclit.Incred.16;
defeat, tou\s *lakedaimoni/ous a)po\ kra/tous h(tthko/tes D.S.15.87.

h(ss-hte/os, a, on, neut. pl. h(sshte/a
one must be beaten, gunaiko/s
by a woman, S. Ant.678, cf. Ar.Lys.450.
h(sso/nws, Adv. of sq., J.AJ17.5.5, 18.2.4, 19.1.15, prob. in Hp. Art.69.

h(/sswn, h(=sson, gen. onos; Att. h(/ttwn, Ion. h(/sswn (not e(/sswn) Hdt. (v. infr.), Democr.50, Hp.VC2: formed from h)=ka (prop. h)ss-, cf. h)/kistos), but in sense Comp. of kako/s, mikro/s: c. gen. pers.,
inferior; esp. in force,
weaker, ai)/q' o(/son h(/. ei)mi\ to/son se/o fe/rteros ei)/hn Il.16.722; of horses, 23.322, al.; r(w/mh| h(/ssones tw=n *perse/wn Hdt.8 113, cf. 9.62; gunaikw=n h(/ssones S.Ant.680; *ku/pridos E.Andr.631; e)/s ti in a thing, Hdt.3.102: c. inf. modi, h(/ss. tino\s qe/ein
not so good at running, ib.105; ou)deno\s h(/ss. gnw=nai
second to none in judging, Th.2.60; i(ppeu/ein h(/tt. tw=n h(li/kwn
inferior to them in riding, X.Cyr. 1.3.15. abs., oi( h(/ss.
the weaker party, A.Supp.203, 489; ou)x h(/ssous gene/sqai to have the best of it, Th.4.72; to\ lamba/nein ta\ tw=n h(tt. X.An.5.6.32: c. dat. modi, h(/ssones naumaxi/h| Hdt.5.86: c. acc. modi, to\n nou=n h(/ss. S.El.1023, cf. X.Cyr.1.4.4; of things, to\n h(/ttw lo/gon krei/ttw poiei=n 'to make
the worse appear the better cause', Pl.Ap.18b, cf. Ar.Nu.114: pl., oi( h(/ttous lo/goi ib.1042, Isoc.15.15; to\ h(=ss. a)diki/a ne/meis E.Supp.379 (lyr.).
less, fewer, i(/na plei/w me\n a)kou/wmen, h(/ttona de\ le/gwmen Zeno Stoic.1.68. c. gen. rei,
giving way or
yielding to a thing,
a slave to . . , tou= th=sd' e)/rwtos ei)s a(/panq' h(/ss. S.Tr.489; tw=n ai)sxrw=n Id.Ant.747; o)rgh=s Id.Fr.929; ga/mwn E.IA1354; ke/rdous Ar.Pl.363; h(donw=n Pl.Prt.353c; gastro\s h)\ oi)/nou h)\ a)frodisi/wn h)\ po/nou h)\ u(/pnou X.Mem.1.5.1; xrhma/twn Democr. l.c., Theopomp.Hist.121: generally,
unable to resist, tou= peprwme/nou E.Hel.1660; no/swn kai\ gh/rws Lys.2.78; oi( h(/ttous tw=n po/nwn [i(/ppoi] X.Eq.Mag.1.3, 2.78. neut. h(=sson, h(=tton, as Adv.,
less, o)li/gon de/ ti/ m' h(=ss. e)ti/ma Od.15.365, cf. E.Hipp.264 (anap.); h(=sso/n ti Th. 3.75; h(=ss. e(te/rwn Id.1.84; o(moi/ws te trwqei\s kai\ h(=ss. Hp.l.c.: mostly with Verbs, but also with Adjs., a)ristokrati/ai . . ai( me\n h(=tt., ai( de\ ma=llon mo/nimoi Arist.Pol.1307a14, cf. Mete.340b8: with a Comp., h(=tt. a)kribe/steron Id.Pr.957b8; h(=tt. eu)lhptote/ran D.H.3.43 codd.: with neg., ou)x h(=ss., ou)d' h(=ss., not a whit
less, just as much, A.Ch.181, 708, Th.1.8; ou)de\n h(=ss., mhde\n h(=ss., S.Aj.276, 1329; for to\ ma=llon kai\ h(=tt., v. ma/la.

h(st-iko/s, h/, o/n, (h(/domai)
pleasing, agreeable, pa/qos S.E.M.6.33. Adv. -kw=s, opp. a)lgeinw=s, ib.10.225.

h(st-o/s, h/, o/n, = foreg., Simp.
in de An.266.25, al., Hsch., Suid.

h(su^x-a/zw, fut. -a/sw Th.2.84, AP5.132 (Maec.), -a/somai Luc. Gall.1: aor. h(su/xa^sa Th.1.12: (h(/suxos):—
keep quiet, be at rest, su\ d' h(su/xaze A.Pr.329, cf. 346; h( a)pori/a tou= mh\ h(suxa/zein the difficulty of
finding rest, Th.2.49; oi( pole/mioi h(su/xazon X.An.5.4.16; a)na/gkh to\ h(suxa/zon e(sta/nai Pl.Prm.162e; tou\s [no/mous] ou)k e)w=n h(suxa/zein e)n timwri/ais Luc.Abd.19; h(. pro\s mi/an qu/rhn, of a lover, AP5.166（Asclep.); o( dialektiko\s h(suxa/sei S.E.P.2.239: freq. in part., h(suxa/zwn prosmenw= S.OT620, cf. E.Or.134; w(/ste mh\ h(suxa/sasa au)chqh=nai
by resting from war, Th.1.12; h(suxazousw=n tw=n new=n ib.49; mo/lis h(suxa/santes Id.8.86; h(suxa/zousan e)/xwn th\n dia/noian Isoc.5.24; to\ h(suxa/zon th=s nukto/s
the dead of night, Th.7.83; h(. a)po/ tinos
keep away from . . , AP5.132 (Maec.): c. dat.,
suspend work on, PFay.117.23 (ii A.D.); a)ll' h(su/xaze only
be tranquil, calm thyself, E.HF98, IA 973. o( -a/zwn, with or without lo/gos, a fallacy, Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.8 (pl.), Gell.1.2.4 (pl.). trans.,
bring to rest, h(suxa/sas tw\ du/o ei)/dh, to\ tri/ton de\ kinh/sas Pl.R.572a. abs.,
impose silence, D.C.69.6.
leave unspoken, a(\ xrh\ le/gein Ph.1.254, cf. 2.268; ta\s a)peila/s J.AJ7.7.3. Pass. in impers. sense, h(suxa/zetai e)pi\ th=s gh=s
there is quiet, LXXJb.37.17.
h(su^x-ai/teros, h(su^/x-tatos, irreg. Comp. and Sup. of h(/suxos (q.v.).

h(su^x-aste/on,
one must keep quiet, Ph.1.2. h(suxaste/os, a, on,
to be kept secret, unsaid, Id.2.5.

h(su^x-asth/s, ou=, o(,
hermit, Just. Nov.5.3.

h(su^x-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
soothing, tro/pos, of music, Aristid. Quint.1.19; h)=qos melopoii/as Cleonid.Harm.13.

h(su^x-a/stria, h(,
she who soothes, gloss on eu)khlh/teira, Hsch., Suid., cf.EM59.35.
h(su^x-a/w, Ep. part. h(suxo/wsa, gloss on galhnio/wsa, Sch. Opp.C.1.115.

h(su^x-h=| (with i PHib.1.73.6 (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen. (v. infr.)), Dor. h(su^x-a=, Adv.
stilly, quietly, softly, gently, Pi.P.11.55, etc.; h(. katakei=sqai Ar.Pl.692; mete/rxesqai/ tina E.Hipp.444; e)/x' h(. keep
quiet! Pl.Hp.Ma.298c; h(. e)/xein th\n ou)ra/n to keep it
still, X. Cyn.3.4; h(. gela/sai Pl.Phd.115c; kosmi/ws pa/nta pra/ttein kai\ h(. Id.Chrm.159b, etc.; h(. a)namimnh/skesqai to recollect
quietly, at one's ease, Aeschin.2.35; eu)sebei=n E.Fr. 286.9.
by stealth, secretly, Plu.Alc.24, Th.8.69, Plot.2.9.18.
to some extent, Men.Her.20;
slightly, fu/llon perikexaragme/non h(. Thphr.HP3.14.1; bhxi/on h(. chro/n Hp.Epid.4.27; o)cu/s Theoc. 14.10 (prob. l.); u(po/simos PCair.Zen.76.11 (iii B.C.); makropro/swpos PStrassb.87.11 (ii B.C.); e)nereuqe/s Dsc.3.131; tou= au)xe/nos ei)s eu)w/numon h(. keklime/nou Plu.Alex.4; grupo/s Ael.NA3.28.

h(su^x-i/a, Ion. -ih, Dor. a(s-(?), h(,
rest, quiet, Od.18.22, etc.; personified in Pi.P.8.1, Ar. Av.1321 (lyr.); a(. filei= sumpo/sion Pi.N.9.48: c. gen. obj., h(. th=s poliorki/hs
rest from . . , Hdt.6.135; th=s h(donh=s Pl.R.583e; tou= lupei=sqai ibid; peri/ ti ib.c; h( a)po\ th=s ei)rh/nhs h(. D.5.25: in pl., ai( h(. sh/pousi Pl. Tht.153c.
silence, stillness, E.Alc.77 (anap.); esp. of the Pythagoreans, Luc.Vit.Auct.3. with Preps., di' h(suxi/hs ei)=nai keep
quiet, Hdt.1.206; e)n th=| h(suxi/a, opp. e)n tw=| pole/mw|, Th.3.12; e)n h(. e)/xein ti to keep it
quiet, not speak of it, Hdt.5.92.g/ ; e)n h(. e)/xein sfe/as au)tou/s ib.93; e)n h(. diatribein Hdn.2.5.2; e)f' h(suxi/as Ar.V.1517; me/nein e)pi\ h(suxi/a Hdn.1.13.2; kat' h(suxi/hn pollh/n quite at one's
ease, Hdt.1.9, cf. 7.208, D.8.12; kaq' h(suxi/an at
leisure, Ar.Lys.1224, Th. 3.48, etc.; opp. dia\ spoudh=s, X.HG6.2.28; meta\ . . h(suxi/as
quietly, E. Hipp.205 (anap.). with Verbs, h(suxi/an a)/gein keep
quiet, be
at peace or
at rest, Hdt.1.66, Pl.Ap.38a, Isoc.6.2, D.4.1, etc.; peri\ me\n tw=n a)/llwn h(. h)=gon, u(pe\r de/ . . Isoc.10.49; kinh/sewn
from movements, Pl.Ti.89e; keep
silent, Hdt.5.92, E.Andr.143 (lyr.), Ar. Ra.321: pl., ta\s h(. a)/gein or e)/xein, Ath.3.114a, 11.493f. h(suxi/an e)/xein, = h(. a)/gein, but generally implying less continuance, Hdt.2.45, 7.150, X.Cyr.1.4.18, HG3.2.27; h(. e)/xein pro/s tina Lys.28.7; keep
silent, ta\ deina\ h(. e(kte/on
about them, D.58.60.
solitude, a sequestered place, h.Merc.356, X.Mem.2.1.21.
*(hsu^xi/des, ai(, priestesses of the Eumenides, Call.Fr.123.

h(su^x-iko/s, h/, o/n,
peaceable, in Sup., prob. in Plot.3.8.6.
h(su^/x-imos, Dor. a(s- (v.l. h(s-), on, = h(/suxos, a(me/ra Pi.O.2.32.

h(su^/x-ios, Dor. a(s- (v.l. h(s-), on,= h(/suxos,
still, quiet, at rest, h(su/xion d' a)/ra min pole/mou e)/kpempe Il.21.598; ei)rh/na Pi.P.9.22; also in Prose, tro/pon h(. of a
quiet disposition, Hdt.1.107; ou)d' h(. o( sw/frwn bi/os Pl.Chrm.160b; ai( h(. pra/ceis ib. c; to\ h(. h)=qos Id.R.604e; oi( h(. Antipho 3.2.1; to\ h(. th=s ei)rh/nhs (v.l. h(/suxon) Th.1.120: Comp. -w/teros
more reposeful, Phld.Rh. 2.60S. Adv. -i/ws h.Merc.438, Pl.Tht.179e.

h(su^x-io/ths, htos, h(,= h(suxi/a, Id.Chrm.159b, 159d; h(. tino/s his
quiet disposition, Lys.26.5.

h(su^x-o/omai, Pass.,
keep quiet, be at rest, Aq.Am.6.10.

h(su^x-opoio/s,
silentiarius, Gloss.

h(/su^x-os, Dor. a(/s- (v. fin.), on,
quiet, h(/. a)nstre/fetai Hes.Th. 763; h(/suxoi e)/rg' e)ne/monto Id.Op.119; h(/ . . . o(do\n e)/rxeo go thy way
in peace, Thgn.331; h(/. kaqeu/dein Anacr.88; h(/. qakei=n, qa/ssein, S.Aj. 325, E.Hec.35; h(/suxoi e)/ste Hdt.7.13, cf. 1.88; e)/x' h(/suxos keep
quiet, keep
still, Id.8.65, E.Med.550; me/n' h(/. Ar.Av.1199, Th.925; gi/gnesqe E.Cyc.94, cf. Ba.1362; kateqea=to X.Cyr.5.3.55; h(su/xw| podi\ xwrei=n E.Or.[136]; h(su/xw| frenw=n ba/sei, i. e. in thought, A.Ch.452; e)n h(su/xw|
quietly, S.OC82; h(/. dori/
inactive with it, E.Fr.998; to\ h(/. th=s ei)rh/nhs, v.l. for h(su/xion, Th.1.120; nou=s h(/. tw=n pra/cewn
at rest from . . , free from . . , Plot.6.8.5.
quiet, gentle, of character, in Comp. -aite/ra, A.Eu.223, cf. E.Supp.952, etc.; oi( d' a)f' h(su/xou podo\s du/skleian e)kth/santo Id.Med.217; o)/mmatos par' h(. A.Supp.199; glw=ssa -wte/ra S.Ant.1089; o)rgh=| u(po/qes h(/suxon po/da
moderate thy wrath, E. Ba.647; to\ cu/nhqes h(/. their accustomed
quietness, Th.6.34; h(suxai/tera
less severe, Id.3.82.
cautious, pro/noia E.Or.1407 (lyr.); of persons, Id.Supp.509. of the voice,
gentle, fwnh\ -aite/ra X. Cyr.1.4.4.
implicit, Plot.6.2.20. Comp. and Sup. -ai/teros,
-ai/tatos, A.Eu.l.c., Th.3.82, Pl.Phlb.24c, X.Cyr.1.4.4, 6.2.12; -w/teros, -w/tatos, S.Ant.1089, Pl.Chrm.160a (nisileg. -iw/tatos）; -e/statos Sch.Lyc.3. Adv. -xws A.Supp.724; ka/rt' a)\n ei)=xon h(. E.Supp. 305; h(. nai/ein Id.Heracl.7;
gently, cautiously, Id.Or.698;
slowly, poreu/esqai X.Cyr.5.3.53, etc.: Ion. Comp. h(suxe/steron Hp.Salubr.3,5: Sup., w(s h(suxai/tata Pl.Chrm.160a: neut. h(/suxon, Dor. a(/suxon, as Adv., v.l. in Theoc.14.27: pl., a(/suxa Id.2.11,100, 6.12, Hymn.Is.103. (Dor. a(s- is dub., h(/suxos, h(suxh=, h(suxi/a codd. Pi., h(su/x-imos, -ios, as v.l.)
h)sxumme/nos, v. ai)sxu/nw.

h)ta, to/,
the letter h, Hp.VC1, Pl.Cra.418c, Epigr.Gr.1095, AP9.385 (Steph.Gramm., v.l. h)=): h(=ta, Sch.D.T.p.486 H. (Hebr.
hêth.）

h)/te or h)/ te,
or also, Il.19.148; later simply,
or, Ascl.Tact.2.7. h)/ te . . h)/ te
both . . and, Il.9.276;
either . . or, ib.11.410, 17.42.
than, Od.16.216.

h)= te,
surely, doubtless; v. h)= 1.1. h)=te, h)/|thn, Att. 2pl. and 3dual of ei)=mi (
ibo).
h)/toi: = h)=toi, Il.18.446, Pi.O.2.3, etc. = h)/ toi, v. h)/ (A).

h)=tor, to/, Ep. and Lyr. word, always in nom. or acc.; exc. dat. h)/tori Simon.37.6 codd. Ath.:—
heart. e)n e)moi\ au)th=| sth/qesi pa/lletai h)=. a)na\ sto/ma
my heart beats up to my throat, Il.22.452;
the seat of life, life, fi/lon h)=. o)le/ssai 5.250, etc.; lu/to gou/nata kai\ fi/lon h)=. 21.114, etc.; a)ne/yuxon fi/lon h)=. 13.84; ta\s d' e)ssume/nws li/pen h)=. Q.S.1.257 (v.l.): most freq., as
the seat of feeling, passion, desire, etc., e)ge/lasse de/ oi( fi/lon h(=. Il.21.389; kateplh/gh fi/lon h)=. 3.31; a)/xei+ bebolhme/nos h)=. 9.9; minu/qei de/ moi e)/ndoqen h)=. Od.4.467; e)n de/ oi( h)=. xai/rei A.R.4.169; boa=| <moi> mele/wn e)/ntosqen h)=. A.Pers.991 (lyr.); poth=tos a)/sasqai fi/lon h)=. Il. 19.307; poqe/ousa fi/lon katath/komai h)=. Od.19.136; ei) d' a)/eqla garu/en e)/ldeai, fi/lon h)=. Pi.O.1.4; *ku/klwpas u(pe/rbion h)=. e)/xontas Hes.Th.139; h)=. a)/lkimon Pi.N.8.24 (so e)n de/ te/ oi( kradi/h| ste/nei a)/lkimon h)=. Il.20.169);
of the reasoning powers, e)n de/ oi( h)=. sth/qessin . . dia/ndixa mermh/ricen Il. 1.188, cf. 15.252; *zhno\s h)=. litai=s e)/peise Pi.O.2.79. (Cf. OHG.
ādara, OE.
æ[combacute]dre 'vein', pl. 'kidneys'.)

h)triai=os, a, on, (h)=tron)
of the stomach, tema/xh Com.Adesp.863; to\ h).
stomach, paunch, Ar.Fr.318.6:—also h)triai/a, h(, ib.506.5, Luc. Lex.6, Ath.1.4c.

h)/trion, Dor. a)/trion, to/,
warp (the woof being kro/kh), Pl.Phdr. 268a, Theoc.18.33, AP6.288 (Leon., pl.): in pl.,
a thin, fine cloth, such that one could see between the threads, h)/tria pe/plwn E.Ion 1421; h)/tria bu/blwn
leaves made of strips of papyrus, prob. cj. in AP 9.350 (Leon. Alex.); to\ dia\ h)tri/ou h)qhme/non Gal.19.98.

h)=tron, to/,
abdomen, esp. the
lower part of it, Hp.Aph.2.35, Pl.Phd. 118a, X.An.4.7.15, D.54.11, Arist.HA493a19, Sor.1.24: metaph.,
belly of a pot, Ar.Th.509.
pith of a reed, Nic.Th.595.
h(=tta, h(tta/omai, h(tta/w, h(/ttwn, Att. for h(ss-.
h(/ttwn, v. h(/sswn.

h)/tw, late form for e)/stw, 3sg. imper. of ei)mi/ (
sum), IG3.3509, BGU 419.13 (iii A.D.), etc.
h)u/+,= h)u/+te, Anon.in Rh.178.4 (s.v.l., cf. Uhlig ad D.T.642.7).
h)u^-ge/neios, h)u^-genh/s, h)u^/-dendros, h)u^-ka/rhnos, h)u^/-komos, h)u^/-purgos, etc., Ep. and Lyr. for eu)-.
hu)chme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (au)ca/nw) gloss on zafelw=s, Eust. 769.23.

h)u/+s, neut. h)u/+, Ep. for e)u/+s (q.v.),
good, brave: only masc. nom. and acc. h)u/+s, h)u/+n, neut. nom. and acc. h)u/+ (neut. pl. h)e/a prob. in Emp. 128.10); h). te me/gas te Il.2.653, etc.; h). qera/pwn 16.464, 653; me/nos h)u/+ 17.456, etc.

h)u/+te, Ep. Particle,
as, like as, h). kou/rh Il.2.872, etc.; h). nebro/s B. 12.87; freq. in similes, Il.1.359, 2.87, etc.: after a Comp., tw=| de/ t' a)/neuqen e)o/nti mela/nteron h). pi/ssa fai/netai [the cloud] appears to him while afar off very black,
even as pitch, 4.277, v. Sch.; e)/xeto klai/ous' a)dinw/teron, h)u/+te kou/rh with sobs coming quicker and quicker,
like a girl, A.R.1.269; but it may =
than in these passages; cf. eu)=te. （h)/ + I.-E.
ute (cf. Skt.
uta) 'also', 'even'.)

hu)toma^tisme/nws, Adv. pf. part. Pass., (au)tomati/zw)
arbitrarily, Procl. in Prm.p.650 S.

*(hfaistei=on (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.375), to/ (sc. i(ero/n),
temple of Hephaestus, Hdt.2.110,al., D.33.18; at Rome, = Lat. Volcanal, D.H.7.17; at Perusia, App.BC5.49:—also *(hfaistiei=on,
temple of Ptah at Memphis, UPZ109.13 (i B.C.).

*(hfai/stia, ta/,
festival of Hephaestus, IG22.1158 (v/iv B.C.), And. 1.132, X.Ath.3.4; = Lat. Volcanalia, D.C.78.25.

*(hfaistia/s, a/dos, h(, name of a
plaster, Gal.12.234.
*(hfai/stios, o( (sc. mh/n), a month (perh. at Lesbos), CIG6850.
*(hfaistiw/n, w=nos, o( (sc. mh/n), a month in Magnesia (Thess.), dub. in IG9(2).1118.
*(hfaisti=tis (sc. li/qos), h(, a precious stone, Plin.HN37.166.
*(hfaisto/-dapta: puri/kauta, Hsch.

*(hfaisto/-ponos, on,
wrought by Hephaestus, o(/pla E.IA1072 (lyr.).

*(/hfaistos (Aeol.and Dor. *)/af-( *(/af-) Sapph.66, Pi.O.7.35, etc.), o(, Hephaestus, Il.18.391, etc.; e)/rgon *(hfai/stoio, of a bowl, Od.4.617; knhmi=das o)reixa/lkoio . . *(hfai/stou kluta\ dw=ra Hes.Sc.123; flogi\ *(hfai/stoio Il.17.88, cf. Antim.44; ma\ to\n *(/h. Com.Adesp.17.35D. = Lat. Volcanus, D.H.2.54, Plu.2.276b, App.BC5.49, etc. = Egypt. Plah, OGI90.2 (Rosetta, ii B.C.). Pythag. name for
nine, Theol.Ar.58. meton. for pu=r,
fire, Il.2.426, Hom.Fr.18, S.Ant.123 (lyr.), 1007, cf. Chrysipp.Stoic.2.315, al., D.S.5.74, etc.

*(hfaisto/-teuktos, on,
wrought by Hephaestus, se/las S.Ph.987, cf. Simon.202A, D.L.1.32:—also *(hfaisto-teuxh/s, e/s, de/pas A.Fr.69 (lyr., leg. *(hfaistotu^ke/s).
*(hfaisto/-xeiros, sine expl., Choerob.Orth. inAB1380.
h(=fi, Ep. for h(=|, Il.22.107.
h)xa/nw, = ptwxeu/w, Suid. (i.e. i)xa/nw): h)/xanen: ei)=pen, Hsch.
h)xe/eis, essa, en, poet. for h)xh/eis, restored for h)xh/enta in Archil. 74.8, cf. Hdn.Gr.2.925.

h)xei=on, to/, (h)=xos)
drum, gong, Plu.Crass.23, Apollod. ap. Sch. Theoc.2.36, Procop.Gaz.Ecphr.p.153B.;
tambourine, as head-dress, Herm.Trism.in Rev.Phil.32.254; used for stage-thunder, Sch.Ar. Nu.292; as sounding-boards in the theatre, Vitr.5.5.2. in the lyre, = xa/lkwma, apptly.
a metallic sounding-plate, Hsch.; so of the palate, Gal.UP7.5. Adj. h)xei=on o)/rganon
sounding instrument, Ph.1.588, cj.ib.444,510.

h)xe/ths, ou, o(, Ep. h)xe/ta^, Dor. a)xe/tas, a)xe/ta^, (h)xe/w)
clear-sounding, musical, shrill, do/nac a)xe/tas A.Pr.575 (lyr.); ku/knos E.El.151 (lyr.); epith. of the cicada,
chirping, h)xe/ta te/ttic Hes.Op.582, AP 7.201 (Pamphil.); a)xe/tat. ib.213 (Arch.): abs., a)xe/tas, o(,
the chirper, i.e.
the male cicada, Anan.5.6, Ar.Pax1159 (lyr.), Av.1095 (lyr.), cf. Arist.HA532b16,556a20: Orph.A.1250 has Ep.acc. h)xe/ta porqmo/n the
sounding strait.

h)x-e/w, Aeol.and Dor. a)xe/w [a_]: intr.,
sound, ring, peal, h)xei= de\ ka/rh . . *)olu/mpou Hes.Th.42; o(/tan a)xh/sh| polio\s buqo/s Mosch.Fr.1.4; a)xou=si prospo/lwn xe/res E.Supp.72 (lyr.); of metal, h)xe/eske o( xalko\s th=s a)spi/dos Hdt.4.200; ta\ xalki/a plhge/nta makro\n h)xei= Pl.Prt.329a, cf. Men.66.4; of the grasshopper,
chirp, Alc.39, Theoc.16.96; of the ears,
tingle, h)xh/sei ta\ w)=ta LXX 1 Ki.3.11; dia\ ti/ h)xei= h)\ dia\ ti/ e)mfai/netai; impers., of
anecho, Arist.AP0.98a27.
suffer from noises in the ears, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.10.40.3. c. acc. cogn., a)xei=n （i)axei=n codd.) u(/mnon
to let it
sound, A.Th.869 (lyr.); kwkuto/n S.Tr.866; go/ous Id.Fr.523; u(/mnous E.Ion883 (lyr.); xalke/on a)/xei
sound the cymbal! Theoc.2.36; e)fech=s h)xou=nta au)ta/ (sc. ta\ fwnh/enta) Demetr.Eloc.71: —Med., a)xei=sqai/ tina
to sound his praises, dub. in Pi.Fr.75.19:— Pass., h)xei=tai ktu/pos a sound
is made, S.OC1500. (Cf. sq.)

h)x-h/, Dor. a)xa/, h(,
sound, noise, h). a)mfote/rwn (sc. *)argei/wn kai\ *trw/wn） i(/ket' ai)qe/ra Il.13.837: freq. in dat., h)xh=|, w(s o(/te ku=ma . . bre/metai 2.209; of trees, pro\s a)llh/las e)/balon tanuh/keas o)/zous h)xh=| qespesi/h| 16.769; pe/trh . . h(\ de/ te h)xh=| e)/rxetai e)mmemaui=a Hes.Sc.438; in Trag.,
cry of sorrow,
wail, E.Med.149 (lyr.), Hipp.585 (lyr.), cf. Nic.Al.304; but also sa/lpiggos h). E.Ph.1378; e)n e)moi\ h( h). tw=n lo/gwn bombei= Pl.Cri.54d, cf. Ti. 37b; of the grasshopper, Longus 1.23: rarely of articulate sounds, E.Ph.1148, Opp.C.1.23;
rumour, talk, Plu.Cat.Ma.22. (Perh. fr.
swāĝh-, cf. i)axe/w, OE.
swógan 'resound', Engl.
sough.）

h)x-h/eis, Dor. a)x-, essa, en,
sounding, ringing, roaring, qa/lassa Il.1.157; dw/mata h)xh/enta
high, echoing rooms or halls, Od.4.72; do/moi h)xh/entes Hes. Th.767; xalko/s A.R.1.1236; i)a/ prob. l. in A.Th.915 (lyr.); qro/os au)lw=n Epic. ap. Plu.2.654f; te/ttic AP7.196 (Mel.); of the ears, h). a)kouh/ Parm.1.35; cf. h)xe/eis.

h)/x-hma, Dor. a)/x-, atos, to/,
sound, f.l. in Ph.1.444; melw|doi=s a)xh/masi prob.l.for i)ax-, E.IA1045 (lyr.).
h)xh=nes, oi(, = ptwxoi/, Hsch.; cf. a)xh/n.
h)x-hth/s, ou=, o(, = h)xe/ths, Hsch.

h)x-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
sounding, ringing, Diom.p.497 K., Simp.
in de An.142.17, al., Eust.918.19; gloss on bu/kths, EM216.50. Adv. -kw=s Hsch. s.v. kanaxhda/.
h)/xqeto, impf. of a)/xqomai. impf. Pass. of e)/xqw.

h(=xi (not h(=|xi), Ep. for h(=|, Adv.
where, Il.1.607, Call.Ap.91, etc.; h(=xi/ per, D.P.176,258; h(=xi/ te Id.67.

h)xiko/s, h/, o/n, （h)=xos） = h)xhtiko/s, of Alcaeus, h). *ai)oli/dhs, i.e.
singing in Aeolic, Epigr. ap. Sch.Pi.O.p.10D.
h(xoi=, Adv.,= h(=xi, IG7.235.16 (Oropus, iv B.C.).

h)xo/pous, o(, h(, poun, to/, gen. podos,= Lat.
sonipes, of horses, Eust. 918.20.

h)=xos, o(, later form of h)xh/, Arist.Aud.804a30, Theoc.27.57, Ep.Hebr.12.19, Ael.Tact.35.3, etc.; tetti/gwn ligu\n h)=. Call.Aet.Oxy. 2079.29 (h(=xon Pap.); paga=s Mosch.Fr.1.12; au)lou= Id.2.98; oi( tw=n prio/nwn h)=xoi A.D.Synt.290.24; of the
sound of words, opp. sense, Phld.Rh.2.258S.; h)=xoi kai\ yo/foi ib.1.150S.; th=s fwnh=s o( h)=. e)n tai=s a)koai=s parame/nei Luc.Nigr.7; gramma/twn Demetr.Eloc.71; h)=. e)n w)si/, or abs., h)=xoi, h)=xos,
ringing in the ears, Hp.Coac.189, 190, Prorrh.1.18, Thphr.Sens.19; h)=xoi w)/twn Aret.SA1.5.
echo, Arist.Pr.899b30. Gramm.,
breathing, h)=xoi o( me\n dasu/s, o( de\ yilo/s Demetr. Eloc.73.
voice, to\n h)=. eu)/tonon kai\ lampro\n a)potelei= Dsc.5.17. (h)=xos, to/, is found in LXXJe.28(51).16, dub. in Ev.Luc.21.25.)
h(xou=, Adv.,= h(=xi, prob. cj. in h.Merc.400.

h)xw/, Dor. a)xw/, h(, gen. h)xou=s, Dor. a)xw=s Mosch.Fr.2.1: acc. h)xw/, Dor. a)xw/ ib.3:—
echo, h.Hom.19.21, Hes.Sc.279,348, A.Pers.391, etc.: personified in Ar.Th.1059, Paus.2.35.10, Mosch.Fr.2, Orph. H.11.9. generally,
ringing sound, ktu/pou ga\r a)xw\ xa/lubos dih=|cen a)/ntrwn muxo/n A.Pr.133 (lyr.); h)xw\ profwnei=n to utter loud
cries, S.El.109 (anap.); h). xqo/nios E.Hipp.1201; h). barei=a prospo/lwn ib.791; o)rqi/a sa/lpiggos h). Id.Tr.1267; a(/pasan th\n *boiwti/hn katei=xe h). all Boeotia
rang with the noise of mourning, Hdt.9.24; voc. *)axoi= Rumour, Pi.O.14.21.

h)xw/dhs, es,
sonorous, of the hexameter, Demetr.Eloc.42. neut. pl. as Subst.,
ringing in the ears, Hp.Coac.163.
full of sounds, th=s h(me/ras -este/ra h( nu/c Plu.2.720c; to\ th=s nukto\s h). Id.Arat.22.
h)w/a: h( ke/dros, e)qnikw=s, Hsch. h)wh/mati: mia=| h(me/ra|, Id. (leg. i)w=| h)/mati).

h)w=qen, Dor. a)w=qen, Adv., (h)w/s)
from morn, i.e.
at dawn, at break of day, Il.11.555, 18.136, Od.1.372, etc.; h)w=qen ma/l' h)=ri 19.320; a)w=qen
qen a(/ma dro/sw| Theoc.15.132.
to-morrow morning, Od.15.506;
in the morning, A.R.4.1224.
h)w=qi, old Ep. loc. of h)w/s (q. v.).

h)w/koitos u(/pnos, o(,
morning-sleep, Hsch., Suid.
h)|w/n, o/nos, h(, contr. from h)i+w/n (q. v.).

h)w=|os, w/|a, w=|on,= h)oi=os,
at break of day, with Verbs, h). gegonw/s h.Merc.17; [te/ttic] h). xe/ei au)dh/n Hes.Sc.396, cf. Op.548; h)w=|oi e)/mellon . . qumo\n a)mu/cein Call.Aet.3.1.10; h). a)le/ktwr khru/sswn AP5.2 (Antip. Thess.): without Verbs, h). u(/pnos ib.7.726 (Leon.); a)sth/r A.R.1.1274.
eastern, *pe/rshs a)nh\r e)pa/gwn . . to\n h)w=|on strato/n Hdt.7.157; ei)s a(/la . . h)w/|hn A.R.2.745.

h)w/s, h(, gen. h)ou=s: dat. h)oi=: acc. (h)o/a A.D.Pron.88.5) h)w=, also h)ou=n Hedyl. ap. Ath.11.473a, AP7.472 (Leon.); Ep. loc. h)w=qi: never used (exc. by Gramm.) in the uncontr. forms, unless *)ao/os be read in Pi.N. 6.52:—Att. e(/ws, gen. and acc. e(/w: Dor. a)w/s, a)bw/r (qq. v.): Aeol. au)/ws Sapph.18, gen. au)/ws Epigr.Gr.992 (Balbilla), acc. au)/wn Sapph. Oxy.1787 Fr.1 + 2.18: Boeot. a)/as: e)s au)/rion, Hsch.:—

to-morrow, Theoc.18.14.
day, Il.1.493, al., Od.19.192, Theoc.12.1, Call.Aet.1.1.1; h). de/ moi/ e)stin h(/de duwdeka/th, o(/te. . Il.21.80; kath/i+en e)s du/sin h). Musae.110; mesa/th h). Orph.A.649.
life, Q.S.10.431; fw=s li/pes h)ou=s IG14.1853.
the East, pro\s h)w= t' h)e/lio/n te Il.12.239 (South acc. to Str.10.2.12); a)po\ h)ou=s pro\s e(spe/rhn Hdt.2.8; ta\ pro\s th\n h)w= ibid.; ta\ pro\s h)w= te kai\ h(/lion a)nate/llonta Id.4.40, cf. Pl.Lg.760d, etc.; pro\s e(/w th=s po/lews, tou= potamou=,
